src: Dann werdet ihr (noch) erfahren, wer die Leute des ebenen Weges sind und wer rechtgeleitet ist.
ref: You will come to know soon who are the men of the straight path and who have come to guidance.
draft: Then you will (still) find out who the people of the straight path are and who is rightly guided.
hil: Then you will (still) find out who the people of the straight path are and who is rightly guided.
compare: Then you will (still) find out who the people of the straight path are and who is rightly guided.

src: Bereits hast du unter uns Vertrauen vor dieser (Aufforderung) genossen.
ref: You seemed very promising among us, before this – What!
draft: Already you have enjoyed trust among us before this (request).
hil: Already you have enjoyed trust among us before this (request).
compare: Already you have enjoyed trust among us before this (request).

src: Soll ich etwa andere außer Ihm zu Göttern nehmen? Wenn der Allerbarmer mir ein Leid zufügen will, so wird ihre Fürsprache mir nichts nützen, noch können sie mich retten.
ref: Should I take other gods apart from Him, who would neither be able to intercede for me nor save me if Ar-Rahman brings me harm?
draft: Should I take others besides Him as gods? If the Most Merciful intends to harm me, their intercession will not benefit me and they cannot save me.
hil: I should take others as gods besides Him? If the Most Merciful intends to harm me, their intercession will not benefit me, nor can they save me.
compare: I should take others as gods besides Him? If the Most Merciful intends to harm me, their intercession will not benefit me, nor can they save me.

src: Noch werdet ihr verehren, was ich verehre.
ref: Nor will you worship who I worship:
draft: You will still worship what I worship.
hil: You will still worship what I worship.
compare: You will still worship what I worship.

src: Und sag zu den Mumin-Frauen, daß sie von ihren Blicken niederschlagen, ihre Keuschheit bewahren und ihren Schmuck nicht sichtbar tragen außer dem, was davon sichtbar wird, und daß sie ihre Khumur bis über ihre Dschuyub ziehen, und daß sie ihren Schmuck vor niemandem sichtbar tragen außer vor ihren Ehemännern, ihren Vätern, den Vätern ihrer Ehemänner, ihren Söhnen, den Söhnen ihrer Ehemänner, ihren Brüdern, den Söhnen ihrer Brüder, den Söhnen ihrer Schwestern, ihren Frauen, denjenigen, die ihr gehören, den Bediensteten außer denjenigen mit Verlangen von den Männern oder den Kindern, die noch nichts über die Blößen der Frauen wissen, und daß sie mit ihren Füßen nicht (auf den Boden) stampfen, damit bekannt wird, was sie noch von ihrem Schmuck verbergen. Und bittet ALLAH um Vergebung allesamt - ihr Mumin! - damit ihr erfolgreich werdet.
ref: And say to the believing women that they cast down their looks and guard their private parts and do not display their ornaments except what appears thereof, and let them wear their head-coverings over their bosoms, and not display their ornaments except to their husbands or their fathers, or the fathers of their husbands, or their sons, or the sons of their husbands, or their brothers, or their brothers' sons, or their sisters' sons, or their women, or those whom their right hands possess, or the male servants not having need (of women), or the children who have not attained knowledge of what is hidden of women; and let them not strike their feet so that what they hide of their ornaments may be known; and turn to Allah all of you, O believers! so that you may be successful.
draft: And say to the women of the Mumin that they should cast down their looks and guard their private parts and not display their ornaments except what is apparent, and that they should draw their veils over their bosoms. And they should not display their ornaments except to their husbands or their fathers, or the fathers of their husbands, or their sons or the sons of their husbands, or their brothers or the sons of their brothers, or the sons of their sisters, or their women, or their slaves, or male attendants who are beyond suspicion, or children who know nothing of women’s nakedness. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they hide of their adornment. And beg ALLAH to forgive you all, O believers, that you may be successful.
hil: Tell the believing women to lower their gaze and guard their private parts and not display their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to cover their bosoms with their veils and not to reveal their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you may succeed.
compare: And say to the women of the Mumin that they should cast down their looks and guard their private parts and not display their ornaments except what is apparent, and that they should draw their veils over their bosoms. And they should not display their ornaments except to their husbands or their fathers, or the fathers of their husbands, or their sons or the sons of their husbands, or their brothers or the sons of their brothers, or the sons of their sisters, or their women, or their slaves, or male attendants who are beyond suspicion, or children who know nothing of women’s nakedness. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they hide of their adornment. And beg ALLAH to forgive you all, O believers, that you may be successful.

src: Als dein HERR den Engeln Wahy zuteil werden ließ: "Gewiß, ICH bin mit euch, so festigt diejenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben.
ref: And the Lord said to the angels: "I am with you; go and strengthen the faithful.
draft: When your Lord gave the angels revelation: "I am with you, so strengthen those who have believed."
hil: When your Lord gave revelation to the angels, He said: "Surely, I am with you. So make strong those who have internalized faith."
compare: When your Lord gave revelation to the angels, He said: "Surely, I am with you. So make strong those who have internalized faith."

src: Ist der, der seinen Bau auf die Furcht Gottes und sein Wohlgefallen gegründet hat, besser oder der, der seinen Bau auf den Rand eines brüchigen Hanges gegründet hat, worauf er mit ihm ins Feuer der Hölle abstürzt?
ref: Is the man who lays the foundations of his sanctum on his allegiance to God and the wish to seek His favour, better, or he who lays the foundations of his building on the edge of a bank eroded by water, which will collapse with him into the fire of Hell?
draft: Is the one who has founded his building on the fear of God and His approval better or the one who has founded his building on the edge of a crumbling cliff, whereby it falls with him into Hell's fire?
hil: The one who has founded the building on the fear of God and His good pleasure, is he better or the one who has founded the building on the edge of a crumbling cliff, whereby it falls with him into Hell's fire?
compare: Is the one who has founded his building on the fear of God and His approval better or the one who has founded his building on the edge of a crumbling cliff, whereby it falls with him into Hell's fire?

src: Und (erinnere daran), als 'Isa Ibnu-Maryam sagte: "Kinder Israil! Gewiß, ich bin ALLAHs Gesandter zu euch bestätigend dessen, was vor mir von At-taurat war, und überbringend eine frohe Botschaft von einem Gesandten, der nach mir kommt, dessen Name Ahmad (Gelobter) ist." Und als er zu ihnen mit den klaren Zeichen kam, sagten sie: "Dies ist eine eindeutige Magie."
ref: And when (Prophet) Jesus, the son of Mary said: 'Children of Israel, I am sent to you by Allah to confirm the Torah that was before me, and to give news of a Messenger (Prophet Muhammad) who will come after me whose name shall be Ahmad' Yet when he came to them with clear proofs, they said: 'This is clearsorcery'
draft: And (remember) when 'Isa Ibnu-Maryam said: "O Children of Israel! I am Allah's Messenger to you, confirming the Taurat (Torah) which came before me, and giving glad tidings of a Messenger to come after me, whose name shall be Ahmad. But when he (Ahmad i.e. Muhammad SAW) came to them with clear proofs, they said: "This is plain magic."
hil: And (remember) when Isa Ibnu-Maryam said: "O Children of Israel! I am the Messenger of God to you, confirming the Torah which came before me and bringing good news of a Messenger who will come after me, whose name is Ahmad (the Praised One)." And when he came to them with clear signs, they said, "This is obvious magic."
compare: And (remember) when Isa Ibnu-Maryam said: "O Children of Israel! I am the Messenger of God to you, confirming the Torah which came before me and bringing good news of a Messenger who will come after me, whose name is Ahmad (the Praised One)." And when he came to them with clear signs, they said, "This is obvious magic."

src: Gewiß, Qarun gehörte zum Volk Musas, doch unterdrückte er sie. Und Wir gaben ihm solche Schätze, daß deren Schlüssel wahrlich eine schwere Last für eine (ganze) Schar kräftiger Männer gewesen wären. Als sein Volk zu ihm sagte: "Sei nicht (übermütig) froh, denn Allah liebt nicht diejenigen (Unterdrücker), die (zu übermütig) froh sind,
ref: Indeed Qaroon was from the people of Moosa – he then oppressed them; and We gave him so many treasures that their keys were a heavy burden for a strong group; when his people said to him, “Do not show off – indeed Allah does not like the boastful.”
draft: Certainly, Qarun belonged to the people of Moses, but he oppressed them. And We gave him such treasures that the keys to them would have been a heavy burden for a group of strong men. When his people said to him, "Do not be too happy, for Allah does not love those who oppress and are too happy.
hil: Indeed, Qarun belonged to the people of Moses, but he oppressed them. And We gave him such treasures that the keys to them would have been a heavy burden even for a group of strong men. When his people said to him, "Do not be too happy, for Allah does not love those who oppress and are too happy."
compare: Indeed, Qarun belonged to the people of Moses, but he oppressed them. And We gave him such treasures that the keys to them would have been a heavy burden even for a group of strong men. When his people said to him, "Do not be too happy, for Allah does not love those who oppress and are too happy."

src: Und unter ihnen gibt es manche, die auf dich schauen. Kannst du aber die Blinden rechtleiten, auch wenn sie nicht sehen?
ref: Some of them look toward you: But can you show the blind the way even when they cannot see?
draft: And among them there are some who look to you. But can you guide the blind, even if they cannot see?
hil: And among them are some who look to you. But can you guide the blind even if they cannot see?
compare: And among them there are some who look to you. But can you guide the blind, even if they cannot see?

src: Doch wer mit der gottmißfälligen Tat kommt, so wird denjenigen, welche die gottmißfälligen Taten begingen, nichts außer dem vergolten, was sie zu tun pflegten.
ref: But whoever brings evil—the evildoers will be rewarded only according to what they used to do.
draft: But whoever comes with the displeasing act, then those who committed the displeasing acts will be repaid with nothing but what they used to do.
hil: Whoever comes with the displeasing act, will be rewarded only with what they used to do, for those who committed the displeasing acts.
compare: But whoever comes with the displeasing act, then those who committed the displeasing acts will be repaid with nothing but what they used to do.

src: Er sagte: "Ich will dich mit einer dieser meiner beiden Töchter verheiraten unter der Bedingung, daß du acht Jahre in meinen Dienst trittst. Wenn du sie aber auf zehn vollmachst, so steht es bei dir.
ref: He said: "I intend to wed one of these two daughters of mine to you, on condition that you serve me for eight years, but if you complete ten years, it will be (a favour) from you.
draft: He said, "I want to marry you with one of my two daughters on the condition that you serve me for eight years. But if you complete ten, it's up to you."
hil: He said, "I want to marry you to one of my two daughters on the condition that you enter my service for eight years. But if you complete ten, it's up to you."
compare: He said, "I want to marry you to one of my two daughters on the condition that you enter my service for eight years. But if you complete ten, it's up to you."

src: Seid ihr dann dankbar?!
ref: Will you not be grateful even then?
draft: Are you grateful then?!
hil: Are you then grateful?!
compare: Are you grateful then?!

src: Dies ist gerechter vor ALLAH, glaubwürdiger für das Zeugnis und näher dazu, keine Zweifel zu hegen.
ref: Do not neglect to reduce to writing your transaction for a specified term, whether it be big or small.
draft: This is more just in the sight of Allah and closer to being reliable evidence and less likely to cause doubt.
hil: This is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger evidence and closer to avoiding doubt.
compare: This is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger evidence and closer to avoiding doubt.

src: ER ist Der Allwissende vom Verborgenen.
ref: (He is) the Knower of the Unseen.
draft: He is the Omniscient of the Hidden.
hil: HE is the Omniscient of the Hidden.
compare: He is the Omniscient of the Hidden.

src: Und denen, die das Gebet verrichten und die Abgabe entrichten und an Gott und den Jüngsten Tag glauben, denen werden Wir einen großartigen Lohn zukommen lassen.
ref: (Those who truly believe) establish the Prayer and pay Zakah, those who firmly believe in Allah and in the Last Day, to them We shall indeed pay a great reward.
draft: And those who perform the prayer and give the alms and believe in God and the Last Day - to them We will give a great reward.
hil: To those who establish prayer, give Zakat, and believe in Allah and the Last Day, We shall grant them a great reward.
compare: And those who perform the prayer and give the alms and believe in God and the Last Day - to them We will give a great reward.

src: Kämpft nicht gegen sie bei der heiligen Moschee, bis sie dort gegen euch kämpfen.
ref: Do not fight them by the Holy Mosque unless they fight you there.
draft: Do not fight against them at the Holy Mosque unless they fight against you there.
hil: Do not fight against them at the Holy Mosque unless they fight against you there.
compare: Do not fight against them at the Holy Mosque unless they fight against you there.

src: Das Versprechen unseres HERRN wird gewiß erfüllt."
ref: The promise of our Lord has indeed been fulfilled."
draft: "The promise of our Lord will certainly be fulfilled."
hil: The promise of our Lord will certainly be fulfilled.
compare: "The promise of our Lord will certainly be fulfilled."

src: Sprich: "Doch! Die Religion Abrahams, der rechtgläubig war und nicht den Götzenanbetern angehörte."
ref: Say thou: 'Nay, rather the creed of Abraham, a man of pure faith; he was no idolater.'
draft: Speak: "Yes! The religion of Abraham, who was righteous and did not belong to the idolaters."
hil: Say: We follow the way of Abraham, who was not an idolater. Wait, we too are waiting.
compare: Speak: "Yes! The religion of Abraham, who was righteous and did not belong to the idolaters."

src: Und die Gesandten waren wahrhaftig."
ref: The Messengers have also spoke the truth".
draft: "And the emissaries were truthful."
hil: "Indeed, the emissaries were truthful."
compare: "Indeed, the emissaries were truthful."

src: Allah weiß über alles Bescheid.
ref: Surely God has knowledge of everything.
draft: Allah knows about everything.
hil: Allah knows about everything.
compare: Allah knows about everything.

src: Haben sie etwa über das Vorgetragene nicht nachgedacht?! Oder kam etwa zu ihnen das, was zu ihren ersten Ahnen nicht kam?!
ref: Have they not pondered the matter, or did that come to them, which did not come to their forefathers?
draft: Did you not think about what was presented? Or did what did not come to your first ancestors come to you?
hil: Have they not thought about what was presented? Or has what did not come to their first ancestors come to them?
compare: Have they not thought about what was presented? Or has what did not come to their first ancestors come to them?

src: Doch wenn ihr euch abkehrt, so habe ich von euch keinen Lohn verlangt.
ref: If you turn away from me (remember) I do not ask any recompense from you.
draft: But if you turn away, I have not asked you for any reward.
hil: If you turn away, I have not asked you for any reward.
compare: But if you turn away, I have not asked you for any reward.

src: Auf Ihn allein ist das Wissen um die Stunde zurückzuführen.
ref: To Him is referred the knowledge of the Hour.
draft: "The knowledge of the hour can only be traced back to him alone."
hil: "The knowledge of the Hour can be attributed to Him alone."
compare: "The knowledge of the Hour can be attributed to Him alone."

src: Sag: "Gewiß, ALLAH ist immer im Stande, eine Aya nach und nach hinabzusenden." Doch die meisten von ihnen wissen es nicht.
ref: Say: "God certainly has power to send down a miracle; but most men cannot understand."
draft: Say: "Indeed, ALLAH is always capable of sending down a Surah gradually." But most of them do not know.
hil: Say: "Indeed, Allah is capable of sending down revelations gradually." But most of them do not know.
compare: Say: "Indeed, Allah is capable of sending down revelations gradually." But most of them do not know.

src: Und Allah liebt die Gutes Tuenden
ref: God loves the doers of good.
draft: And Allah loves those who do good deeds.
hil: And Allah loves those who do good deeds.
compare: And Allah loves those who do good deeds.

src: Sag: "Betreibt ihr etwa Kufr Demjenigen gegenüber, Der die Erde in zwei Ayyam erschuf, und setzt ihr Ihm etwas als Ebenbürtiges bei?!
ref: Say “What! You disbelieve in Him Who created the earth in two days, and you appoint equals to Him?
draft: Say: "Do you practice Kufr (unbelief) towards Him Who created the earth in two Days and do you set up equals with Him?"
hil: Say: 'Do you practice Kufr towards Him Who created the earth in two Days and do you set up equals with Him?'
compare: Say: "Do you practice Kufr (unbelief) towards Him Who created the earth in two Days and do you set up equals with Him?"

src: Und wenn ihr euch geduldig zeigt, so ist es besser für die Geduldigen.
ref: But if you endure patiently, verily, it is better for As-Sabirin (the patient ones, etc.).
draft: "And if you show patience, it is better for the patient ones."
hil: Indeed, it is better for the patient ones if you show patience.
compare: Indeed, it is better for the patient ones if you show patience.

src: Jedoch sie besitzen darüber kein Wissen; sie vermuten es nur.
ref: Yet they have no knowledge of this: They only speculate.
draft: However, they have no knowledge about it; they just speculate.
hil: They have no knowledge about it; they just assume it.
compare: They have no knowledge about it; they just assume it.

src: "Wem gehört die Herrschaft heute?!" (Sie gehört) ALLAH, Dem Einzigen, Dem Allbezwingenden.
ref: Whose then will be the kingdom? -- God's, the one, the omnipotent.
draft: "To whom does the rule belong today?!" (It belongs to) ALLAH, The Only One, The Almighty.
hil: "To whom does the rule belong today?!" (It belongs to) ALLAH, The Only One, The Almighty.
compare: "To whom does the rule belong today?!" (It belongs to) ALLAH, The Only One, The Almighty.

src: Sie sagen: "Wäre ihm von seinem Herrn ein Zeichen niedergesandt worden!" Sprich: "Allah hat die Macht, ein Zeichen herabzusenden, doch die meisten von ihnen wissen es nicht!"
ref: They ask: 'Why has no sign been sent down to him from his Lord' Say: 'Allah is Able to send down a sign' But most of them do not know.
draft: They say, "If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!" Say, "Allah has the power to send down a sign, but most of them do not know."
hil: They say, "If a sign had been sent down to him from his Lord!" Say, "Allah has the power to send down a sign, but most of them do not know it!"
compare: They say, "If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!" Say, "Allah has the power to send down a sign, but most of them do not know."

src: - vollendete Weisheit; allein selbst die Warnungen richteten (bei ihnen) nichts aus
ref: Containing consummate wisdom; yet warnings were of no avail.
draft: "consummate wisdom; only the warnings themselves did not accomplish anything (among them)".
hil: The consummate wisdom; only the warnings themselves did not accomplish anything (among them).
compare: "consummate wisdom; only the warnings themselves did not accomplish anything (among them)".

src: Ihr laßt euch wenig ermahnen.
ref: Yet little do you care to remember.
draft: You don't let yourselves be admonished much.
hil: You do not take much admonition.
compare: You don't let yourselves be admonished much.

src: Und (du wirst Erstaunliches erleben), würdest du nur sehen, als sie sich erschreckten. Dann gibt es kein Entkommen.
ref: And if only you see, when they will be forced into a terror from which they will be unable to escape, and are seized from a place nearby.
draft: And (you will experience amazing things), if only you could see them getting frightened. Then there's no escape.
hil: And (you will experience amazing things), if only you could see them getting frightened. Then there's no escape.
compare: And (you will experience amazing things), if only you could see them getting frightened. Then there's no escape.

src: So lasse die Kinder Isra'ils mit mir gehen!"
ref: So let the Children of Israel depart along with me."
draft: "So let the Children of Israel go with me!"
hil: Let the Children of Israel go with me!
compare: "So let the Children of Israel go with me!"

src: Und ohne die Huld Allahs gegen euch und Seine Barmherzigkeit würde niemand von euch jemals lauter sein. Allah aber läutert, wen Er will.
ref: But for the grace of God and His mercy upon you none of you would have escaped undefiled; but God makes whosoever He will grow in goodness, for God is all-hearing and all-knowing.
draft: And without the grace of Allah towards you and His mercy, none of you would ever be pure. But Allah purifies whom He wills.
hil: And were it not for Allah's grace upon you and His mercy, none of you would ever be pure. But Allah purifies whom He wills.
compare: And without the grace of Allah towards you and His mercy, none of you would ever be pure. But Allah purifies whom He wills.

src: Und wie hörend!
ref: How well He hears!
draft: And how listening!
hil: And like attentive listening!
compare: And like attentive listening!

src: Sag: "Ihr Schriftbesitzer! Kommt zu einem Wort, das gleichermaßen für euch und uns gilt, daß wir nur ALLAH dienen und Ihm gegenüber mit Nichts Schirk praktizieren, und daß die einen von uns sich die anderen nicht als Herren anstelle von ALLAH nehmen."
ref: Tell them: "O people of the Book, let us come to an agreement on that which is common between us, that we worship no one but God, and make none His compeer, and that none of us take any others for lord apart from God."
draft: Say: "O owners of scripture! Come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except Allah and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of Allah ."
hil: Say, "O People of the Book, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will worship none but Allah, and that we will associate no partners with Him, and that none of us takes others as lords beside Allah."
compare: Say, "O People of the Book, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will worship none but Allah, and that we will associate no partners with Him, and that none of us takes others as lords beside Allah."

src: Das sind die Gefährten des Feuers; darin werden sie ewig weilen.
ref: They are the people of Hell, where they will abide for ever,
draft: These are the companions of fire; therein they will dwell forever.
hil: They are the companions of the fire; therein they will dwell forever.
compare: They are the companions of the fire; therein they will dwell forever.

src: Allah sieht wohl, was sie tun.
ref: God sees the things they do.
draft: Allah sees well what they do.
hil: Allah sees well what they do.
compare: Allah sees well what they do.

src: Und ob ihr das, was in eurem Inneren ist, offenlegt oder geheimhaltet, Gott rechnet mit euch darüber ab.
ref: Whether you publish what is in your hearts or hide it, God shall make reckoning with you for it.
draft: And whether you reveal or conceal what is within you, God will call you to account for it.
hil: And whether you disclose or keep hidden what is in your hearts, God will call you to account for it.
compare: And whether you reveal or conceal what is within you, God will call you to account for it.

src: Und sollten sie dich um Erlaubnis wegen mancher privaten Angelegenheiten bitten, dann gewähre Erlaubnis demjenigen von ihnen, dem du willst, und bitte ALLAH für sie um Vergebung.
ref: Surely those who ask leave of you are the ones who believe in God and His Apostle. Therefore when they ask leave of you for personal business give leave to those you please, and seek God's forgiveness for them.
draft: And if they ask you for permission regarding some private matters, then grant permission to the one among them whom you will, and ask Allah for forgiveness for them.
hil: If they ask you for permission regarding some private matters, then grant permission to the one among them whom you will, and ask Allah for forgiveness for them.
compare: And if they ask you for permission regarding some private matters, then grant permission to the one among them whom you will, and ask Allah for forgiveness for them.

src: Das ist ein Tag, an dem die Menschen versammelt werden, und das ist ein Tag, den jeder erleben wird.
ref: That is a Day whereon mankind shall be gathered together, and that is a Day to be witnessed.
draft: This is a day when people will be gathered, and this is a day that everyone will experience.
hil: That is a day on which people will be assembled, and that is a day that everyone will experience.
compare: That is a day on which people will be assembled, and that is a day that everyone will experience.

src: Diese haben uns irregeleitet, so laß ihnen das Doppelte an Peinigung des Feuers zuteil werden!"
ref: These misled us, so give them a double torment of the Fire."
draft: "These have misguided us, so let them receive twice the punishment of fire!"
hil: And they have misguided us, so let the punishment of fire be doubled for them!
compare: "These have misguided us, so let them receive twice the punishment of fire!"

src: Dann werden sie zu Allah, ihrem Herrn, zurückgebracht. Wahrlich, Sein ist das Urteil, und Er ist der Schnellste im Rechnen.
ref: Then are they sent back to Allah, their Master, the True one; now surely His is the judgment and He is swiftest in taking account.
draft: Then they will be brought back to Allah, their Lord. Truly, His is the judgment, and He is the Swiftest in taking account.
hil: They will then be brought back to Allah, their Lord. Truly, His is the judgement, and He is the Swiftest in taking account.
compare: Then they will be brought back to Allah, their Lord. Truly, His is the judgment, and He is the Swiftest in taking account.

src: Doch wenn die einen von ihnen sich mit den anderen zurückzogen, sagten sie: "Erzählt ihr ihnen von dem, was ALLAH euch erläuterte, damit sie mit diesem gegen euch vor eurem HERRN argumentieren?
ref: But when they go apart one with another they say: Prate ye to them of that which Allah hath disclosed to you that they may contend with you before your Lord concerning it?
draft: But when some of them withdrew to others, they said, "Do you inform them of what Allah has revealed to you so they can argue against you before your Lord?"
hil: If some of them turn aside from others, they would ask them, 'Have you informed them of what Allah has revealed to you so they can argue against you with it before your Lord? Do you not understand?'
compare: But when some of them withdrew to others, they said, "Do you inform them of what Allah has revealed to you so they can argue against you before your Lord?"

src: Und Mose sagte: «Ich suche Zuflucht bei meinem Herrn und eurem Herrn vor jedem Hochmütigen, der nicht an den Tag der Abrechnung glaubt.»
ref: Moses said: "I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every insolent imposter who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."
draft: "And Moses said, 'I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.'"
hil: And Moses said, 'I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.'
compare: "And Moses said, 'I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.'"

src: Gewiß, sie fanden ihre Ahnen abirrend vor,
ref: They had found their fathers astray,
draft: Certainly, they found their ancestors wandering.
hil: Indeed, they found their ancestors wandering.
compare: Certainly, they found their ancestors wandering.

src: Nein, mit Sicherheit!
ref: By no means! Aye!
draft: No, for sure!
hil: No, for sure!
compare: No, for sure!

src: Aber nein! Diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, sind dem Leugnen (der Botschaft) verhaftet.
ref: Yet the infidels persist in denial.
draft: But no! Those who are unbelievers are attached to the denial (of the message).
hil: Indeed, the unbelievers disavow, for they are attached to the denial (of the message).
compare: Indeed, the unbelievers disavow, for they are attached to the denial (of the message).

src: "Und gewiß, wir wissen nicht, ob Böses für diejenigen auf der Erde gewollt wird, oder ob ihr HERR für sie Gutes wollte."
ref: We do not know if this means ill for the dwellers of the earth, or their Lord wishes guidance for them.
draft: "And certainly, we do not know whether evil is intended for those on earth, or whether their LORD intended good for them."
hil: We surely do not know whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intended good for them.
compare: "And certainly, we do not know whether evil is intended for those on earth, or whether their LORD intended good for them."

src: Und Wir haben euch ja erschaffen. Hierauf haben Wir euch gestaltet.
ref: And We have certainly created you, [O Mankind], and given you [human] form.
draft: And We have created you. Thereafter, We have fashioned you.
hil: And We have indeed created you. Then We fashioned you.
compare: And We have created you. Thereafter, We have fashioned you.

src: Und tötet eure Kinder nicht aus Furcht vor Armut; Wir sorgen für sie und für euch. Wahrlich, sie zu töten ist ein großer Fehler.
ref: And do not kill your children, fearing poverty; We shall provide sustenance to them as well as to you; indeed killing them is a great mistake.
draft: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty; We provide for them and for you. Truly, killing them is a great mistake.
hil: Do not kill your children, fearing poverty; we shall provide sustenance for them as well as for you. Killing them is certainly a heinous sin.
compare: Do not kill your children, fearing poverty; we shall provide sustenance for them as well as for you. Killing them is certainly a heinous sin.

src: Doch wenn ihr sie verbergt und den Bedürftigen zukommen lasst, dann ist dies besser für euch.
ref: But if you keep it secret, and give it to the needy in private, that is better for you.
draft: But if you hide them and give them to the needy, then that is better for you.
hil: And if you keep them hidden and give them to the needy, then that is better for you.
compare: And if you keep them hidden and give them to the needy, then that is better for you.

src: Er sagte: "Ich bin eurer Tat gegenüber von den Verabscheuenden.
ref: (Lot) said: "I am disgusted with your actions,"
draft: He said, "I am disgusted by your act."
hil: He said: 'I am disgusted by your act.'
compare: He said, "I am disgusted by your act."

src: Gewiß, bereits haben WIR Nuh zu seinen Leuten entsandt, dann sagte er: "Meine Leute! Dient ALLAH!
ref: Indeed We sent Nooh to his people – he therefore said, “O my people!
draft: Certainly, we have already sent Nuh to his people, then he said: "My people! Serve Allah!
hil: Certainly, We have already sent Nuh to his people, then he said: 'My people! Serve Allah!'
compare: Certainly, we have already sent Nuh to his people, then he said: "My people! Serve Allah!

src: Dieser Koran ist mir offenbart, damit ich euch und auch jeden, den er erreicht, durch ihn warne.
ref: This Quran was revealed to me, that I may warn you with it, and whomever it may reach.
draft: This Quran has been revealed to me so that I may warn you and everyone it reaches.
hil: The Quran has been revealed to me to warn you and everyone who receives it.
compare: This Quran has been revealed to me so that I may warn you and everyone it reaches.

src: Fühlen sie sich etwa sicher vor ALLAHs Versuchung?!
ref: Can they remain secure against the plan of God?
draft: Do you feel safe from Allah's temptation?!
hil: Do you feel safe from Allah's temptation?
compare: Do you feel safe from Allah's temptation?!

src: Du bist doch nur ein Warner für denjenigen, der vor ihr Ehrfurcht hat.
ref: Your duty is only to warn him who fears it.
draft: You are just a warning for those who have awe of her.
hil: You are only a warner for those who have awe of her.
compare: You are only a warner for those who have awe of her.

src: Wer aber von euch danach Kufr betreibt, den werde ICH doch mit einer Peinigung peinigen, mit der ICH sonst keinen anderen der Menschen peinigen werde."
ref: But whoever among you disbelieves thereafter, I will punish him with a punishment the like of which I never punish any other being.”
draft: "But whoever among you commits Kufr thereafter, I will surely punish him with a punishment that I have not inflicted on anyone among the people."
hil: But whoever among you commits Kufr thereafter, I will surely punish him with a punishment that I have not inflicted on anyone else among the people.
compare: But whoever among you commits Kufr thereafter, I will surely punish him with a punishment that I have not inflicted on anyone else among the people.

src: Er kennt euren Zustand wohl.
ref: He knows what you are about.
draft: He probably knows your condition.
hil: He certainly knows your condition.
compare: He certainly knows your condition.

src: ER sagte: "Mein Untergang!
ref: He said, 'Woe is me!
draft: He said, "My downfall!"
hil: He said, "My downfall!"
compare: He said, "My downfall!"

src: Und fürchtet das Feuer, das für die Ungläubigen vorbereitet ist
ref: Keep away from the Fire prepared for the infidels;
draft: And fear the fire that is prepared for the unbelievers.
hil: And fear the fire that is prepared for the unbelievers.
compare: And fear the fire that is prepared for the unbelievers.

src: Diejenigen aber, die ungläubig sind und Unsere Zeichen leugnen, sollen die Bewohner des Feuers sein. Darin bleiben sie auf ewig; und das ist eine schlimme Bestimmung!
ref: Those who did not believe and denied Our revelations will be inmates of Hell, where they will abide for ever, and how evil a journey's end!
draft: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, therein to abide forever. And that is a terrible destiny.
hil: Those who disbelieve and deny Our signs shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, wherein they will abide forever. And that is a terrible destiny.
compare: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, therein to abide forever. And that is a terrible destiny.

src: Gepriesen sei Er! Nein, aber sie sind (nur) geehrte Diener
ref: Hallowed be He! aye! they are bondmen honoured.
draft: "Praised be He! No, but they are (only) honored servants."
hil: Praised be He! No, but they are (only) honored servants.
compare: "Praised be He! No, but they are (only) honored servants."

src: Als er zu seinem Volk sagte: "Ihr begeht fürwahr das Abscheuliche, wie es vor euch niemand von den Weltenbewohnern getan hat.
ref: (Remember) when he said unto his folk: Lo! ye commit lewdness such as no creature did before you.
draft: When he said to his people, "You are truly committing the abominable, as no inhabitant of the worlds before you has done.
hil: He said to his people, "Truly, you commit the abominable, which no inhabitant of the worlds before you has ever done."
compare: He said to his people, "Truly, you commit the abominable, which no inhabitant of the worlds before you has ever done."

src: Es gibt keinen Gott außer Ihm, dem Allmächtigen und Allweisen.
ref: There is no god but He, the all-mighty and all-wise.
draft: There is no god but Him, the Almighty and All-Wise.
hil: There is no god but Him, the Almighty and All-Wise.
compare: There is no god but Him, the Almighty and All-Wise.

src: Ihnen aber steht es nicht zu, zu wählen.
ref: The good is not for them to choose.
draft: But you are not entitled to vote.
hil: You, however, are not entitled to choose.
compare: But you are not entitled to vote.

src: Er spricht: "lhr verweiltet nur kurze Zeit, wenn ihr es nur wüßtet!
ref: He will say: "You stayed there only a moment, if you knew.
draft: He says, "You only stay for a short time, if only you knew!"
hil: He says, "You only stay for a short time, if only you knew!"
compare: He says, "You only stay for a short time, if only you knew!"

src: Oder haben sie ihren Gesandten nicht erkannt, so daß sie ihn (nun) verwerfen?
ref: Or did they not recognise their apostle, and rejected him?
draft: Or have they not recognized their messenger, so they reject him now?
hil: Or have they not recognized their messenger, so they reject him now?
compare: Or have they not recognized their messenger, so they reject him now?

src: Und eine bestimmte Frist ist bei Ihm festgesetzt.
ref: A term is fixed with Him.
draft: And a certain deadline is set for him.
hil: And a specific term has been appointed for Him.
compare: And a specific term has been appointed for Him.

src: Und sie erlernten, was ihnen schadet und nicht nützt. Und sie wußten doch, daß, wer es erkaufte, am Jenseits wahrlich keinen Anteil hätte.
ref: They knew indeed whoever bought this had no place in the world to come, and that surely they had sold themselves for something that was vile.
draft: And they learned what harms them and does not benefit them. And they knew that whoever bought it would surely have no share in the hereafter.
hil: They learned what harms them and does not benefit them, and knew that whoever purchased it had no share in the hereafter.
compare: And they learned what harms them and does not benefit them. And they knew that whoever bought it would surely have no share in the hereafter.

src: Sie bieten den Frieden an: «Wir pflegten nichts Böses zu tun.» - «Doch, Gott weiß Bescheid über das, was ihr zu tun pflegtet.
ref: Then they will offer surrender: 'We were doing nothing evil. 'Nay; but surety God has knowledge of the things you did.
draft: They offer peace: "We didn't used to do anything bad." - "But God knows what you used to do."
hil: They offer peace: 'We didn't used to do anything bad.' - 'But God knows what you used to do.'
compare: They offer peace: "We didn't used to do anything bad." - "But God knows what you used to do."

src: Und vor dem Unheil eines Neiders, wenn er neidisch ist.
ref: From the evil of the envier when he envies.
draft: And before the misfortune of an envious person, when he is envious.
hil: And before the harm of an envier who is envious.
compare: And before the harm of an envier who is envious.

src: Und diejenigen, die Kufr betrieben haben, wurden nach Dschahannam in Gruppen getrieben.
ref: Those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in throngs.
draft: And those who practised disbelief were driven in groups towards Jahannam.
hil: And those who practised disbelief were driven in groups towards Jahannam.
compare: And those who practised disbelief were driven in groups towards Jahannam.

src: Er kennt sehr wohl die Rechtgeleiteten.
ref: He knows best who will come to guidance.
draft: He knows very well the guided ones.
hil: He knows the guided ones very well.
compare: He knows the guided ones very well.

src: Oder fühlen sich etwa die Bewohner der Ortschaften davor sicher, daß Unsere Peinigung sie morgens überkommt, während sie sich vergnügen?!
ref: Or, are the people of the towns so unafraid that (even when) Our retribution comes upon them in the hours of the morning they remain engrossed in sport and play?
draft: Or do the inhabitants of the villages feel safe before our punishment comes upon them in the morning while they are enjoying themselves?!
hil: Or do the inhabitants of the towns really feel safe before Our punishment comes upon them in the morning while they are still amusing themselves?!
compare: Or do the inhabitants of the towns really feel safe before Our punishment comes upon them in the morning while they are still amusing themselves?!

src: Bestimmt nicht! WIR werden registrieren lassen, was er sagt, und werden ihm noch viel mehr von der Peinigung zuteilen lassen.
ref: Never; We shall now record what he says and give him a prolonged punishment.
draft: Definitely not! WE will register what he says and we will let him suffer much more.
hil: Definitely not! WE will register what he says and subject him to much more torment.
compare: Definitely not! WE will register what he says and subject him to much more torment.

src: Sie machten für ihn, was er begehrte: Paläste und Bildwerke, Becken wie Teiche und feststehende Kochbottiche: "Wirkt ihr vom Hause Davids in Dankbarkeit."
ref: They made for him whatever he wished, synagogues and statues, dishes large as water-troughs, and cauldrons firmly fixed (on ovens; and We said): "O House of David, act, and give thanks."
draft: They made for him what he desired: palaces and statues, basins like ponds and fixed boiling vats: "Work with gratitude, you of the House of David."
hil: They did for him what he desired: palaces and statues, basins like ponds and fixed boiling vats: "Work with gratitude, you of the House of David."
compare: They did for him what he desired: palaces and statues, basins like ponds and fixed boiling vats: "Work with gratitude, you of the House of David."

src: Wollt ihr ihn etwa ableugnen?!
ref: Will you then deny it?
draft: Do you want to deny him?!
hil: Do you really want to deny him?
compare: Do you really want to deny him?

src: Und richte nicht an das Bittgebete anstelle von ALLAH, was dir weder nutzt noch schadet.
ref: And do not call, apart from God, on what neither benefits you nor harms you.
draft: And do not address prayer to anyone besides Allah, for it neither profits you nor harms you.
hil: And do not direct your supplications to anyone other than Allah, for it neither benefits you nor harms you.
compare: And do not address prayer to anyone besides Allah, for it neither profits you nor harms you.

src: Und Wir riefen ihn von der rechten Seite des Berges und ließen ihn zu vertraulichem Gespräch nähertreten.
ref: We called him from the right side of the Mount, and brought him close for communion;
draft: And we called him from the right side of the mountain and allowed him to approach for confidential conversation.
hil: And We called him from the right side of the mountain and allowed him to approach for confidential conversation.
compare: And we called him from the right side of the mountain and allowed him to approach for confidential conversation.

src: Er ißt von dem, was ihr esset, und trinkt von dem, was ihr trinkt.
ref: He eats as you do, and drinks as you drink.
draft: He eats of what you eat, and drinks of what you drink.
hil: He eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.
compare: He eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.

src: Sie sagten: "O Wehe uns!
ref: They said, 'Alas for us!
draft: They said, "Oh woe to us!"
hil: They said, 'Oh woe to us!'
compare: They said, "Oh woe to us!"

src: Als er ein Feuer sah, sagte er zu seinen Angehörigen: "Bleibt (hier), ich habe ein Feuer wahrgenommen; vielleicht kann ich euch ein Stück Glut davon bringen oder den rechten Weg am Feuer finden.
ref: I have seen a fire. I may haply be able to bring an ember from it, or find direction by the fire."
draft: When he saw a fire, he said to his relatives: "Stay here, I noticed a fire; maybe I can bring you a piece of coal from it or find the right way by the fire."
hil: When he saw a fire, he said to his relatives: 'Stay here, I have noticed a fire; maybe I can bring you a piece of coal from it or find the right way by the fire.'
compare: When he saw a fire, he said to his relatives: "Stay here, I noticed a fire; maybe I can bring you a piece of coal from it or find the right way by the fire."

src: Ihre Spenden werden nur deshalb nicht angenommen, weil sie nicht an Allah und an Seinen Gesandten glauben und nur träge zum Gebet kommen und ihre Spenden nur widerwillig geben.
ref: Nothing prevents the acceptance of what they spend except that they do not believe in God and His Apostle, and come to worship but languidly and spend only grudgingly.
draft: Your donations are only not accepted because you do not believe in Allah and His Messenger and only come to prayer sluggishly and give your donations unwillingly.
hil: Their donations are only declined because they do not believe in Allah and His messenger, and they are lazy to come for prayer and give their donations reluctantly.
compare: Your donations are only not accepted because you do not believe in Allah and His Messenger and only come to prayer sluggishly and give your donations unwillingly.

src: Dann habe Ich sie ergriffen.
ref: Then (in the end) I seized it (with punishment).
draft: Then I grabbed her.
hil: Then I grabbed her.
compare: Then I grabbed her.

src: Wenn ihr ungläubig seid, so ist Allah eurer unbedürftig, obgleich Er mit dem Unglauben für Seine Diener nicht zufrieden ist. Wenn ihr aber dankbar seid, ist Er damit zufrieden für euch.
ref: If you are ungrateful, then remember! God is independent of you, and He does not favour ingratitude on the part of His creatures.
draft: If you are unbelieving, Allah is independent of you, although He is not satisfied with disbelief for His servants. But if you are grateful, He is pleased with you.
hil: O you who believe, if you are disbelieving, Allah is not in need of you, although He does not approve disbelief for His servants. And if you are grateful, He approves it for you.
compare: O you who believe, if you are disbelieving, Allah is not in need of you, although He does not approve disbelief for His servants. And if you are grateful, He approves it for you.

src: Hinter ihnen ist eine Schranke bis zu dem Tag, da sie auferweckt werden.
ref: Behind them lies the intervening barrier (stretching) to the day of their resurrection.
draft: Behind them is a barrier until the day they are awakened.
hil: Behind them is a barrier until the day they are resurrected.
compare: Behind them is a barrier until the day they are resurrected.

src: Dem, der sich hochmütig von Allahs Weg abwendet, ist Schande im Diesseits bestimmt; und am Tage der Auferstehung werden Wir ihn die Strafe des Verbrennens kosten lassen.
ref: Turning their backs that they may lead away from the path of God. For such there is disgrace in the world, and on the Day of Judgement We shall make them taste the torment of burning.
draft: The one who arrogantly turns away from Allah's path is destined for shame in this life; and on the Day of Resurrection, We will make him taste the punishment of burning.
hil: The one who arrogantly turns away from Allah's path is destined for shame in this life; and on the Day of Resurrection, We will make him taste the punishment of burning.
compare: The one who arrogantly turns away from Allah's path is destined for shame in this life; and on the Day of Resurrection, We will make him taste the punishment of burning.

src: Und rufe die Menschen zur Pilgerfahrt auf. Sie werden zu Fuß und auf jedem mageren Kamel aus allen entfernsten Gegenden zu dir kommen
ref: “And publicly announce the pilgrimage to all people – they will come to you, on foot and on every lean she-camel, coming from every far distant journey.” (The announcement by Prophet Ibrahim reached each and every soul.)
draft: And call the people to pilgrimage. They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel from the most distant regions.
hil: And call the people to pilgrimage. They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel from the most distant regions.
compare: And call the people to pilgrimage. They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel from the most distant regions.

src: Und ohne die Huld Allahs gegen euch und Seine Barmherzigkeit, und daß Allah nicht Gnädig und Barmherzig wäre ...
ref: But for the grace of God and His mercy (much harm would have been done); yet God is compassionate and kind.
draft: And without the grace of Allah towards you and His mercy, and that Allah would not be compassionate and merciful ...
hil: And without Allah's grace towards you and His mercy, and that Allah would not be compassionate and merciful ...
compare: And without the grace of Allah towards you and His mercy, and that Allah would not be compassionate and merciful ...

src: Und (erinnere daran), als WIR euer Gelöbnis entgegennahmen: "Ihr vergießt euer Blut nicht und vertreibt euch selbst nicht aus euren Wohnstätten." Dann habt ihr es gebilligt, während ihr es bezeugt habt.
ref: And remember, when We made a covenant with you whereby you agreed you will neither shed blood among you nor turn your people out of their homes, you promised, and are witness to it too.
draft: And (remember) when WE received your pledge: "You do not shed your blood and do not drive yourselves out of your dwellings." Then you approved it, while you witnessed it.
hil: Remember when we received your covenant saying, "You shall not shed your blood, nor shall you evict each other from your homes." Then you confirmed this while bearing witness to it.
compare: Remember when we received your covenant saying, "You shall not shed your blood, nor shall you evict each other from your homes." Then you confirmed this while bearing witness to it.

src: ALLAH wußte, daß ihr an sie denken werdet, doch gebt ihnen kein Heiratsversprechen, außer daß ihr gebilligtes Wort sagt! Und entschließt euch nicht zum Heiratsvertrag, bis die Vorgeschriebene (Idda-Zeit) ihr Ende hat.
ref: Yet do not make a promise in secret, unless you speak in a manner that is proper; and do not resolve upon marriage till the fixed term of waiting is over.
draft: ALLAH knew that you would think of them, but do not give them a marriage promise, unless you say an approved word! And do not decide on the marriage contract until the prescribed (Idda period) has ended.
hil: God knows that you will think of them, but do not promise them marriage, except that you say a permissible thing! And do not decide on the marriage contract until the prescribed (Idda) waiting period has ended.
compare: God knows that you will think of them, but do not promise them marriage, except that you say a permissible thing! And do not decide on the marriage contract until the prescribed (Idda) waiting period has ended.

src: "Nein! Vielmehr erklären sie das für Lüge, wovon sie kein umfassendes Wissen haben, und schon bevor seine Deutung zu ihnen gekommen ist. So haben es auch diejenigen, die vor ihnen waren, für Lüge erklärt. Schau, wie das Ende der Ungerechten war!
ref: On the contrary, they denied the thing the knowledge of which they could not master, whereas they have not yet seen its outcome; similarly those before them had denied, therefore see what sort of fate befell the unjust!
draft: No! Rather they declare it a lie of which they have no comprehensive knowledge, even before his interpretation has reached them. Thus did those before them also declare it a lie. See how the end of the unjust was!
hil: No! Rather, they declare it a lie of which they have no comprehensive knowledge, even before his interpretation has reached them. Thus did those before them also declare it a lie. See how the end of the unjust was!
compare: No! Rather they declare it a lie of which they have no comprehensive knowledge, even before his interpretation has reached them. Thus did those before them also declare it a lie. See how the end of the unjust was!

src: Muhammad ist ALLAHs Gesandter!
ref: Muhammad is the apostle of Allah.
draft: Muhammad is the messenger of ALLAH!
hil: Muhammad is the Prophet of God!
compare: Muhammad is the messenger of ALLAH!

src: Zum Volk Pharaos, ob sie nicht gottesfürchtig sein wollen.»
ref: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear and take heed?"
draft: "To the people of Pharaoh, whether they want to be God-fearing."
hil: To the people of Pharaoh, whether they want to be God-fearing.
compare: "To the people of Pharaoh, whether they want to be God-fearing."

src: Angezündet (wird die Lampe) von einem gesegneten Ölbaum, der weder östlich noch westlich ist, dessen Öl beinahe leuchten würde, auch wenn das Feuer es nicht berührte.
ref: The glass is like a brilliant planet, fueled by a blessed tree, an olive tree, neither eastern nor western. Its oil would almost illuminate, even if no fire has touched it.
draft: The lamp is lit by a blessed olive tree that is neither east nor west, whose oil would almost glow even if the fire didn't touch it.
hil: The lamp is lit by a blessed olive tree that is neither eastern nor western, and whose oil would almost shine even if the fire did not touch it.
compare: The lamp is lit by a blessed olive tree that is neither eastern nor western, and whose oil would almost shine even if the fire did not touch it.

src: Ein Wohlgefallen von Gott ist aber größer. Das ist der großartige Erfolg.
ref: Yet Allah’s pleasure is greater [than all these]; that is the great success.
draft: A well-pleasure from God is greater. This is the great success.
hil: A satisfaction from God is greater. This is the magnificent triumph.
compare: A satisfaction from God is greater. This is the magnificent triumph.

src: Und dein HERR ist immer allsehend.
ref: Your Lord is always watching.
draft: And your LORD is always omniscient.
hil: And your Lord is always All-Seeing.
compare: And your LORD is always omniscient.

src: Und die Hölle umfaßt die Ungläubigen.
ref: And surely Gehenna encompasses the unbelievers.
draft: And hell encompasses the unbelievers.
hil: And hell encompasses the disbelievers.
compare: And hell encompasses the unbelievers.

src: Er befiehlt ihnen das Rechte und verbietet ihnen das Verwerfliche, er erlaubt ihnen die köstlichen Dinge und verbietet ihnen die schlechten, und er nimmt ihnen ihre Last und die Fesseln, die auf ihnen lagen, ab.
ref: He directs them to righteousness, and deters them from evil, and allows for them all good things, and prohibits for them wickedness, and unloads the burdens and the shackles that are upon them.
draft: He commands them what is right and prohibits what is reprehensible, he allows them the delicious things and prohibits the bad, and he takes off their burden and the shackles that lay upon them.
hil: He commands them to do what is right and prohibits them from doing what is wrong, he allows them to enjoy the delicious things and prohibits them from having the bad, and he takes away their burden and the shackles that lay upon them.
compare: He commands them to do what is right and prohibits them from doing what is wrong, he allows them to enjoy the delicious things and prohibits them from having the bad, and he takes away their burden and the shackles that lay upon them.

src: Die Allerersten, die ersten der Auswanderer und der Helfer und jene, die ihnen auf die beste Art gefolgt sind - mit ihnen ist Allah wohl zufrieden und sie sind wohl zufrieden mit Ihm; und Er hat ihnen Gärten vorbereitet, durch welche Bäche fließen.
ref: Those among the migrants (from Makkah) and helpers (in Madina) who were the first to believe, and those who followed them in goodness, have been accepted by God and they follow His way.
draft: The very first, the first of the emigrants and the helpers, and those who followed them in the best way - Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him; and He has prepared gardens for them through which rivers flow.
hil: God is well pleased with the first muhajirs, the ansar, and those who followed them in doing good. Gardens with streams of running water which they will abide therein forever have been prepared for them.
compare: God is well pleased with the first muhajirs, the ansar, and those who followed them in doing good. Gardens with streams of running water which they will abide therein forever have been prepared for them.

src: Und als WIR von ihm sein Unglück wegnahmen, fuhr er fort, als richtete er an Uns niemals Bittgebete wegen des Unglücks, das ihm zustieß.
ref: But when We take away his troubles, he moves away, as though he had never called to Us in affliction.
draft: And when WE took away his misfortune from him, he continued as if he never offered supplication to Us because of the misfortune that befell him.
hil: And when We removed his affliction from him, he continued as if he had never supplicated to Us for the affliction that had befallen him.
compare: And when We removed his affliction from him, he continued as if he had never supplicated to Us for the affliction that had befallen him.

src: Sag: "ALLAH, DU Schöpfer der Himmel und der Erde, Der Allwissende über das Verborgene und das Sichtbare!
ref: Say thou: O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth!
draft: Say: "ALLAH, You Creator of the heavens and the earth, The All-Knower of the unseen and the seen!
hil: Say, "Allah, You Creator of the heavens and the earth, The All-Knower of the unseen and the seen!"
compare: Say: "ALLAH, You Creator of the heavens and the earth, The All-Knower of the unseen and the seen!

src: Sag: "Erwartet ihr für uns etwas anderes außer eines der beiden Schönen (Sieg oder Schahada fi-sabilillah)?" Und wir erwarten für euch, daß ALLAH euch mit einer Peinigung trifft entweder (direkt) von Sich oder durch uns.
ref: Say thou await ye for us ought save one of the two excellences; while for you we wait that Allah shall afflict you with a torment from Himself or at our hands.
draft: Say, "Do you expect for us anything other than one of the two beauties (victory or martyrdom for the sake of Allah)?" And we expect for you that Allah will afflict you with a punishment, either from Himself directly or through us.
hil: Say: "Do you expect anything for us other than one of the two beauties (victory or martyrdom for the sake of Allah)?" And we expect for you that Allah will inflict upon you a punishment, either from Himself directly or through us.
compare: Say, "Do you expect for us anything other than one of the two beauties (victory or martyrdom for the sake of Allah)?" And we expect for you that Allah will afflict you with a punishment, either from Himself directly or through us.

src: Und ER ist Derjenige, Der lebendig macht und sterben läßt. Und Ihm unterliegt die Aufeinanderfolge von Nacht und Tag. Besinnt ihr euch etwa nicht?!
ref: And it is He Who gives life and causes death, and for Him are the alternations of night and day; so do you not have sense?
draft: And HE is the One who gives life and causes death. And to Him belongs the succession of night and day. Do you not reflect?!
hil: He is the One who gives life and causes death. And to Him belongs the succession of night and day. Do you not reflect?!
compare: And HE is the One who gives life and causes death. And to Him belongs the succession of night and day. Do you not reflect?!

src: Aber nein! Allah hat sie wegen ihres Unglaubens verflucht.
ref: Rather, God has cursed them for their ingratitude.
draft: But no! Allah has cursed them for their unbelief.
hil: No indeed; Allah has cursed them for their disbelief.
compare: But no! Allah has cursed them for their unbelief.

src: Wer Böses tut, dem wird danach vergolten, und er wird für sich anstelle Gottes weder Freund noch Helfer finden.
ref: Whosoever does evil shall be recompensed for it, and will not find for him, apart from God, a friend or helper.
draft: "Who does evil will be repaid afterwards, and he will not find either a friend or a helper for himself instead of God."
hil: Whoever does evil deeds, so it is for his own harm, and whoever commits good deeds, so it is for his own good; and he will not find either a friend or a helper for himself instead of God.
compare: "Who does evil will be repaid afterwards, and he will not find either a friend or a helper for himself instead of God."

src: Denn für euch gibt es keinen anderen als Gott.
ref: You have no god other than He.
draft: For there is no other for you but God.
hil: For there is no other for you but God.
compare: For there is no other for you but God.

src: O Prophet, furchte Allah und gehorche nicht den Ungläubigen und den Heuchlern.
ref: O Prophet, fear God, and obey not the unbelievers and the hypocrites.
draft: O Prophet, fear Allah and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites.
hil: O Prophet, do not fear Allah and do not obey the unbelievers and the hypocrites; indeed, God suffices as a protector.
compare: O Prophet, fear Allah and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites.

src: Nehmt diejenigen, die euren Din zum Spott und zur Belustigung mißbrauchen von denjenigen, denen die Schrift vor euch zuteil wurde, und von den Kafir, nicht als Wali!
ref: Do not befriend those who take your religion in mockery and as a sport, be they from among those who were given the Scripture before you, or the disbelievers.
draft: Take not for friends those who mock and make a jest of thy religion, whether among those who have been given the Scripture before thee, or among those who scoff at Truth, or haply Verse 57.  Keep away from those who make a jest and sport of your faith.
hil: Do not take as allies those who ridicule and mock your Din from among those who were given the Book before you and the disbelievers.
compare: Do not take as allies those who ridicule and mock your Din from among those who were given the Book before you and the disbelievers.

src: Und den, der an Allah glaubt und recht handelt, wird Er in Gärten führen, durch die Bäche fließen, worin (er) auf ewig verweilen wird.
ref: Whosoever believes in God and does the right, He will admit into gardens with rivers flowing by, where they will abide for ever.
draft: And whoever believes in Allah and does righteous deeds, He will guide him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein he will abide forever.
hil: The one who believes in Allah and acts rightly, He will lead to gardens through which rivers flow, wherein he will dwell forever.
compare: And whoever believes in Allah and does righteous deeds, He will guide him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein he will abide forever.

src: Ich schwöre bei dem, was ihr seht,
ref: I swear by that you see
draft: I swear by what you see.
hil: I swear by what you see.
compare: I swear by what you see.

src: Sie sagten: «O unser Vater, bitte für uns um Vergebung unserer Sünden.
ref: They said, ‘Father! Plead [with Allah] for forgiveness of our sins!
draft: They said: "O our father, please pray for forgiveness of our sins."
hil: They said, 'O our Father, pray for us that our sins be forgiven, for we are really sinners.'
compare: They said: "O our father, please pray for forgiveness of our sins."

src: Er gehört wahrlich zu den Ungerechten."
ref: He is surely a mischief-monger."
draft: "He truly belongs to the unjust."
hil: He truly belongs to the unjust.
compare: "He truly belongs to the unjust."

src: So versiegeln Wir die Herzen der Übertreter.
ref: That is how We seal the hearts of the iniquitous.
draft: So we seal the hearts of the transgressors.
hil: We thus seal the hearts of the transgressors.
compare: We thus seal the hearts of the transgressors.

src: Und wenn Unser Befehl ergeht und die Oberfläche der Erde (Wasser) hervorwallen läßt, dann nimm ein Paar von jeglicher Gattung an Bord sowie deine Angehörigen mit Ausnahme derer, gegen die das Wort bereits ergangen ist.
ref: Then, when Our Command comes, and the oven gushes forth water, take on board of each kind two (male and female), and your family, except those thereof against whom the Word has already gone forth.
draft: And when our command is given and the surface of the earth (water) causes to gush forth, then take on board a pair of every kind, along with your family, except for those against whom the command has already been issued.
hil: Embark therein, of each kind two (male and female), and your family, except those against whom the word has already gone forth.
compare: Embark therein, of each kind two (male and female), and your family, except those against whom the word has already gone forth.

src: Sag: "Ihr folgt uns nicht!
ref: Tell them: "You will not follow us.
draft: Say: "You're not following us!"
hil: Say: 'You're not following us!'
compare: Say: "You're not following us!"

src: Doch ER machte mich nicht zu einem widerspenstigen Widersacher!
ref: He has not made me haughty or rebellious.
draft: However, HE did not make me into a stubborn opponent!
hil: But HE did not make me into a rebellious opponent!
compare: But HE did not make me into a rebellious opponent!

src: Sie scheuen keine Mühe, euch zu verwirren, und möchten gern, daß ihr in Bedrängnis geratet. Schon wurde aus ihren Mündern Haß offenkundig, aber was ihre Brüste verborgen halten, ist (noch) schwerwiegender.
ref: O believers, take not for your intimates outside yourselves such men spare nothing to ruin you; they yearn for you to suffer Hatred has already shown itself of their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is yet greater.
draft: They do not shy away from any effort to confuse you and would like you to be in distress. Hatred has already become evident from their mouths, but what they hide in their breasts is even more serious.
hil: They will spare no effort to ruin you: They surely desire your annihilation. Hatred has already become evident from their mouths, but what they hide in their breasts is even more serious.
compare: They will spare no effort to ruin you: They surely desire your annihilation. Hatred has already become evident from their mouths, but what they hide in their breasts is even more serious.

src: Und wenn Du uns nicht vergibst und dich unser erbarmst, werden wir bestimmt zu den Verlierern gehören.»
ref: If You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we shall certainly be lost."
draft: "And if you do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we will certainly be among the losers."
hil: If you do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we will certainly be among those who lose.
compare: "And if you do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we will certainly be among the losers."

src: Dann bestimmte ER sie zu sieben Himmeln in zwei Ay-yam, und ließ in jedem Himmel seine Anweisung als Wahy zuteil werden. Und WIR schmückten den untersten Himmel mit Lampen und Bewahrendem. Dies ist die Bestimmung Des Allwürdigen, Des Allwissenden.
ref: He then established them into seven heavens in two days, and to each heaven He sent the command of its affairs; and We decorated the lower heaven with lamps; and for its protection; this is the command set by the Most Honourable, the All Knowing.
draft: Then HE appointed them seven heavens in two days and imparted to each heaven its mandate. And We adorned the lower heaven with lamps and preserved it. This is the determination of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
hil: Then HE appointed them seven heavens in two days and imparted to each heaven its mandate. And We adorned the nearest (lowest) heaven with lamps to be an adornment as well as to guard from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils. Such is the decree of Him the All-Mighty, the All-Knower.
compare: Then HE appointed them seven heavens in two days and imparted to each heaven its mandate. And We adorned the nearest (lowest) heaven with lamps to be an adornment as well as to guard from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils. Such is the decree of Him the All-Mighty, the All-Knower.

src: Ich will dir keine Härte auferlegen.
ref: I do not wish to impose any hardship on you.
draft: I don't want to force you.
hil: I don't want to impose any hardship on you.
compare: I don't want to impose any hardship on you.

src: Und wenn du sie fragst: "Wer schuf sie?" werden sie sicher sagen: "Allah." Wie lassen sie sich da (von Ihm) abwenden?
ref: And if you ask them as to Who created them, they will surely answer “Allah” – so where are they reverting?
draft: "And if you ask them, 'Who created them?' they will surely say, 'Allah.' So how are they being turned away?"
hil: If you ask them who created them, they will surely say, 'Allah.' How can they then be turned away (from Him)?
compare: "And if you ask them, 'Who created them?' they will surely say, 'Allah.' So how are they being turned away?"

src: "Was brachte euch in Saqar hinein?"
ref: "What was it that brought you to Hell?"
draft: "What brought you into Saqar?"
hil: What brought you into Saqar?
compare: "What brought you into Saqar?"

src: Oder wer hat die Himmel und die Erde erschaffen und euch vom Himmel Wasser herabkommen lassen? Dadurch haben Wir Gärten wachsen lassen, die Freude bereiten. Ihr hättet unmöglich deren Bäume wachsen lassen können. Gibt es denn einen (anderen) Gott neben Gott? Nein, ihr seid ja Leute, die (Gott andere) gleichsetzen.
ref: Or He Who created the heavens and the earth, and sent down water from the sky for you; so We grew delightful gardens with it; you had no strength to grow its trees; is there a God along with Allah?! In fact they are those who shun the right path.
draft: Or who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky for you, whereby We have caused gardens to grow full of beauty and delight - [you] could not [otherwise] have caused their trees to grow. Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].
hil: Who created the heavens and the earth and sent down water from the sky for you, whereby We caused gardens to grow full of beauty and delight - [you] could not [otherwise] have caused their trees to grow. Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].
compare: Or who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky for you, whereby We have caused gardens to grow full of beauty and delight - [you] could not [otherwise] have caused their trees to grow. Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].

src: Für sie ist darin bestimmt, was sie wollen. Und bei Uns ist noch mehr.
ref: Theirs will be whatsoever they wish: And with Us there is more.
draft: "For them, it is determined therein what they want. And with us there is even more."
hil: For them, it is predetermined what they want. And with Us there is even more.
compare: For them, it is predetermined what they want. And with Us there is even more.

src: Aber naht euch nicht diesem Baum, sonst gehört ihr zu den Ungerechten!"
ref: But neither of you should come close to this tree or else you shall both become transgressors'
draft: "But do not approach this tree, otherwise you will belong to the unjust!"
hil: "But do not approach this tree, otherwise you will belong to the unjust!"
compare: "But do not approach this tree, otherwise you will belong to the unjust!"

src: Und kehrt euch zu eurem Herrn, und ergebt euch Ihm, bevor die Strafe über euch kommt; (denn) dann werdet ihr keine Hilfe finden.
ref: Turn towards your Lord and obey Him before the punishment comes upon you when you will not be helped.
draft: And turn to your Lord and surrender yourselves to Him before the punishment comes upon you; for then you shall not find any help.
hil: Turn to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you, for then you will not find any help.
compare: And turn to your Lord and surrender yourselves to Him before the punishment comes upon you; for then you shall not find any help.

src: Ja! Wenn diese sie dann trifft, wird sie von ihnen nicht mehr abgewendet werden, und sie werden dann von dem umgeben, was sie zu verspotten pflegten.
ref: And yet, the day it comes, they will not be able to avert it; and what they used to laugh at will encompass them.
draft: Yes! When she meets them, she will no longer be averted by them, and they will then be surrounded by what they used to mock.
hil: Yes! If she then meets them, she will no longer be averted by them, and they will then be surrounded by what they used to mock.
compare: Yes! If she then meets them, she will no longer be averted by them, and they will then be surrounded by what they used to mock.

src: Dann iß von allen Früchten und folge den Wegen deines Herrn, (die Er dir) leicht gemacht hat." Aus ihren Leibern kommt ein Trank, mannigfach an Farbe.
ref: Then eat thou of all the fruits and tread the ways of thy Lord made easy.
draft: Then eat of all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord, which He has made easy for you." From their bodies comes a drink diverse in colors.
hil: "Then eat of all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord, which He has made easy for you." From their bodies comes a drink diverse in colors.
compare: Then eat of all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord, which He has made easy for you." From their bodies comes a drink diverse in colors.

src: Wenn aber einer gezwungen wird, wobei er weder Auflehnung noch Übertretung begeht, so ist Gott voller Vergebung und barmherzig.
ref: Yet whoso is constrained, not desiring nor transgressing, God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
draft: If, however, one is compelled, without transgressing, to do something, God is forgiving and merciful.
hil: If, however, someone is coerced to do something without rebellion or transgression, then God is forgiving and merciful.
compare: If, however, one is compelled, without transgressing, to do something, God is forgiving and merciful.

src: ER ist Derjenige, Der euch Gnade erweist und Seine Engel erbitten sie für euch, damit ER euch von den Finsternissen ins Licht herausbringt.
ref: It is He who blesses you, and His angels, to bring you forth from the shadows into the light.
draft: He is the one who shows you mercy and His angels ask for it for you so that He can bring you out of darkness into light.
hil: He is the one who shows you mercy and His angels ask for it for you so that He can bring you out of darkness into light.
compare: He is the one who shows you mercy and His angels ask for it for you so that He can bring you out of darkness into light.

src: Er ist nichts anderes als ein deutlicher Warner.
ref: He is only a plain admonisher.
draft: He is nothing other than a clear warning.
hil: He is nothing more than a clear Warner.
compare: He is nothing other than a clear warning.

src: Oder fühlt ihr euch sicher davor, daß ER euch dorthin (ins Meer) noch einmal zurückkehren läßt, und dann über euch einen Orkan schickt, dann euch ertrinken läßt für das, was ihr an Kufr betrieben habt? Dann findet ihr darin gegen Uns keinen Bestreitenden.
ref: Or are you unafraid that He may again take you back to the sea, then send against you a ship-breaking gust of wind, therefore drowning you because of your disbelief – then you may not find for yourself anyone to come after Us for this?
draft: Or do you feel safe that HE will let you return there (into the sea) once again, and then sends a hurricane over you, and then lets you drown for what you have done in Kufr? Then you will not find anyone to dispute against Us.
hil: To feel safe that HE would not take you back there (into the sea), and then send a storm over you, and then drown you for your Kufr activities? Then you will find no one challenging Us in that.
compare: Or do you feel safe that HE will let you return there (into the sea) once again, and then sends a hurricane over you, and then lets you drown for what you have done in Kufr? Then you will not find anyone to dispute against Us.

src: Und wenn alle Bäume, die auf der Erde sind, Schreibrohre wären und der Ozean (Tinte), und sieben Ozeane würden sie mit Nachschub versorgen, selbst dann könnten Allahs Worte nicht erschöpft werden. Wahrlich, Allah ist Allmächtig, Allweise.
ref: And if all the trees in the earth were pens, and the seas were its ink, with seven more seas to back it up – the Words of Allah will not finish; indeed Allah is Almighty, Wise.
draft: And if all the trees on earth were pens, and the ocean, with seven more oceans added to it, (were ink), the words of Allah would not be exhausted. Truly, Allah is Mighty, Wise.
hil: The words of Allah could not be exhausted even if all the trees on earth were pens, and the ocean, with seven more oceans added to it, (were ink) to replenish them. Truly, Allah is Mighty and Wise.
compare: And if all the trees on earth were pens, and the ocean, with seven more oceans added to it, (were ink), the words of Allah would not be exhausted. Truly, Allah is Mighty, Wise.

src: Und Allah liebt jene, die Gutes tun.
ref: And Allah loves the good-doers.
draft: "And Allah loves those who do good."
hil: Allah loves those who do good.
compare: "And Allah loves those who do good."

src: Er sagte: "Ja, und dann werdet ihr zu unseren Nächsten gehören."
ref: "Yes," he replied. "You 'will be among the honoured."
draft: He said: "Yes, and then you will belong to our neighbors."
hil: He said, "Yes, and then you will become our neighbors."
compare: He said, "Yes, and then you will become our neighbors."

src: Und die ihnen keine Unterstützung gewähren, noch sich selbst helfen können?
ref: Who can neither help them, nor help themselves?
draft: And those who cannot provide them with support, nor help themselves?
hil: And those who do not provide them with support, nor can help themselves?
compare: And those who cannot provide them with support, nor help themselves?

src: Oder (gewahrtest du etwa nicht) denjenigen, der an einer Ortschaft vorbeiging, während die Stützen ihrer (Häuser) dem Erdboden gleichgemacht wurden?!
ref: Or take the man who passed by a town which lay destroyed upside down.
draft: Or (don't you see that) the one who passed by a village while its (houses) were razed to the ground?!
hil: Did you not see such as he who passed by a town that was fallen down upon its turrets? He said, 'How shall God give life to this now it is dead?'
compare: Or (don't you see that) the one who passed by a village while its (houses) were razed to the ground?!

src: Dann entfernten sie sich.
ref: Then they turn away.
draft: Then they moved away.
hil: Then they moved away.
compare: Then they moved away.

src: Aber er blieb nicht lange aus. Er sagte: "Ich habe (an Wissen) erfaßt, was du nicht erfaßt hast.
ref: But he was not long in coming, and reported: "I have been around where you have not been.
draft: But he didn't stay away for long. He said: "I have grasped knowledge that you have not grasped.
hil: He didn't stay away for long and said, "I have grasped knowledge that you have not grasped."
