compare: "But only young people from his people believed in Musa, despite their fear of Pharaoh and his leading group, that he would persecute them."

src: Darum gewähre nun den Ungläubigen Aufschub, ein klein wenig Aufschub.
ref: So bear with unbelievers with patience, and give them respite for a while.
draft: Therefore, grant the unbelievers a little respite now, just a little respite.
hil: Therefore, grant the unbelievers a little respite now, just a little respite.
compare: Therefore, grant the unbelievers a little respite now, just a little respite.

src: Und du wirst im Verfahren Gottes keine Veränderung finden.
ref: And you will not find any change in the Way of Allah.
draft: And you will find no change in the process of God.
hil: You will find no change in the way of God.
compare: You will find no change in the way of God.

src: Gewiß, WIR ließen dir Wahy zuteil werden, wie WIR Wahy Nuh und den Propheten nach ihm zuteil werden ließen. Ebenso ließen WIRWahy zuteil werden Ibrahim, Isma'il, Ishaq, Ya'qub, den Stämmen Israils, 'Isa, Ayyub, Yunus, Harun und Sulaiman. Auch ließen WIR Dawud Zabur zukommen.
ref: We have sent revelations to you as We sent revelations to Noah and the prophets (who came) after him; and We sent revelations to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob, and their offspring, and to Jesus and Job, and to Jonah and Aaron and Solomon, and to David We gave the Book of Psalms,
draft: Certainly, we let revelation come to you as We let revelation come to Nuh and the Prophets after him. Likewise, We have sent revelation to Ibrahim, Isma'il, Ishaq, Ya'qub, the tribes of Israel, 'Isa, Ayyub, Yunus, Harun, and Sulaiman. And We gave Dawud the Zabur (Psalms).
hil: And We revealed to you, (O Muhammad), as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And We revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the descendants, and to Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon. And to David We gave the book of Psalms.
compare: Certainly, we let revelation come to you as We let revelation come to Nuh and the Prophets after him. Likewise, We have sent revelation to Ibrahim, Isma'il, Ishaq, Ya'qub, the tribes of Israel, 'Isa, Ayyub, Yunus, Harun, and Sulaiman. And We gave Dawud the Zabur (Psalms).

src: Und wenn ihnen eine Angelegenheit zu (Ohren) kommt, die Sicherheit oder Furcht betrifft, machen sie es bekannt. Wenn sie es jedoch vor den Gesandten und den Befehlshabern unter ihnen brächten, würden es wahrlich diejenigen unter ihnen wissen, die es herausfinden können.
ref: When there comes to them a matter, be it of security or fear, they broadcast it; if they had referred it to the Messenger and to those in authority among them, those of them whose task it is to investigate would have known the matter.
draft: And if they hear of any matter concerning safety or fear, they broadcast it. If they had referred it to the Messenger and to those in authority among them, then those among them who could investigate and analyse the matter would have known it (best).
hil: If they come to know of any matter concerning safety or fear, they should make it known publicly. But if they refer it to the Messenger or to those in authority among them, those of them who are able to investigate and think out the matter would understand it (from them directly).
compare: And if they hear of any matter concerning safety or fear, they broadcast it. If they had referred it to the Messenger and to those in authority among them, then those among them who could investigate and analyse the matter would have known it (best).

src: ER wird denjenigen, die Schlechtes taten, doch das vergelten, was sie taten, und ER wird denjenigen, die Ihsan taten, mit dem Besseren vergelten.
ref: He will repay those who do evil according to their deeds, and recompense those who do good with the best.
draft: "He will repay those who did bad deeds for what they did, and He will reward those who did Ihsan with even better."
hil: He will requite those who did evil according to their deeds, and reward those who did Ihsan with something even better.
compare: He will requite those who did evil according to their deeds, and reward those who did Ihsan with something even better.

src: (Erwähne) den Tag, an dem ALLAH die Gesandten versammelt, dann sagt: "Welche Antwort wurde euch gegeben?!"
ref: The day God will gather the apostles and ask: "What answer was made to you?"
draft: (Mention) the day on which Allah will gather the messengers and then say, "What response was given to you?!"
hil: Mention the day when Allah will gather the messengers and say, "What response was given to you?"
compare: (Mention) the day on which Allah will gather the messengers and then say, "What response was given to you?!"

src: Und wenn WIR es wollten, gewiß hätten WIR dir sie gezeigt, dann wirst du sie sicher an ihren Merkmalen erkennen. Und du erkennst sie doch an der Andeutung mit dem Gesagten. Und ALLAH kennt eure Handlungen.
ref: And if We will, We can show them to you so that you may recognise them by their faces; and you will surely recognise them by the way they talk; and Allah knows your deeds.
draft: And if we wanted to, we would certainly have shown them to you, then you would surely recognize them by their characteristics. And you do recognize them by the indication of what is said. And Allah knows your actions.
hil: And if we wanted to, we could have definitely shown them to you, then you would surely recognize them by their characteristics. And you do recognize them by the indication of what is said. And Allah knows your actions.
compare: And if we wanted to, we would certainly have shown them to you, then you would surely recognize them by their characteristics. And you do recognize them by the indication of what is said. And Allah knows your actions.

src: Und beleidigt euch nicht gegenseitig durch Gesten und bewerft euch nicht gegenseitig mit (häßlichen) Beinamen.
ref: Do not slander one another, nor give one another nick-names.
draft: And do not insult each other with gestures and do not throw (ugly) nicknames at each other.
hil: Do not insult each other with gestures and do not throw (ugly) nicknames at each other.
compare: And do not insult each other with gestures and do not throw (ugly) nicknames at each other.

src: An ihnen habt ihr sonst allerlei Nutzen. Und damit ihr, auf ihnen reitend, etwas, was ihr in eurer Brust hegt und anstrebt, erreichen könnt.
ref: And in them you have other benefits as well, and through them you satisfy your needs.
draft: You otherwise have many benefits from them. And so that you can achieve something that you hold and strive for in your chest, while riding on them.
hil: You have many benefits from them. And so that you can achieve something that you hold and strive for in your chest, while riding on them.
compare: You have many benefits from them. And so that you can achieve something that you hold and strive for in your chest, while riding on them.

src: Auch Derjenige, Der vom Himmel Wasser nach Bestimmung fallen ließ, dann ließen WIR damit eine tote Landschaft erstehen. Solcherart werdet ihr hervorgebracht.
ref: Who sent down water in due measure from the sky, then quickened a region that was dead -- So shall We bring you forth --
draft: Also the one who let water fall from the sky as determined, then WE made a dead landscape arise with it. In such a way you are brought forth.
hil: The One who causes water to fall from the sky as determined by Allah, and then, with it, WE cause a dead landscape to arise. In this way, you are brought forth.
compare: The One who causes water to fall from the sky as determined by Allah, and then, with it, WE cause a dead landscape to arise. In this way, you are brought forth.

src: ER weiß, was in die Erde hineingeht, was aus ihr herauskommt, und was vom Himmel hinabkommt, und in ihn hinaufsteigt. Und ER ist Der Allgnädige, Der Allvergebende.
ref: He knows all that goes into the earth and all that comes out of it, and all that descends from the skies and all that ascends into it; and only He is the Most Merciful, the Oft Forgiving.
draft: He knows what goes into the earth, what comes out of it, what comes down from heaven, and what goes up into it. And He is the Most Merciful, the Most Forgiving.
hil: He knows what goes into the earth, what comes out of it, what comes down from heaven, and what goes up into it. And He is the Most Merciful, the Most Forgiving.
compare: He knows what goes into the earth, what comes out of it, what comes down from heaven, and what goes up into it. And He is the Most Merciful, the Most Forgiving.

src: Und WIR machten sie zur Rechtleitung für die Kinder Israils.
ref: And We appointed it to be a guidance unto the Children of Is'rail.
draft: And WE made it (referring to a book or scripture) a guide for the Children of Israel.
hil: And We made it a guide for the Children of Israel.
compare: And We made it a guide for the Children of Israel.

src: Gibt es denn einen (anderen) Gott neben Gott? Nein, ihr seid ja Leute, die (Gott andere) gleichsetzen.
ref: Nay, but they are a people who assign to Him equals!
draft: Is there any other God beside God? No, you are people who equate (other gods with God).
hil: Is there any other God beside God? No, instead they are people who equate others with God.
compare: Is there any other God beside God? No, you are people who equate (other gods with God).

src: Und gewiß, von seiner Gefolgschaft ist doch Ibrahim.
ref: And Abraham indeed was of his inducement,
draft: And certainly, Ibrahim is among his followers.
hil: And indeed, Ibrahim is among his followers.
compare: And certainly, Ibrahim is among his followers.

src: Geht also in die Häuser durch ihre Türen.
ref: Enter the house through the main gate, and obey God.
draft: So go into the houses through their doors.
hil: So enter the houses through their doors.
compare: So go into the houses through their doors.

src: dir unterliegt von der Angelegenheit nichts - oder ihnen vergibt oder sie peinigt.
ref: It is no concern of yours whether He redeems them or punishes them.
draft: There is nothing that depends on you regarding the matter - either it forgives you or it torments you.
hil: There is nothing incumbent upon you regarding the matter - either it pardons you or torments you.
compare: There is nothing incumbent upon you regarding the matter - either it pardons you or torments you.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH vergibt die Verfehlungen - allesamt.
ref: Surely God forgives all sins.
draft: Certainly, ALLAH forgives the mistakes - all of them.
hil: Verily, ALLAH forgives the wrongdoings - all of them.
compare: Certainly, ALLAH forgives the mistakes - all of them.

src: Allah gebietet Gerechtigkeit, gütig zu sein und den Verwandten zu geben; Er verbietet das Schändliche, das Verwerfliche und die Gewalttätigkeit.
ref: Verily God has enjoined justice, the doing of good, and the giving of gifts to your relatives; and forbidden indecency, impropriety and oppression.
draft: "Allah commands justice, kindness towards relatives, and forbids shameful acts, injustice, and violence."
hil: "Allah commands justice, kindness towards relatives, and forbids shameful acts, injustice, and violence."
compare: "Allah commands justice, kindness towards relatives, and forbids shameful acts, injustice, and violence."

src: Und ALLAH ist allwissend über die Unrecht-Begehenden.
ref: And Allah is the Knower of he wrong-doers.
draft: And Allah is all-knowing about those who commit injustice.
hil: And Allah is all-knowing about those who commit injustice.
compare: And Allah is all-knowing about those who commit injustice.

src: Sag: Was meint ihr, wenn er doch von Allah stammt und ihr ihn hierauf verleugnet?
ref: Say: "See ye if the (Revelation) is (really) from Allah, and yet do ye reject it?
draft: Say: What do you mean when he comes from Allah and you deny him?
hil: Say: What do you mean when he comes from Allah and you deny him?
compare: Say: What do you mean when he comes from Allah and you deny him?

src: ALLAH hat für sie Dschannat vorbereitet, die von Flüssen durchflossen werden. Darin werden sie ewig bleiben. Dies ist der unermeßliche Gewinn.
ref: Allah has kept ready for them Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding in it forever; this is the greatest success.
draft: "ALLAH has prepared paradise for them, which is crossed by rivers. They will stay there forever. This is the immeasurable gain."
hil: God has prepared for them gardens of Paradise under which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. This is the immeasurable gain.
compare: God has prepared for them gardens of Paradise under which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. This is the immeasurable gain.

src: Als (der Überbringer) zu Salomo kam, sagte (dieser): "Schüttet ihr Reichtümer über mich aus?
ref: So, when the envoys came to Solomon he said: "Do you wish to increase my wealth?
draft: When (the messenger) came to Solomon, he said: "Are you pouring your riches over me?"
hil: When the messenger came to Solomon, he said, "Are you pouring your riches over me?"
compare: When (the messenger) came to Solomon, he said: "Are you pouring your riches over me?"

src: Gewiß, ALLAHs Androhung ist wahr. So lasst das diesseitige Leben euch nicht täuschen, und lasst keineswegs das Täuschende euch in ALLAH täuschen!
ref: Surely God's promise is true; so let not the present life delude you, and let not the Deluder delude you concerning God.
draft: Surely, Allah's threat is true. So do not let this worldly life deceive you, and do not let the deceiver deceive you in Allah!
hil: For sure, Allah's threat is true. Then, don't let this worldly life deceive you and never let the deceptive (things) deceive you in Allah.
compare: Surely, Allah's threat is true. So do not let this worldly life deceive you, and do not let the deceiver deceive you in Allah!

src: Und als ihnen Unsere Ayat verdeutlicht vorgetragen wurden, haben diejenigen, die Unsere Begegnung nicht erhoffen, gesagt: "Bringe einen Quran außer diesem oder forme ihn um!" Sag: "Mir steht es nicht zu, ihn nach meinem Gutdünken umzuformen. Ich folge nur dem, was mir an Wahy zuteil wird! Ich fürchte, sollte ich meinem HERRN widersprechen, die Peinigung eines gewaltigen Tages!"
ref: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, the people who do not expect to meet Us say, “Bring a Qur’an other than this one, or change it”; say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “I do not have the right to change it on my own; I only follow what is divinely revealed to me; if I were to disobey my Lord*, then I fear the punishment of the Great Day (of Resurrection). (* Which is impossible.)
draft: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it." Say, [O Muhammad], "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
hil: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, 'Bring us a Quran other than this or change it.' Say, 'It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day!'
compare: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it." Say, [O Muhammad], "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."

src: Und WIR erschufen den Himmel, die Erde und das, was zwischen ihnen ist, doch nicht aus sinnlosem Treiben.
ref: We have not created the heavens and the earth, and all that lies between them, out of fun.
draft: And WE created the heaven, the earth, and that which is between them, not in vain.
hil: And WE did not create the heavens, the Earth, and all that lies between them in vain.
compare: And WE created the heaven, the earth, and that which is between them, not in vain.

src: Wäre nicht zuvor ein Wort von deinem Herrn ergangen, wäre gewiß zwischen ihnen entschieden worden; aber wahrhaftig, sie befinden sich in beunruhigendem Zweifel über ihn (den Quran)
ref: If the Word of your Lord had not preceded it the matter would have been settled between them. They are still in doubt about it and uneasy.
draft: If a word had not gone forth from thy Lord, (their differences) would have been settled between them: But verily those who are obstinate in sin are in a quarrelsome doubt.
hil: If a word had not gone forth from your Lord beforehand, the matter would surely have been decided between them. But verily they are in disturbing doubt about it (the Quran).
compare: If a word had not gone forth from your Lord beforehand, the matter would surely have been decided between them. But verily they are in disturbing doubt about it (the Quran).

src: Als die Zauberer kamen, sagte Mose zu ihnen: «Werft, was ihr werfen wollt.»
ref: So when the magicians arrived, Moses said to them: "Cast whatever (spell) you have to cast."
draft: When the wizards came, Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you want to throw."
hil: When the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you want to throw."
compare: When the wizards came, Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you want to throw."

src: Hat sie nicht die Kunde von denen erreicht, die vor ihnen waren vom Volke Noahs, von `Ad und Tamud und vom Volke Abrahams und den Bewohnern Madyans und der zusammengestürzten Städte? Ihre Gesandten kamen mit deutlichen Zeichen zu ihnen. Allah also wollte ihnen kein Unrecht tun, doch sie taten sich selber Unrecht.
ref: Has not the news of those before them come to them; of the people of Nuh and Ad and Samood, and the people of Ibrahim and the dwellers of Madyan and the overthrown cities; their apostles came to them with clear arguments; so it was not Allah Who should do them injustice, but they were unjust to themselves.
draft: Has she not received news of those before them, the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud, the people of Abraham, and the dwellers of Midian and the overturned cities? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. Allah would never wrong them, but they wronged themselves.
hil: Has she not received news of those who were before them, the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud, the people of Abraham, the inhabitants of Midian, and the overturned cities? Their messengers came to them with clear signs. Allah did not want to wrong them, but they wronged themselves.
compare: Has she not received news of those before them, the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud, the people of Abraham, and the dwellers of Midian and the overturned cities? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. Allah would never wrong them, but they wronged themselves.

src: Sie haben ja kein Wissen darüber. Sie stellen nur Schätzungen an.
ref: They do not know its truth at all; they only make guesses.
draft: You do not have any knowledge about it. You only make estimations.
hil: They have no knowledge about it. They only make estimations.
compare: You do not have any knowledge about it. You only make estimations.

src: Mir wird offenbart, daß euer Gott ein Einziger Gott ist; so seid aufrichtig gegen Ihn und bittet Ihn um Vergebung." Und wehe den Götzendienern
ref: To me it has been revealed that your God is One God; so go straight with Him, and ask for His forgiveness; and woe to the idolaters
draft: "I am revealed that your God is the One God; so be sincere towards Him and ask Him for forgiveness. And woe to the idolaters."
hil: I am revealed that your God is the One God; so be sincere towards Him and ask Him for forgiveness. And woe to the idolaters.
compare: "I am revealed that your God is the One God; so be sincere towards Him and ask Him for forgiveness. And woe to the idolaters."

src: Er warf die Tafeln hin und ergriff seinen Bruder beim Kopf, indem er ihn an sich zog.
ref: And he cast aside the tablets, and pulled his brother by the hair.
draft: He threw the tablets and seized his brother by the head, pulling him towards himself.
hil: He threw the tablets and seized his brother by the head, pulling him towards himself.
compare: He threw the tablets and seized his brother by the head, pulling him towards himself.

src: Allahs Gesandter sagte zu ihnen: "(Achtet auf) Allahs Kamelstute und ihre Trinkzeit."
ref: And the apostle of God had to tell them: "This is God's she-camel, let her drink."
draft: "Allah's messenger said to them: "Pay attention to Allah's she-camel and her drinking time."
hil: Allah's messenger said to them: 'Pay attention to Allah's she-camel and her drinking time.'
compare: "Allah's messenger said to them: "Pay attention to Allah's she-camel and her drinking time."

src: Und so haben Wir euch zu einer Gemeinschaft der Mitte gemacht, damit ihr Zeugen über die (anderen) Menschen seiet und damit der Gesandte über euch Zeuge sei. Wir hatten die Gebetsrichtung, die du einhieltest, nur bestimmt, um zu wissen, wer dem Gesandten folgt und wer sich auf den Fersen umkehrt.
ref: Thus, have We made of you an Ummat justly balanced, that ye might be witnesses over the nations, and the Messenger a witness over yourselves; and We appointed the Qibla to which thou wast used, only to test those who followed the Messenger from those who would turn on their heels (From the Faith).
draft: And thus We have made you a just community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels.
hil: Thus We have appointed you a midmost nation that you might be witnesses to the people, and that the Messenger might be a witness to you; and We did not appoint the direction which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels.
compare: And thus We have made you a just community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels.

src: Nein! Vielmehr sind sie lebendig; aber ihr nehmt es nicht wahr.
ref: In fact, they are alive but you do not perceive that life.
draft: No! Rather, they are alive; but you do not perceive it.
hil: They are alive, rather; however, you do not perceive it.
compare: No! Rather, they are alive; but you do not perceive it.

src: Sag: Jeder handelt nach seiner Weise.
ref: Say, “Each does according to his disposition.
draft: Say: Everyone acts according to their own way.
hil: Proclaim: Each one acts according to their own disposition, but only a little knowledge has been bestowed upon you.
compare: Say: Everyone acts according to their own way.

src: Und des Abraham, der (seine Pflichten) erfüllte?
ref: And of Abraham who fulfilled his trust? --
draft: And what about Abraham, who fulfilled his duties?
hil: And what about Abraham, who fulfilled his obligations?
compare: And what about Abraham, who fulfilled his duties?

src: Gewiß, diejenigen, denen ihr anstelle von ALLAH dient, haben für euch kein Rizq, so strebt das Rizq bei ALLAH an, dient Ihm und erweist euch Ihm gegenüber dankbar!
ref: Surely those you worship other than God have no power over your means of livelihood. So seek your sustenance from God, and worship Him and give Him thanks.
draft: Surely, those whom you serve besides Allah have no power to provide sustenance for you. So, seek sustenance from Allah, worship Him, and be grateful to Him.
hil: Surely, those whom you worship instead of Allah have no power to provide sustenance for you. So seek sustenance from Allah, worship Him, and be grateful to Him.
compare: Surely, those whom you serve besides Allah have no power to provide sustenance for you. So, seek sustenance from Allah, worship Him, and be grateful to Him.

src: Doch wahrlich, er (Jesus) ist ein Vorzeichen der Stunde. So bezweifelt sie nicht, sondern folgt Mir. Das ist ein gerader Weg.
ref: And indeed Eisa is a sign* of the Last Day, therefore do not ever doubt in the Last Day, and obey Me**; this is the Straight Path. (* The advent of Prophet Eisa to earth for the second time. ** By obeying the Noble Messenger.)
draft: But truly, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour. So do not doubt, but follow me. This is a straight path.
hil: But truly, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour. So do not doubt, but follow me. This is a straight path.
compare: But truly, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour. So do not doubt, but follow me. This is a straight path.

src: (Es gibt) keine Zuflucht.
ref: There is no refuge!
draft: "No refuge."
hil: There is no refuge.
compare: "No refuge."

src: Darin sind wahrlich Zeichen für die Betrachtenden.
ref: Herein are really signs for those who discern.
draft: There are truly signs for those who reflect.
hil: There are truly signs for those who reflect.
compare: There are truly signs for those who reflect.

src: Die Frau Fir'auns sagte: "(Er wird) für mich und dich ein Grund zur Freude sein. Tötet ihn nicht. Vielleicht nützt er uns oder wir nehmen ihn als Kind an." Dabei merkten sie nicht (, was sie taten).
ref: And the wife of Fir'awn said: a comfort unto me and thee slay him not; belike he shall be of benefit to us or we might like him for a son; and they perceived not.
draft: "The wife of Pharaoh said: "(He will) be a reason for joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Maybe he will benefit us or we will adopt him as a child." They did not realize what they were doing."
hil: The wife of Pharaoh said, 'He will be a cause of joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he will benefit us or we will adopt him as a child.' They did not realize what they were doing.
compare: The wife of Pharaoh said, 'He will be a cause of joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he will benefit us or we will adopt him as a child.' They did not realize what they were doing.

src: An ihnen habt ihr sonst allerlei Nutzen.
ref: You may also obtain other benefits from them.
draft: You would otherwise have all sorts of benefits from them.
hil: Through them, you otherwise have all sorts of benefits.
compare: You would otherwise have all sorts of benefits from them.

src: Und Wir gaben ihm solche Schätze, daß deren Schlüssel wahrlich eine schwere Last für eine (ganze) Schar kräftiger Männer gewesen wären.
ref: We had given him treasures, so many that a team of wrestlers could hardly lift their keys.
draft: And We gave him such treasures that the keys to them would truly have been a heavy burden for a (whole) group of strong men.
hil: And We gave him treasures, of which the keys would truly have been a heavy burden for a whole company of strong men.
compare: And We gave him such treasures that the keys to them would truly have been a heavy burden for a (whole) group of strong men.

src: Ihr sollt Gott allein dienen. Ich fürchte für euch die Pein eines schmerzvollen Tages.»
ref: Do not worship anyone but God; for I fear the punishment of a dreadful day for you."
draft: "You shall worship God alone. I fear for you the pain of a painful day."
hil: You shall worship only God. I fear for you the punishment of a painful day.
compare: You shall worship only God. I fear for you the punishment of a painful day.

src: Seid nicht wie diejenigen, die Kufr betrieben haben und zu ihren Brüdern sagten, als diese sich auf Handelsreisen oder Feldzügen befanden: "Wären sie bei uns geblieben, wären sie weder gestorben, noch getötet worden." (Sagt es nicht), damit ALLAH dies als Bitterkeit (nur) in ihren Herzen bleiben läßt.
ref: Be not like those who disbelieve (hypocrites) and who say to their brethren when they travel through the earth or go out to fight: "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed," so that Allah may make it a cause of regret in their hearts.
draft: Do not be like those who committed Kufr and said to their brothers, when they were on trading voyages or military expeditions, 'If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed.' (This was said) so that Allah might make it a cause of regret for them in their hearts.
hil: Do not be like those who disbelieved and said to their brothers when they were traveling or fighting, "If they had been with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say this) because Allah intends thereby bitterness (only) into their hearts.
compare: Do not be like those who committed Kufr and said to their brothers, when they were on trading voyages or military expeditions, 'If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed.' (This was said) so that Allah might make it a cause of regret for them in their hearts.

src: Und Er hat euch in der Religion keine Bedrängnis auferlegt; so ist die Glaubensrichtung eures Vaters Abraham. Er hat euch Muslime genannt, früher und (nunmehr) in diesem (Buch), auf daß der Gesandte Zeuge über euch sei und ihr Zeugen über die Menschen seid.
ref: He has chosen you (to convey His Message of Islamic Monotheism to mankind by inviting them to His religion, Islam), and has not laid upon you in religion any hardship, it is the religion of your father Ibrahim (Abraham) (Islamic Monotheism).
draft: And He has not imposed upon you in religion any hardship. (It is) the faith of your father, Abraham. Allah has named you Muslims before (in former scriptures) and in this (revelation) that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people.
hil: And He has not imposed upon you in religion any hardship. It is the faith of your father, Abraham. Allah named you Muslims before (in former scriptures) and in this (revelation) that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people.
compare: And He has not imposed upon you in religion any hardship. (It is) the faith of your father, Abraham. Allah has named you Muslims before (in former scriptures) and in this (revelation) that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people.

src: Sag: Wollt ihr denn Allah kundtun, was Er nicht kennt, weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde? Preis sei Ihm!
ref: You inform Allah of something which in His knowledge does not exist in the heavens or in the earth?” Purity and Supremacy are to Him, above their association. (* Some things like the sun, stars, trees are useful but they too are created by Allah.
draft: Say, do you want to declare to Allah what He does not know, neither in the heavens nor on the earth? Praise be to Him!
hil: Say: Do you want to declare to Allah that which He does not know, neither in the heavens nor on the earth? Praise be to Him!
compare: Say, do you want to declare to Allah what He does not know, neither in the heavens nor on the earth? Praise be to Him!

src: Was aber diejenigen angeht, die ungläubig sind, so sagen sie: "Was will denn Allah damit als Gleichnis?" Er läßt damit viele in die Irre gehen und leitet viele damit recht, doch läßt Er damit nur die Frevler in die Irre gehen,
ref: He misleads many thereby, and He guides many thereby; and with it He misleads only those who are rebellious.
draft: As for those who are unbelievers, they say, "What does Allah mean by this parable?" He leads many astray thereby, and guides many thereby; but He leads astray thereby only those who are transgressors.
hil: As for the disbelievers, they say: 'What does Allah mean by this parable?' By it Allah leaves many astray and guides many. But He thereby leaves astray only the wicked,
compare: As for the disbelievers, they say: 'What does Allah mean by this parable?' By it Allah leaves many astray and guides many. But He thereby leaves astray only the wicked,

src: Und als ihm Unsere Ayat vorgetragen wurden, kehrte er den Rücken in Arroganz um, als ob er sie nicht hörte, als ob in seinen Ohren Schwerhörigkeit wäre.
ref: When Our verses are recited before them they turn away haughtily as though they did not hear them, as if a deafness had come into their ears.
draft: And when Our revelations were recited to him, he turned his back in arrogance, as if he did not hear them, as if there was deafness in his ears.
hil: And when Our revelations are recited to him, he haughtily turns away as if he did not hear them, as if there is deafness in his ears.
compare: And when Our revelations were recited to him, he turned his back in arrogance, as if he did not hear them, as if there was deafness in his ears.

src: Tragen werden sie aber nichts von ihren Verfehlungen, denn sie sind fürwahr Lügner.
ref: Surely, they are liars.
draft: They will not bear any of their faults, because they are truly liars.
hil: They will not bear any of their faults because they are truly liars.
compare: They will not bear any of their faults, because they are truly liars.

src: Aber ihr liebt die nicht, die gut raten.»
ref: (The people in the graves can hear the speech of those who are on earth.)
draft: But you do not love those who give good advice.
hil: But you do not love those who give good advice.
compare: But you do not love those who give good advice.

src: Was ist mit euch, daß ihr Allah nicht (in der Ihm gebührenden Weise) ehrt
ref: What has come upon you that you do not fear the majesty of God,
draft: What's wrong with you that you do not honour Allah (in the way He deserves)?
hil: What is wrong with you that you are not honoring Allah (in the manner in which He deserves)?
compare: What is wrong with you that you are not honoring Allah (in the manner in which He deserves)?

src: Der Satan droht euch Armut an und befiehlt euch Schändliches. Gott verheißt euch Vergebung von seiner Seite und Huld. Gott umfaßt und weiß alles.
ref: The devil scares you of poverty and bids you to the shameful; and Allah promises you forgiveness from Him, and munificence; and Allah is Most Capable, All Knowing.
draft: The Satan threatens you with poverty and commands you to commit shameful deeds. God promises you forgiveness from Himself and grace. God encompasses and knows everything.
hil: The Satan threatens you with poverty and commands you to commit shameful deeds. God promises you forgiveness from Himself and grace. God encompasses and knows everything.
compare: The Satan threatens you with poverty and commands you to commit shameful deeds. God promises you forgiveness from Himself and grace. God encompasses and knows everything.

src: Beinahe werde ICH sie enthüllen, damit jeder Seele nach ihrem Bestreben vergolten wird.
ref: I keep it secret that every soul may be rewarded for its endeavour.
draft: Almost I WILL reveal her, so that every soul will be recompensed according to their desire.
hil: Almost will I expose them so that every soul may be recompensed according to their endeavor.
compare: Almost will I expose them so that every soul may be recompensed according to their endeavor.

src: Und (Wir sandten) zu Madyan ihren Bruder Shuayb.
ref: Remember, We sent to Midian their brother Shu'aib.
draft: And (We sent) their brother Shuayb to Madyan.
hil: And unto Madyan We sent their brother Shuayb.
compare: And unto Madyan We sent their brother Shuayb.

src: Mache Da"wa zum Weg deines HERRN mit Weisheit und schöner Ermahnung, und disputiere mit ihnen auf die beste Art. Gewiß, dein HERR ist es, der Wissen darüber hat, wer von Seinem Weg abgekommen ist.
ref: Call them unto the way of thy Lord with Wisdom and goodly exhortation, and argue with them with that which is best. Verily thy Lord!
draft: Make Da'wah to the way of your LORD with wisdom and beautiful preaching, and argue with them in the best way. Indeed, your LORD is the one who knows best who has strayed from His path.
hil: Call to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good advice, and argue with them in the best way possible. Indeed, your Lord is the one who knows best who has strayed from His path.
compare: Call to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good advice, and argue with them in the best way possible. Indeed, your Lord is the one who knows best who has strayed from His path.

src: Und da gibt es bei ihnen Werke, die anders sind als diese, und die sie vollbringen.
ref: Moreover, there are other deeds besides this which they do.
draft: And there are works among them that are different from these, which they accomplish.
hil: And there are deeds among them that are different from these and that they accomplish.
compare: And there are deeds among them that are different from these and that they accomplish.

src: Weiß er denn nicht?
ref: So does he not know?
draft: Do you not know?
hil: Doesn't he know?
compare: Doesn't he know?

src: Und Wir haben einige der Propheten vor den anderen bevorzugt. Und Wir haben David eine Schrift zukommen lassen.
ref: We exalted some of the prophets over the others; and to David We gave the Book of Psalms.
draft: And We have preferred some of the prophets over others. And We have sent down to David a Scripture.
hil: And We have preferred some of the prophets over others. And We have sent a Scripture to David.
compare: And We have preferred some of the prophets over others. And We have sent down to David a Scripture.

src: Und wenn eine jede Seele, die Unrecht begangen hat, alles besäße, was auf Erden ist, würde sie versuchen, sich damit (von der Strafe) loszukaufen. Und sie werden Reue empfinden, wenn sie sehen, wie die Strafe (über sie) kommt.
ref: Even if every soul that has sinned possessed whatever is on the earth, it would surely offer it to ransom itself, and feel repentant on seeing the punishment.
draft: And if every soul that has committed injustice possessed everything that is on earth, it would try to redeem itself (from the punishment) with it. And they will feel regret when they see how the punishment (comes upon them).
hil: And if each unjust soul owned everything that is on earth, it would certainly give it to redeem itself from the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. And they will feel remorse when they see the punishment come upon them. It will be judged among them with fairness, and they will not be wronged.
compare: And if each unjust soul owned everything that is on earth, it would certainly give it to redeem itself from the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. And they will feel remorse when they see the punishment come upon them. It will be judged among them with fairness, and they will not be wronged.

src: (Sie sind) verflucht. Wo immer sie (im Kampf) angetroffen werden, werden sie ergriffen und allesamt getötet.
ref: Accursed, they would be seized wherever found, and slain mercilessly.
draft: (Cursed are) They are cursed. Wherever they are encountered (in battle), they are captured and all killed.
hil: They are cursed. Wherever they are encountered (in battle), they are captured and all killed.
compare: (Cursed are) They are cursed. Wherever they are encountered (in battle), they are captured and all killed.

src: Und es hielt Uns nichts zurück, Gesandte mit den Ayat zu entsenden, außer daß die Früheren sie als Lüge erklärten. Und WIR ließen Thamud das Kamelweibchen als Erläuterung zuteil werden, so begingen sie mit ihm Unrecht.
ref: Naught prevented Us from sending the signs but that the ancients cried lies to them; and We brought Thamood the She-camel visible, but they did her wrong.
draft: And nothing held us back from sending messengers with the signs except that the earlier peoples denied them as lies. And we made the she-camel a clear sign for Thamud, but they wronged her.
hil: And nothing held us back from sending messengers with the signs except that the earlier peoples denied them as lies. And we made the she-camel a clear sign for Thamud, but they wronged her.
compare: And nothing held us back from sending messengers with the signs except that the earlier peoples denied them as lies. And we made the she-camel a clear sign for Thamud, but they wronged her.

src: Vielmehr hat Allah ihn zu Sich erhoben. Allah ist Allmächtig und Allweise.
ref: Allah took him up to Himself; and Allah is Mighty, Wise.
draft: Rather, Allah has raised him to Himself. Allah is Almighty and All-Wise.
hil: But God has raised him closer to Himself; and God is all-mighty and all-wise.
compare: Rather, Allah has raised him to Himself. Allah is Almighty and All-Wise.

src: (Von ihnen) sagen wir uns vor Dir los.
ref: We led them astray, as we were astray ourselves. We declare our innocence (from them) before You.
draft: We say goodbye to you in front of you.
hil: We dissociate ourselves from them before you.
compare: We dissociate ourselves from them before you.

src: Nicht Wir taten ihnen Unrecht, sondern sie taten sich selber Unrecht an; und ihre Götter, die sie statt Allah anriefen, nützten ihnen überhaupt nichts, als der Befehl deines Herrn eintraf; sie stürzten sie nur noch mehr ins Verderben.
ref: We did not wrong them; they wronged themselves. When your Lord's chastisement descended upon them, their gods, on whom they called apart from God, were not of the least avail, and all they did was only to add to their destruction.
draft: We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves; and their gods, whom they called upon instead of Allah, were of no avail to them at all when the command of your Lord arrived; they only increased their ruin.
hil: We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves, and their gods, whom they called upon instead of Allah, were of no avail to them at all when the command of your Lord arrived; it only increased their ruin.
compare: We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves; and their gods, whom they called upon instead of Allah, were of no avail to them at all when the command of your Lord arrived; they only increased their ruin.

src: Wahrlich, Allah hat Macht über alle Dinge.
ref: Indeed God has power over everything.
draft: Truly, Allah has power over all things.
hil: Truly, Allah has power over everything.
compare: Truly, Allah has power over all things.

src: Und es dann zu grauer Spreu macht.
ref: Then reduces them to rusty rubbish.
draft: And then it turns into gray chaff.
hil: And then it turns to gray chaff.
compare: And then it turns to gray chaff.

src: Ihr werdet doch, inscha-allah, Almasdschidil-haram betreten, sicher mit rasierten Häuptern oder mit kurzgeschnittenen (Haaren).
ref: If Allah so wills you shall certainly enter the Inviolable Mosque, in full security, you will shave your heads and cut your hair short, and do so without any fear.
draft: You will enter the Masjid al-Haram, God willing, surely with shaved heads or with short hair.
hil: {"output": "You will surely enter Al-Masjid al-Haram, God willing, with shaved heads or short hair."}
compare: {"output": "You will surely enter Al-Masjid al-Haram, God willing, with shaved heads or short hair."}

src: Diese werden freigesprochen von dem, was man (über sie) redet.
ref: Those are acquitted of what they say.
draft: They are acquitted of what is said (about them).
hil: They shall be acquitted of that which is being said about them.
compare: They shall be acquitted of that which is being said about them.

src: Und wenn das Wort über sie fällig wird, bringen Wir ihnen ein Tier aus der Erde hervor, das zu ihnen spricht; (dies), weil die Menschen von Unseren Zeichen nicht überzeugt sind.
ref: When the sentence will have been passed against them, We shall bring forth beastly brutes from the earth who will torment them, for men certainly do not believe Our signs.
draft: And when the word falls upon them, We will produce for them a creature from the earth speaking to them that the people were not certain of Our signs.
hil: And when the word befalls upon them, We bring forth for them a creature from the earth that speaks to them, because people are not convinced of Our signs.
compare: And when the word befalls upon them, We bring forth for them a creature from the earth that speaks to them, because people are not convinced of Our signs.

src: Und ich bin nicht Diener Dessen, was ihr gedient habt,
ref: Nor will I worship what you worship,
draft: And I am not a servant of what you have served.
hil: And I am not a servant of what you have served.
compare: And I am not a servant of what you have served.

src: ALLAH hat für sie Dschannat vorbereitet, die von Flüssen durchflossen werden.
ref: Allah has prepared for them Gardens beneath which rivers flow.
draft: ALLAH has prepared paradise for them, which is traversed by rivers.
hil: God has prepared gardens for them, beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever.
compare: God has prepared gardens for them, beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever.

src: Bei dem Morgen
ref: I CALL TO witness the early hours of morning,
draft: Bei dem Morgen -> In the morning
hil: In the morning
compare: Bei dem Morgen -> In the morning

src: Aber die Antwort seines Volkes war nur, daß sie sagten: "Tötet ihn oder verbrennt ihn." Da rettete Allah ihn aus dem Feuer.
ref: The people (of Abraham) had no answer except: "Kill him or burn him;" but God saved him from the fire.
draft: But his people's response was only to say, "Kill him or burn him." Then Allah saved him from the fire.
hil: But the response of his people was only to say, "Kill him or burn him." Allah saved him from the fire.
compare: But his people's response was only to say, "Kill him or burn him." Then Allah saved him from the fire.

src: Und ein Zauberer soll keinen Erfolg haben, woher er auch kommen mag."
ref: That which they have made is only a magician's trick, and the magician will never be successful, no matter whatever amount (of skill) he may attain."
draft: "And a wizard shall have no success, wherever he may come from."
hil: And a magician shall not have success, no matter where he comes from.
compare: And a magician shall not have success, no matter where he comes from.

src: Vortreffliche, die (alles) aufschreiben,
ref: Illustrious scribes
draft: Exquisite, those who write down (everything).
hil: Exquisite, those who write down (everything).
compare: Exquisite, those who write down (everything).

src: Er sagte: "Es (die Schätze) wurde mir nur um des Wissens willen, das ich besitze, gegeben."
ref: He said: "This has come to me through my own acumen."
draft: He said, "It (the treasures) was given to me only for the sake of the knowledge that I possess."
hil: He said, "It was only given to me for the sake of the knowledge that I possess."
compare: He said, "It was only given to me for the sake of the knowledge that I possess."

src: Das Verschieben (eines Haram-Monats) ist eine Steigerung von Kufr. Damit werden diejenigen irregeleitet, die Kufr betrieben haben. Sie erklären ihn in einem Jahr für einen Nicht-Haram-Monat und in einem anderen Jahr für einen Haram-Monat, um der Anzahl der von ALLAH festgelegten Haram-Monate zu entsprechen und dann für halal zu erklären, was ALLAH für haram erklärte. Ihnen wurde das Schlechte ihrer Handlungen als schön dargeboten. ALLAH leitet die Kafir-Leute nicht recht.
ref: Their postponing of the months is nothing but furtherance in disbelief – the disbelievers are misled by it – they decree it lawful in one year and regard it forbidden in another year, in order to equate to the number of the months which Allah has made sacred, and to make lawful what Allah has forbidden; their evil deeds seem good in their sight; and Allah does not guide the disbelievers.
draft: The postponement (of a Haram month) is an increase in Kufr. Thus, those who have done Kufr are led astray. They declare it to be a non-Haram month in one year and a Haram month in another year to correspond to the number of Haram months set by ALLAH, and then declare as halal what ALLAH has declared as haram. The badness of their actions has been presented to them as good. ALLAH does not guide the unfaithful people rightly.
hil: The postponement of a Haram month is an increase in Kufr, leading astray those who have committed Kufr. They declare it a non-Haram month in one year and a Haram month in another year, to correspond to the number of Haram months set by Allah, and then declare as halal what Allah has declared as haram. The badness of their deeds has been presented to them as good. Allah does not guide those who disbelieve rightly.
compare: The postponement (of a Haram month) is an increase in Kufr. Thus, those who have done Kufr are led astray. They declare it to be a non-Haram month in one year and a Haram month in another year to correspond to the number of Haram months set by ALLAH, and then declare as halal what ALLAH has declared as haram. The badness of their actions has been presented to them as good. ALLAH does not guide the unfaithful people rightly.

src: Er sprach: "O mein Volk, (ihr) seht nicht ein, daß ich einen klaren Beweis von meinem Herrn habe; und Er hat mir Seine Barmherzigkeit gewährt, die euch aber verborgen geblieben ist.
ref: He said: "O my people! Tell me, if I have a clear proof from my Lord, and a Mercy (Prophethood, etc.) has come to me from Him, but that (Mercy) has been obscured from your sight.
draft: He spoke: "O my people, you do not see that I have a clear proof from my Lord; and He has granted me His mercy, which has remained hidden from you.
hil: He said, "O my people, you do not understand that I have clear evidence from my Lord, and He has granted me His mercy, which has remained hidden from you."
compare: He spoke: "O my people, you do not see that I have a clear proof from my Lord; and He has granted me His mercy, which has remained hidden from you.

src: Gewiß, WIR entsandten dich mit der Wahrheit als Überbringer froher Botschaft und als Warner.
ref: We have sent you with the truth, to give glad tidings and to warn.
draft: Sure, WE have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good news and as a warner.
hil: We have sent you with the truth as a bearer of glad tidings and as a warner.
compare: Sure, WE have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good news and as a warner.

src: Selbst wenn ich zu meinem Herrn zurückgebracht werde, so werde ich ganz gewiß einen besseren Aufenthalt als diesen finden."
ref: And even if I am returned to my Lord, I will find something better than this in return.”
draft: "Even if I am brought back to my Lord, I will surely find a better abode than this."
hil: Even if I am returned to my Lord, I will surely find a better abode than this one.
compare: Even if I am returned to my Lord, I will surely find a better abode than this one.

src: Und Allahs ist, was in den Himmeln und was auf der Erde ist; Er verzeiht, wem Er will, und straft, wen Er will, und Allah ist Allverzeihend und Barmherzig.
ref: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth: He may pardon whom He please and punish whom He will. Yet God is forgiving and kind.
draft: "And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and Allah is forgiving and merciful."
hil: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.
compare: "And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and Allah is forgiving and merciful."

src: Dabei hatten sie sich vorher Gott gegenüber verpflichtet, sie würden nicht den Rücken kehren. Über die Verpflichtung Gott gegenüber wird Rechenschaft gefordert.
ref: Whereas earlier they had made a promise to God that they would never turn their backs; and a promise made to God is answerable.
draft: They had previously committed themselves to God that they would not turn their backs. Accountability is demanded for the commitment to God.
hil: Those who had previously pledged to God not to turn their backs are demanded accountability for their commitment to God.
compare: They had previously committed themselves to God that they would not turn their backs. Accountability is demanded for the commitment to God.

src: Bereits haben sie doch Musa um Größeres als dieses gebeten, sie sagten: "Zeige uns ALLAH offenkundig!" Dann erschlug sie der Blitz wegen ihrer Übertretung, dann nahmen sie sich das Kalb (als Götzen), nachdem zu ihnen die deutlichen Zeichen gekommen waren, dann haben WIR ihnen dies vergeben und ließen Musa einen eindeutigen Beweis zuteil werden.
ref: Of Moses they asked greater than that, they said to him: 'Show us Allah openly' And a thunderbolt took them for their evil doing. Then they took to themselves the calf, after the clear proofs had come to them, yet We forgave that and We gave Moses clear authority.
draft: They have already asked Musa for something greater than this, they said: "Show us ALLAH manifestly!" Then the lightning struck them because of their transgression, then they took the calf (as an idol), after the clear signs had come to them, then WE forgave them for this and gave Musa a clear proof.
hil: They have already asked Musa for something greater than this, they said: "Show us ALLAH manifestly!" Then the lightning struck them because of their transgression, then they took the calf (as an idol), after the clear signs had come to them, then WE forgave them for this and gave Musa a clear proof.
compare: They have already asked Musa for something greater than this, they said: "Show us ALLAH manifestly!" Then the lightning struck them because of their transgression, then they took the calf (as an idol), after the clear signs had come to them, then WE forgave them for this and gave Musa a clear proof.

src: Und so erweckten Wir sie auf, damit sie sich gegenseitig fragten.
ref: Even so We roused them that they may question one another.
draft: And so we raised them up, so that they could ask each other.
hil: We raised them up so that they could ask each other.
compare: And so we raised them up, so that they could ask each other.

src: Was ist Al-Haqqa?
ref: What is the concrete reality?
draft: What is Al-Haqqa?
hil: What is Al-Haqqa?
compare: What is Al-Haqqa?

src: ER sagte: "In Kürze werden sie es doch noch bereuen."
ref: Answered (the Lord): "They shall wake up repenting soon."
draft: He said, "Soon they will regret it."
hil: He said, "Soon they will regret it."
compare: He said, "Soon they will regret it."

src: Und wenn ein Teil von euch an das glauben sollte, womit ich gesandt worden bin, ein anderer Teil aber nicht glauben sollte, so geduldet euch, bis Allah zwischen uns richtet. Er ist der Beste derer, die richten."
ref: If some of you believe what has been sent through me, and some of you do not, have patience until God decide between us, for He is the best of all judges."
draft: "And if some of you should believe in what I have been sent with, while another part does not believe, then be patient until Allah judges between us. He is the best of judges."
hil: If some of you believe in what I have been sent with, while another part does not believe, then be patient until Allah judges between us. He is the best of judges.
compare: "And if some of you should believe in what I have been sent with, while another part does not believe, then be patient until Allah judges between us. He is the best of judges."

src: Verkündet ihr mir daß ich auferstehen soll, obwohl schon vor mir Geschlechter dahingegangen sind?" und (der ihnen, wenn) sie beide Allah zu Hilfe rufen (und zu ihm sagen): "Wehe dir, glaube!
ref: You promise me that I will be raised again whereas generations have passed away before me?” And they both seek Allah’s help and say to him, “May you be ruined, accept faith!
draft: "Announce to me that I should rise again, even though generations have passed before me?" and (to them, when) they both call upon Allah for help (and say to him): "Woe to you, believe!"
hil: Say to me, "Shall I inform you that you will be resurrected even though generations before me have passed away?" And to those who, when they both invoke Allah for help, say to them, "Woe unto you; have faith!"
compare: Say to me, "Shall I inform you that you will be resurrected even though generations before me have passed away?" And to those who, when they both invoke Allah for help, say to them, "Woe unto you; have faith!"

src: Gewiß, WIR sandten dir die Schrift für die Menschen der Wahrheit gemäß hinab. Wer also Rechtleitung findet, (tut es allein) für sich selbst, und wer irregeht, (tut es ausschließlich) gegen sich selbst. Und du bist über sie kein Wakil.
ref: We have indeed sent down this Book to you with the truth, in order to guide mankind; so whoever attains guidance has attained it is for his own good, and whoever strays, has strayed for his own harm; and you are not at all responsible for them.
draft: Certainly, WE sent down the scripture to you in truth for the people. So whoever is guided is guided for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray - only against himself. And you are not an administrator over them.
hil: We have certainly sent down to you the Book in truth for the people. So whoever is guided is guided for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever goes astray, only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager for them.
compare: Certainly, WE sent down the scripture to you in truth for the people. So whoever is guided is guided for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray - only against himself. And you are not an administrator over them.

src: Doch wenn sie sich abkehren, so wisse, daß Allah sie für einen Teil ihrer Sünden treffen will. Viele von den Menschen sind fürwahr Frevler.
ref: If they turn away, then know that God is sure to punish them for some of their sins; and many of them are transgressors.
draft: But if they turn away, know that Allah intends to afflict them for some of their sins. Indeed, many of the people are indeed transgressors.
hil: If they turn away, know that Allah intends to afflict them for some of their sins. Indeed, many of the people are truly transgressors.
compare: If they turn away, know that Allah intends to afflict them for some of their sins. Indeed, many of the people are truly transgressors.

src: Darin lag wahrhaftig eine schwere Prüfung von eurem HERRN!
ref: In this was a great trial from your Lord."
draft: Surely, therein was a severe test from your Lord!
hil: Surely, that was a great trial from your Lord.
compare: Surely, that was a great trial from your Lord.

src: Dein Herr ist schnell im Bestrafen, und Er ist voller Vergebung und barmherzig.
ref: Indeed your Lord's retribution is swift, yet He is forgiving and kind.
draft: Your Lord is quick to punish, yet He is full of forgiveness and mercy.
hil: Your Lord is quick to punish, yet He is full of forgiveness and mercy.
compare: Your Lord is quick to punish, yet He is full of forgiveness and mercy.

src: Hätte es doch aus den Generationen vor euch manche gegeben, die einsichtig waren, welche Verderben auf Erden verboten! Ausgenommen davon sind die Wenigen aus denen, die WIR erretteten.
ref: If only there had been men endued with virtue in the ages before you, who could preserve men from doing evil in the world, other than the few We saved from among them.
draft: If only there had been some among the generations before you who were wise, who understood what was forbidden on earth. Except for the few we saved, they are the exception.
hil: If only there had been some among the generations before you who were wise, who understood what destruction was prohibited on earth! Those saved by US are the exception.
compare: If only there had been some among the generations before you who were wise, who understood what destruction was prohibited on earth! Those saved by US are the exception.

src: Und Allah gehört die Herrschaft der Himmel und der Erde und dessen, was dazwischen ist, und zu Ihm ist der Ausgang.
ref: For to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is between them; to Him is the homecoming.
draft: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination [of all].
hil: To Allah belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and to Him is the final return.
compare: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination [of all].

src: Wenn sie es aber aus der Nähe sehen, dann werden die Gesichter derer, die ungläubig sind, schlimm betroffen. Und es wird gesprochen: «Das ist das, was ihr herbeizurufen suchtet.»
ref: So when they will see it close, the faces of the disbelievers will become ghastly, and it will be declared, “This is what you were demanding.”
draft: If they, however, see it up close, then the faces of those who are unbelievers will be badly affected. And it will be said: "This is what you've been summoning for."
hil: When they see it up close, the faces of the unbelievers will be deeply affected. And it will be said: 'This is what you have been summoning for.'
compare: If they, however, see it up close, then the faces of those who are unbelievers will be badly affected. And it will be said: "This is what you've been summoning for."

src: Und gewiß, bereits schickten WIR vor dir Gesandte zu ihren Leuten, dann kamen sie zu ihnen mit den klaren Zeichen, dann übten WIR Vergeltung an denjenigen, die schwere Verfehlungen begingen.
ref: Verily We sent many apostles before you to their people, who brought clear signs with them. Then We retributed those who were sinful.
draft: And certainly, We have sent messengers before you to their people, and they came to them with clear evidences. Then We took retribution from those who committed crimes.
hil: And indeed, We sent messengers before you to their respective peoples. They came to them with clear signs and We took retribution from those who committed grave sins.
compare: And indeed, We sent messengers before you to their respective peoples. They came to them with clear signs and We took retribution from those who committed grave sins.

src: Aber diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, erdichten Lügen gegen Gott, und die meisten von ihnen haben keinen Verstand.
ref: The unbelievers fabricate lies of God, for many of them are devoid of sense.
draft: But those who are unbelievers invent lies against God, and most of them have no understanding.
hil: Those who disbelieve invent lies against God, and most of them have no understanding.
compare: Those who disbelieve invent lies against God, and most of them have no understanding.

src: Er (Moses) sagte: " Er ist euer Herr und der Herr eurer Vorväter."
ref: (Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."
draft: He (Moses) said: "He is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers."
hil: He (Moses) said, "He is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers."
compare: He (Moses) said: "He is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers."

src: Sag: "Sterbt mit eurer Wut."
ref: Say: "Die of your rage.
draft: Say: "Die with your rage."
hil: Say, 'Die with your rage.'
compare: Say, 'Die with your rage.'

src: Doch ihr seid selten dankbar.
ref: Little thanks you give.
draft: But you are rarely grateful.
hil: But you are seldom grateful.
compare: But you are rarely grateful.

src: Es hielt auf dem Djudi an. Und es wurde gesprochen: «Weg mit den Leuten, die Unrecht tun!»
ref: The ark came to rest on Judi (Mount Ararat), and it was said: "Away with the cursed people!"
draft: It stopped at the Djudi. And it was said, "Away with people who do wrong!"
hil: It stopped at the Djudi. And it was said, 'Away with people who do wrong!'
compare: It stopped at the Djudi. And it was said, "Away with people who do wrong!"

src: Dazu hat Er sie erschaffen. Und so erfüllt sich das Wort deines Herrn: "Ich werde die Hölle ganz gewiß mit den Ginn und den Menschen allesamt füllen."
ref: To that end He created them, and perfectly is fulfilled the word of thy Lord: 'I shall assuredly fill Gehenna with jinn and men all together.'
draft: For this, He created her. And so the word of your Lord is fulfilled: "I will certainly fill Hell with jinn and all mankind."
hil: He created her for this purpose. And thus the word of your Lord is fulfilled: "I will undoubtedly fill Hell with jinn and all mankind."
compare: He created her for this purpose. And thus the word of your Lord is fulfilled: "I will undoubtedly fill Hell with jinn and all mankind."

src: Die Sonne und der Mond (laufen) nach Berechnung.
ref: The sun and moon revolve to a computation;
draft: The sun and the moon (run) according to calculation.
hil: The sun and the moon run according to calculation.
compare: The sun and the moon (run) according to calculation.

src: Und wer (dies) nicht aufbringen kann, fastet an zwei aufeinanderfolgenden Monaten als Reue vor ALLAH.
ref: Then whosoever findeth not the wherewithal, on him is the fasting for two months in succession: a penance from Allah.
draft: And whoever is not able to do so, should fast for two consecutive months as repentance before ALLAH.
hil: Whoever is unable to do so, must fast for two consecutive months as repentance before Allah.
compare: Whoever is unable to do so, must fast for two consecutive months as repentance before Allah.

src: Und Wir ließen die Kinder Israels das Meer überqueren.
ref: And We led the Children of Isra'il across the sea.
draft: And We let the Children of Israel cross the sea.
hil: We let the Children of Israel cross the sea.
compare: And We let the Children of Israel cross the sea.

src: Allah weiß, daß ihr an sie denken werdet.
ref: God knows that you will be thinking about them.
draft: Allah knows that you will think of them.
hil: Allah knows that you will be thinking of them.
compare: Allah knows that you will think of them.

src: Darin werden sie auf ewig weilen.
ref: They will abide in them for ever.
draft: They will dwell there forever.
hil: They will abide therein eternally.
compare: They will dwell there forever.

src: Unzweifelhaft kennt Allah, was sie verbergen und was sie kundtun. Wahrlich, Er liebt die Hochmütigen nicht.
ref: Certainly Allah knows what they hide and what they disclose; indeed He does not like the proud.
draft: Undoubtedly Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Truly, He does not love the arrogant.
hil: Undoubtedly Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Truly, He does not love the arrogant.
compare: Undoubtedly Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Truly, He does not love the arrogant.

src: Meint ihr etwa, ihr würdet verlassen sein, wo Allah doch noch nicht jene von euch gezeichnet hat, die (in Seiner Sache) kämpfen und sich keinen zum Vertrauten nehmen außer Allah und Seinen Gesandten und die Gläubigen?
ref: Do you think you will get away before God knows who among you fought and did not take anyone but God, His Apostle and the faithful, as their friends?
draft: Do you think you would be left alone when Allah has not yet distinguished those among you who strive hard in His cause and do not take anyone as intimate friends besides Allah, His Messenger, and the believers?
hil: Do you think you will be left alone, while Allah has not yet distinguished those among you who strive hard in His cause and do not take anyone as close friends besides Allah, His Messenger, and the believers?
compare: Do you think you will be left alone, while Allah has not yet distinguished those among you who strive hard in His cause and do not take anyone as close friends besides Allah, His Messenger, and the believers?

src: Als das Land dann trotz seiner Weite ihnen eng erschien, ihre Seelen unter Beklemmung litten und sie wußten, daß es keine Zuflucht vor ALLAH gibt außer (der reuigen Umkehr) zu Ihm, dann verhalf ER ihnen zur Reue, damit sie bereuen.
ref: Then, when the earth, as vast as it is, closed in on them, and their very souls closed in on them, and they realized that there was no refuge from God, except in Him, He redeemed them, so that they may repent.
draft: When the land then seemed narrow to them despite its vastness, their souls suffered from oppression and they knew that there was no refuge from Allah except to turn back to Him in repentance, then He helped them to repent, so that they may repent.
hil: When the land then seemed narrow to them despite its vastness, their souls suffered from oppression and they knew that there was no refuge from Allah except to turn back to Him in repentance, then He helped them to repent so that they may repent.
compare: When the land then seemed narrow to them despite its vastness, their souls suffered from oppression and they knew that there was no refuge from Allah except to turn back to Him in repentance, then He helped them to repent so that they may repent.

src: ER gewährt Weisheit, wem ER will.
ref: He gives wisdom to whomever He wills.
draft: "He grants wisdom to whom he wills."
hil: He gives wisdom to whom He wills.
compare: "He grants wisdom to whom he wills."

src: Die Entscheidung liegt nur bei Allah. Er legt die Wahrheit dar, und Er ist der beste Richter."
ref: He relates the truth, and He is the Best of deciders.'
draft: "The decision lies only with Allah. He presents the truth and He is the best judge."
hil: The decision lies only with God. He presents the truth and He is the best judge.
compare: "The decision lies only with Allah. He presents the truth and He is the best judge."

src: Das ist eine Erinnerung für die, die (Gottes) gedenken.
ref: This is a reminder for those who are observant.
draft: This is a reminder for those who remember (God).
hil: This is a reminder for those who remember (God).
compare: This is a reminder for those who remember (God).

src: Also erbärmlich ist die Bleibe der Arroganten."
ref: How grievous a destination for the haughty!
draft: Also miserable is the abode of the arrogant.
hil: Thus miserable is the dwelling place of the arrogant.
compare: Thus miserable is the dwelling place of the arrogant.

src: Und Wir ließen einen Regen auf sie niedergehen; wie böse war der Regen für diejenigen, die gewarnt worden waren!
ref: And rained on them a shower (of Stones). How terrible was the rain (that fell) on those who had been warned!
draft: And We sent down rain upon them; how evil was the rain of those who had been warned!
hil: And We sent down rain upon them; how evil was the rain for those who had been warned!
compare: And We sent down rain upon them; how evil was the rain of those who had been warned!

src: Keineswegs! Beim Mond
ref: I say the truth, and call the moon to witness,
draft: By no means! At the moon.
hil: Certainly not! By the moon.
compare: Certainly not! By the moon.

src: Hast du nicht gesehen, daß Allah Wasser vom Himmel herniedersendet?
ref: Have you not seen that it is Allah Who causes the water to descend from the sky?
draft: Did you not see that Allah sends water down from the sky?
hil: Did you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky?
compare: Did you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky?

src: Dann verbarg er Furcht vor ihnen. Sie sagten: "Fürchte dich nicht!"
ref: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them.
draft: Then he concealed his fear from them. They said, "Do not be afraid!"
hil: He concealed his fear from them. They said, 'Do not be afraid!'
compare: Then he concealed his fear from them. They said, "Do not be afraid!"

src: Nennt sie nach ihren Vätern; das ist gerechter vor Allah.
ref: Call them by the names of their fathers. This is the right course in the sight of God.
draft: "Call them by their fathers; that is more just before Allah."
hil: Call them by their fathers; that is more just before Allah.
compare: "Call them by their fathers; that is more just before Allah."

src: Ich habe ihnen nichts gesagt außer dem, womit DU mich beauftragt hast: Dient ALLAH, meinem HERRN und eurem HERRN. Und ich war Zeuge über sie, solange ich unter ihnen weilte.
ref: I only said to them what Thou didst command me: "Serve God, my Lord and your Lord."
draft: I have not told them anything except what YOU have commissioned me with: Serve ALLAH, my LORD and your LORD. And I was a witness over them as long as I stayed among them.
hil: I told them nothing except what YOU commissioned me with: Serve ALLAH, my LORD and your LORD. And I was a witness over them as long as I stayed among them.
compare: I told them nothing except what YOU commissioned me with: Serve ALLAH, my LORD and your LORD. And I was a witness over them as long as I stayed among them.

src: Auch wenn ein Koran käme, mit dem die Berge versetzt oder die Erde zerstückelt oder zu den Toten gesprochen werden könnte... Nein, bei der ganzen Angelegenheit hat Gott allein zu entscheiden. Wissen denn diejenigen, die glauben, nicht, daß Gott, wenn Er wollte, die Menschen alle rechtleiten würde? Diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, wird immer eine Katastrophe treffen für das, was sie gemacht haben, oder sie wird in der Nähe ihrer Wohnstätten niedergehen, bis das Versprechen Gottes eintrifft. Und Gott bricht das Versprechen nicht.
ref: And were such a Qur’an to come that would cause the mountains to move, or the earth to split asunder, or the dead to speak, even then these disbelievers would not believe; in fact, all matters are only at Allah’s discretion; so have not the Muslims despaired in that, had Allah willed, He would have guided all mankind? Disasters shall continue to strike the disbelievers on account of their deeds, or descend near their homes until Allah’s promise comes; indeed Allah does not break the promise.
draft: Even if a Quran came, by which the mountains were moved, or the earth was cleft, or the dead were spoken to... No, in this matter, God alone decides. Do those who believe not know that if God had willed, He would have guided all mankind? As for those who disbelieve, disaster will not cease to strike them for what they have done — or it will fall close to their homes — until God's promise is fulfilled. Verily, Allah will not fail in His promise.
hil: To Him is your return, all together - a true promise from Allah. Indeed, He initiates the creation, then repeats it, so that He may reward those who believe and do good deeds in a fair manner. But for those who committed unbelief, there is a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment for what they used to do.
compare: Even if a Quran came, by which the mountains were moved, or the earth was cleft, or the dead were spoken to... No, in this matter, God alone decides. Do those who believe not know that if God had willed, He would have guided all mankind? As for those who disbelieve, disaster will not cease to strike them for what they have done — or it will fall close to their homes — until God's promise is fulfilled. Verily, Allah will not fail in His promise.

src: Und (eines Tages) trat er in die Stadt, ohne von ihren Einwohnern bemerkt zu werden, dann fand er zwei Männer, die gegeneinander kämpften, dieser gehörte seiner Partei an und jener war von seinen Feinden, dann bat ihn derjenige, der seiner Partei angehörte, um Hilfe gegen denjenigen, der von seinen Feinden war, dann schlug Musa mit der Faust auf ihn, dann tötete er ihn. Er sagte: "Dies ist vom Werk des Satans, gewiß, er ist ein verleitender, entschiedener Feind."
ref: And he entered the city when its inhabitants were sleeping unaware in the afternoon – he therefore found two men fighting; one was from Moosa’s group, and the other from among his enemies; so the one who was of Moosa’s group pleaded to Moosa for help against him who was of his enemies – therefore Moosa punched him thereby finishing him; he said, “This act was from the devil*; indeed he is an open enemy, a misleader.” (* The act of oppressing the man from Bani Israel).
draft: And (one day) he entered the city without being noticed by its inhabitants, then he found two men fighting against each other, one of them belonged to his party and the other was from his enemies, then the one who belonged to his party asked him for help against the one who was from his enemies, then Musa hit him with his fist, then he killed him. He said: "This is from the work of Satan, indeed, he is a misleading, determined enemy."
hil: And (one day) he entered the city without being noticed by its inhabitants. Then he found two men fighting each other, one from his group and the other from his enemies. Then the one who belonged to his party asked Musa for help against the one who was from his enemies. Musa hit him with his fist and killed him. He said, 'This is of Satan's doing,' he surely is a misleading, determined enemy.
compare: And (one day) he entered the city without being noticed by its inhabitants, then he found two men fighting against each other, one of them belonged to his party and the other was from his enemies, then the one who belonged to his party asked him for help against the one who was from his enemies, then Musa hit him with his fist, then he killed him. He said: "This is from the work of Satan, indeed, he is a misleading, determined enemy."

src: Da wurden ihre Herzen versiegelt, so daß sie nicht begreifen.
ref: So their hearts were sealed; and now they do not understand.
draft: Their hearts were sealed so that they don't understand.
hil: Their hearts were sealed so that they do not understand.
compare: Their hearts were sealed so that they do not understand.

src: Dies sind Allahs Zeichen, die Wir dir der Wahrheit entsprechend verlesen. Und du bist wahrlich einer der Gesandten.
ref: These are the messages of God. We recite them to you in all truth, as indeed you are one of the apostles.
draft: These are the signs of Allah that We recite to you in truth. And you are truly one of the messengers.
hil: These are the signs of Allah, which We recite to you in truth. And you are truly one of the messengers.
compare: These are the signs of Allah that We recite to you in truth. And you are truly one of the messengers.

src: Und keiner ist unter euch, der nicht daran vorbeikommen wird das ist eine von deinem Herrn beschlossene Fügung.
ref: There is not one among you who will not reach it. Your Lord has made this incumbent on Himself.
draft: And none of you is there who will not pass by it; this is, with thy Lord, a Decree which cannot be reversed.
hil: No one among you will pass by it without this being a decree from your Lord; and indeed, that which is with Allah is a great reward for those who believe and do good deeds.
compare: And none of you is there who will not pass by it; this is, with thy Lord, a Decree which cannot be reversed.

src: Viele von den Besitzern des Buches möchten euch, nachdem ihr gläubig geworden seid, gern wieder zu Ungläubigen machen, aus Neid in ihren Seelen, nachdem ihnen die Wahrheit klar gemacht wurde. Doch vergebt und seid nachsichtig, bis Allah Seine Entscheidung ergehen läßt. Wahrlich, Allah hat zu allem die Macht.
ref: Many among People given the Book(s) wished to turn you to disbelief after you had accepted faith; out of hearts’ envy, after the truth has become very clear to them; so leave them and be tolerant, until Allah brings His command; indeed Allah is Able to do all things.
draft: Many of the owners of the book would like to make you, after you have become believers, again unbelievers, out of envy in their souls, after the truth has been made clear to them. But forgive and be lenient until Allah issues His decision. Truly, Allah has power over all things.
hil: Many of those who believe in the Book wish they could turn you back to disbelief after you have believed, out of envy in their souls, even though the truth has become clear to them. But forgive and overlook until Allah accomplishes His command. Surely, Allah has power over all things.
