src: Sag: "Ich sage euch nicht, daß ich über dieMagazine von ALLAHs (Rizq) verfüge. Auch kenne ich das Verborgene nicht.
ref: Tell them: "I do not say that I possess the treasures of God, or have knowledge of the Unknown, or that I am an angel.
draft: Say: "I do not tell you that I have control over the treasures of Allah (Rizq). Nor do I know the unknowable.
hil: Say, 'I do not claim that I have control over Allah's (Rizq) treasuries. Nor do I know the unseen.'
compare: Say, 'I do not claim that I have control over Allah's (Rizq) treasuries. Nor do I know the unseen.'

src: Wahrlich, der Messias, Jesus, Sohn der Maria, ist nur der Gesandte Allahs und Sein Wort, das Er Maria entboten hat, und von Seinem Geist. Darum glaubt an Allah und Seine Gesandten, und sagt nicht: "Drei."
ref: The Messiah 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary), was (no more than) a Messenger of Allah and His Word, ("Be!" - and he was) which He bestowed on Maryam (Mary) and a spirit (Ruh) created by Him; so believe in Allah and His Messengers.
draft: Truly, the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, is only the messenger of Allah and His word that He conveyed to Mary, and a spirit from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers, and do not say "Three".
hil: Truly, the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, is only the messenger of Allah and His word that He conveyed to Mary, and a spirit from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers, and do not say "Three".
compare: Truly, the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, is only the messenger of Allah and His word that He conveyed to Mary, and a spirit from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers, and do not say "Three".

src: Wenn wir und unsere Väter zu Staub geworden sind, sollen wir dann wirklich wieder hervorgebracht werden?
ref: When we and our fathers have become dust shall we be raised [from the dead]?
draft: If we and our fathers have turned to dust, will we really be brought forth again?
hil: If we and our fathers have turned to dust, how shall we be raised again?
compare: If we and our fathers have turned to dust, will we really be brought forth again?

src: Und sie sagen: "Sollen wir etwa, wenn wir (bereits) Knochen und Überreste geworden sind, denn wirklich als neue Schöpfung auferweckt werden?"
ref: Yet they say: "When we are turned to bones and bits, shall we be raised as a new creation?"
draft: And they say, "Shall we then, when we have become bones and decayed remnants, indeed be resurrected as a new creation?"
hil: They say, "Shall we really be resurrected as a new creation when we have become bones and decayed remnants?"
compare: And they say, "Shall we then, when we have become bones and decayed remnants, indeed be resurrected as a new creation?"

src: Die Barmherzigkeit Gottes ist den Rechtschaffenen nahe.
ref: The blessing of God is at hand for those who do good.
draft: The mercy of God is near to the righteous.
hil: The mercy of God is close to the righteous.
compare: The mercy of God is near to the righteous.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Fügt euch ALLAH und dem Gesandten, wenn er euch zu dem aufruft, was euch lebendig macht. Und wisst, daß ALLAH gewiß dem Menschen die Verfügung über sein Inneres verwehren kann und daß ihr gewiß zu Ihm versammelt werdet.
ref: O believers, respond to God and the Messenger when He calls you unto that which will give you life; and know that God stands between a man and his heart, and that to Him you shall be mustered.
draft: You who have internalized the Imam! Submit to Allah and the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah can certainly deny man the control over his inner self and that you will certainly gather before Him.
hil: O you who have internalized faith! Submit to Allah and His Messenger when he calls you to what gives you life. And know that Allah can certainly deny man the control over his inner self and that you will certainly be gathered before Him.
compare: O you who have internalized faith! Submit to Allah and His Messenger when he calls you to what gives you life. And know that Allah can certainly deny man the control over his inner self and that you will certainly be gathered before Him.

src: Und sollten sie dem Salam zugeneigt sein, dann sei ihm ebenfalls zugeneigt und übe ALLAH gegenüber Tawakkul! ER ist gewiß Der Allhörende, Der Allwissende.
ref: But if they are inclined to peace, make peace with them, and have trust in God, for He hears all and knows everything.
draft: And if you are inclined towards the Salam, then be inclined towards it, and exercise Tawakkul towards ALLAH! He is certainly the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
hil: If they are inclined towards peace, then be inclined towards it, and put your trust in Allah! He is certainly the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
compare: If they are inclined towards peace, then be inclined towards it, and put your trust in Allah! He is certainly the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

src: Dann erfüllten WIR ihnen das Versprechen und erretteten sie und diejenigen, die WIR wollten, und richteten die Maßlosen zugrunde.
ref: Then We made Our promise good to them and delivered whomsoever We pleased, and destroyed the transgressors.
draft: Then we fulfilled the promise to them and saved them and those whom we wanted and destroyed the transgressors.
hil: Then we fulfilled the promise to them and saved them and those whom we wanted and destroyed the transgressors.
compare: Then we fulfilled the promise to them and saved them and those whom we wanted and destroyed the transgressors.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Gehorcht ALLAH und gehorcht dem Gesandten und laßt eure Handlungen nicht nichtig werden!
ref: O you who believe, obey God and the Prophet, and do not waste your deeds.
draft: You, who have internalized the Imam! Obey ALLAH and obey the messenger and do not let your actions become void!
hil: Those who have internalized the faith! Obey ALLAH and obey the messenger and do not let your actions become void!
compare: You, who have internalized the Imam! Obey ALLAH and obey the messenger and do not let your actions become void!

src: Heute versiegeln WIR ihnen ihre Münder, und zu Uns sprechen dann ihre Hände, auch ihre Beine legen Zeugnis ab für das, was sie zu erwerben pflegten.
ref: We shall seal their lips that day; and their hands will speak, their feet testify to what they had done.
draft: Today, WE seal their mouths, and then their hands speak to Us, and even their legs testify to what they used to acquire.
hil: Today, we seal their mouths and their hands speak to us, and even their legs testify to what they used to acquire.
compare: Today, we seal their mouths and their hands speak to us, and even their legs testify to what they used to acquire.

src: Du bist nichts (anderes) als ein Mensch wie wir. So bringe ein Zeichen, wenn du zu den Wahrhaftigen gehörst."
ref: “You are just a human like us; therefore bring some sign if you are truthful.”
draft: "You are nothing but a human like us. So bring a sign if you belong to the truthful."
hil: You are nothing but a human like us. So bring a sign if you belong to the truthful.
compare: "You are nothing but a human like us. So bring a sign if you belong to the truthful."

src: Und derjenige, der zu seinen Eltern sagt: "Pfui über euch!
ref: And the one who said to his parents, “Uff – I am fed up with both of you! What!
draft: And the one who says to his parents: "Shame on you!
hil: And whoever says to his parents, 'Shame on you!'
compare: And whoever says to his parents, 'Shame on you!'

src: Und sei nicht laut beim Gebet, und auch nicht leise dabei.
ref: (Muhammad), do not be too loud or slow in your prayer.
draft: And do not be loud during prayer, nor too quiet.
hil: And do not be loud during prayer, not too quiet either.
compare: And do not be loud during prayer, not too quiet either.

src: Es wurde von dem einen angenommen und von dem anderen nicht angenommen. Der sagte: «Ich schlage dich tot.»
ref: God accepted the sacrifice of one of them (Abel) but not that of the other (Cain) who then said to his brother, "I shall certainly kill you."
draft: It was accepted by one and not accepted by the other. The latter said, "I'll kill you."
hil: It was accepted by one and not accepted by the other. The latter said, "I'll kill you."
compare: It was accepted by one and not accepted by the other. The latter said, "I'll kill you."

src: Sie sind bei ALLAH nicht gleich!
ref: They are not equal before Allah.
draft: You are not equal to Allah!
hil: You are not equal to Allah!
compare: You are not equal to Allah!

src: Und der, der zu seinen Eltern sagt: «Pfui über euch! Wollt ihr denn mir versprechen, ich würde hervorgebracht werden, wo vor mir Generationen dahingegangen sind?»...
ref: But he who says to his parents: "Shame on you: You intimidate me that I will be resurrected when many generations will have passed before me?"
draft: "And the one who says to his parents: 'Shame on you! Do you promise me that I will be brought forth when generations before me have passed away?'"
hil: And the one who says to his parents: 'Shame on you! Do you promise me to be brought forth where generations before me have passed away?'
compare: And the one who says to his parents: 'Shame on you! Do you promise me to be brought forth where generations before me have passed away?'

src: Das ist die Bedeutung dessen, was du nicht in Geduld zu ertragen vermöchtest."
ref: So, I did not do that of my own accord. This is the explanation of things you could not bear with patience."
draft: "This is the meaning of what you cannot bear patiently."
hil: This is the meaning of what you cannot bear patiently.
compare: "This is the meaning of what you cannot bear patiently."

src: Und Allah ist wahrlich Allwissend und Nachsichtig.
ref: Verily God is all-knowing and forbearing.
draft: And Allah is truly All-Knowing and Forgiving.
hil: And Allah is truly All-Knowing and Forbearing.
compare: And Allah is truly All-Knowing and Forgiving.

src: Und sie sagen: "Wir glauben an Allah und an den Gesandten, und wir gehorchen."
ref: They say, 'We believe in God and the Messenger, and we obey.'
draft: And they say, "We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey."
hil: And they say, 'We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey.'
compare: And they say, "We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey."

src: Er sagte: "Bei ALLAH!
ref: He said: "By Allah!
draft: He said: "By Allah!"
hil: He said, 'By Allah!'
compare: He said: "By Allah!"

src: Es gibt unter ihnen aber auch manche, die, wenn du ihnen (nur) einen Dinar anvertraust, ihn dir nicht (wieder) aushändigen, es sei denn, du bist ständig hinter ihnen her. Dies, weil sie sagen: "Gegen uns kann man der Schriftunkundigen wegen nicht vorgehen".
ref: 6 lbs.), will return it to you, and there are others, who, if you trust him with a dinar will not hand it back unless you stand over him, for they say: 'As for the common people, they have no recourse to us' They say lies against Allah while they know.
draft: There are also some among them who, if you entrust them with only one dinar, will not give it back to you unless you are constantly after them. This is because they say, "You cannot take action against us because of the ignorant."
hil: Some of them are also among those who, if you entrust them with only one dinar, will not give it back to you unless you are constantly after them. They say this because they believe that no action can be taken against them because of their lack of knowledge of scripture.
compare: Some of them are also among those who, if you entrust them with only one dinar, will not give it back to you unless you are constantly after them. They say this because they believe that no action can be taken against them because of their lack of knowledge of scripture.

src: Diejenigen aber, die Widerwillen zeigen und sich hochmütig verhalten, wird Er mit einer schmerzhaften Pein peinigen. Und sie werden für sich anstelle Gottes weder Freund noch Helfer finden.
ref: He will bestow upon those who have been disdainful and arrogant a painful chastisement; and they will find for themselves neither a guardian nor a helper besides Allah.
draft: But those who show reluctance and behave arrogantly, He will punish with painful torment. And they will find neither a friend nor helper for themselves instead of Allah.
hil: And those who show reluctance and behave arrogantly, He will punish with painful torment. And they will not find, besides Allah, any protector or helper for themselves.
compare: And those who show reluctance and behave arrogantly, He will punish with painful torment. And they will not find, besides Allah, any protector or helper for themselves.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist mein HERR und euer HERR.
ref: Surely God is my Lord and your Lord; so serve Him.
draft: Sure, ALLAH is my Lord and your Lord.
hil: Surely, ALLAH is my Lord and your Lord.
compare: Sure, ALLAH is my Lord and your Lord.

src: Er läßt die Nacht in den Tag eindringen, und Er läßt den Tag in die Nacht eindringen. Und Er hat die Sonne und den Mond dienstbar gemacht - ein jedes läuft auf eine festgesetzte Frist zu. Dies ist doch Allah, euer Herr; Ihm gehört die Herrschaft. Diejenigen aber, die ihr anstatt Seiner anruft, verfügen nicht einmal über das Häutchen eines Dattelkerns.
ref: He brings the night in a part of the day and He brings the day in a part of the night; and He has subjected the sun and moon; each one runs to its fixed term; such is Allah, your Lord – only His is the kingship; and those whom you worship instead of Him do not own even the husk of a date-seed.
draft: He causes the night to penetrate the day, and He causes the day to penetrate the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon - each to run its course for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. But those who invoke instead of Allah do not possess [even] a [grain of] seed husk.
hil: He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night. He has made the sun and the moon subservient, [each] running its course for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. But those who invoke other than Allah do not possess [even] a [grain of] seed husk.
compare: He causes the night to penetrate the day, and He causes the day to penetrate the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon - each to run its course for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. But those who invoke instead of Allah do not possess [even] a [grain of] seed husk.

src: Und ER fand dich irrend, so leitete ER dich recht.
ref: Did He not find you perplexed, and show you the way?
draft: And HE found you wandering, so HE guided you right.
hil: And HE found you wandering, so HE guided you right.
compare: And HE found you wandering, so HE guided you right.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir haben zugehört und uns widersetzt." So wurde in ihren Herzen (die Zuneigung) zum Kalb wegen ihres Kufr eingeprägt.
ref: They said, 'We hear, and rebel'; and they were made to drink the Calf in their hearts for their unbelief.
draft: They said, "We listened and resisted." Thus, in their hearts, affection for the calf was imprinted due to their Kufr.
hil: They said, "We listened and resisted." Thus, their hearts were imprinted with an affection for the calf because of their disbelief.
compare: They said, "We listened and resisted." Thus, their hearts were imprinted with an affection for the calf because of their disbelief.

src: Und keiner begeht mehr Unrecht als derjenige, der Lügen im Namen ALLAHs erfindet oder Seine Ayat ableugnet.
ref: Who could be more wicked than he who imputes lies to God or denies His revelations?
draft: And no one commits more injustice than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah or denies His signs.
hil: And who is more unjust than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah or denies His signs?
compare: And no one commits more injustice than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah or denies His signs.

src: Und von den Satanen gab es welche, die für ihn tauchten und andere Arbeit als diese verrichten.
ref: And of the devils were some that dived for him, and performed other, lesser tasks.
draft: And among the Satans there were some who dived for him and did other work than this.
hil: And among the Satans, there were some who dived for him and did other work than this.
compare: And among the Satans there were some who dived for him and did other work than this.

src: Erwarten Sie denn etwas anderes, als daß die Engel zu ihnen kommen, oder daß der Befehl deines Herrn eintrifft? So handelten auch diejenigen, die vor ihnen lebten.
ref: What! Do the (unbelievers) expect that the angels should descend, or the sentence of your Lord come to pass?
draft: Do you expect anything other than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives? This is how those who lived before them acted as well.
hil: Do you expect anything else than that the angels come to them or that the command of your Lord arrives? This is how those who lived before them acted.
compare: Do you expect anything other than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives? This is how those who lived before them acted as well.

src: Er sagte: "Ja! Und gewiß, ihr werdet dann doch von den Vertrauten sein."
ref: He said, “Yes, and you will then become close to me.”
draft: He said, "Yes! And certainly, you will then be among the trusted ones."
hil: He said, "Yes! And surely, you will then be among the trusted ones."
compare: He said, "Yes! And certainly, you will then be among the trusted ones."

src: Das sind ja nichts als Fabeln der Früheren."
ref: This is only the tales of the ancients!"
draft: "That's nothing but the fables of the ancients."
hil: "These are nothing but myths of the past."
compare: "These are nothing but myths of the past."

src: Und die Ungläubigen werden in Scharen zu Gahannam geführt werden, bis daß, wenn sie sie erreichen, sich ihre Pforten öffnen und ihre Wächter zu ihnen sprechen: "Sind nicht Gesandte aus eurer Mitte zu euch gekommen, um euch die Verse eures Herrn zu verlesen und euch vor dem Eintreffen dieses euren Tages zu warnen?"
ref: The unbelievers will be driven into Hell in groups till, when they reach it and its doors are opened up, its keepers will say to them: "Did not apostles of your own come to you reciting your Lord's revelations, warning you of this your day of Doom?"
draft: And the unbelievers will be led in groups to Gahannam until, when they reach it, its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them: "Have not messengers from your own midst come to you, reciting the verses of your Lord to you and warning you of the arrival of this day of yours?"
hil: The unbelievers will be led in groups to Gehenna. And when they arrive, its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them: "Did not apostles come to you from among you, communicating the signs of your Lord to you, bringing warnings of this your day (of Doom)?"
compare: And the unbelievers will be led in groups to Gahannam until, when they reach it, its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them: "Have not messengers from your own midst come to you, reciting the verses of your Lord to you and warning you of the arrival of this day of yours?"

src: Und Gott genügt als Freund, und Gott genügt als Helfer.
ref: Sufficieth Allah as a Friend and sufficieth Allah as a Helper.
draft: "And God suffices as a friend, and God suffices as a helper."
hil: And Allah suffices as a friend, and Allah suffices as a helper.
compare: "And God suffices as a friend, and God suffices as a helper."

src: Beinahe hätte er uns doch von unseren Gottheiten abirren lassen, hätten wir uns nicht in Geduld ihnen gegenüber geübt!" Und sie werden wissen, wenn sie die Peinigung sehen, wer weiter vom Weg abgeirrt ist.
ref: “Possibly he would have misled us away from our Gods had we not been firm upon them”; soon they will know, when they see the punishment, who was astray from the path.
draft: He almost made us deviate from our deities, had we not practiced patience towards them! "And they will know, when they see the torment, who has strayed further from the path.
hil: He would have almost led us astray from our deities had we not practiced patience towards them! And they will know, when they see the torment, who has strayed further from the path.
compare: He would have almost led us astray from our deities had we not practiced patience towards them! And they will know, when they see the torment, who has strayed further from the path.

src: Es ist für euch kein Vergehen, unbewohnte Häuser zu betreten, in denen sich eine Nutznießung für euch befindet. Und Gott weiß, was ihr offenlegt und was ihr verschweigt.
ref: There is no harm in going into uninhabited houses where there is some convenience for you, as God has knowledge of what you hide and what you disclose.
draft: It is not a sin for you to enter uninhabited houses in which there is a benefit for you. And God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
hil: It is no sin for you to enter uninhabited houses in which there is a benefit for you. And God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
compare: It is not a sin for you to enter uninhabited houses in which there is a benefit for you. And God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

src: Die Zurückgebliebenen werden sagen: "Wenn ihr zu den Beutegütern aufbrecht, um sie einzunehmen, dann laßt uns euch folgen!" Sie wollen ALLAHs Worte ändern.
ref: The Bedouins who were left behind will say, when you set forth after spoils, to take them, 'Let us follow you,' desiring to change God's words.
draft: The backward ones will say: "If you set out to take possession of the spoils, then let us follow you!" They want to change the words of Allah.
hil: The ones who stayed behind will say: "When you set out to take possession of the spoils that you intend to capture, then let us follow you!" They intend to alter the words of Allah.
compare: The ones who stayed behind will say: "When you set out to take possession of the spoils that you intend to capture, then let us follow you!" They intend to alter the words of Allah.

src: Da ergriff sie Allah für ihre Sünden, und sie hatten vor Allah keinen Beschützer.
ref: Yet they were seized by God for their sins, and had none to protect them against God.
draft: Then Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector against Allah.
hil: Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector against Allah.
compare: Then Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector against Allah.

src: Eignet euch euer Vermögen untereinander nicht durch das für nichtig Erklärte an! Nicht verboten ist es, (es euch anzueignen) durch einen Handel, den ihr in gegenseitigem Einvernehmen abschließt.
ref: Eat not up your property among yourselves unjustly except it be a trade amongst you, by mutual consent.
draft: Do not acquire your property among each other through invalid means! It is not prohibited to acquire it through a trade that you conclude by mutual agreement.
hil: Do not acquire your wealth among each other through means declared void! It is not prohibited to acquire it by means of a trade that you conclude by mutual agreement.
compare: Do not acquire your property among each other through invalid means! It is not prohibited to acquire it through a trade that you conclude by mutual agreement.

src: Ich wußte für euch von keinem anderen Gott außer mir! Also Haman behandle meinetwegen die Erde mit Feuer und lasse für mich einen Turm errichten!
ref: I know not that ye have a god other than me, so kindle for me (a fire), O Haman, to bake the mud; and set up for me a lofty tower in order that I may survey the god of Moses; and lo!
draft: I knew of no other god for you except me! So, for my sake, let Haman burn the earth and build a tower for me!
hil: I knew of no other god for you except me! Let Haman, for my sake, burn the earth and build a tower for me!
compare: I knew of no other god for you except me! Let Haman, for my sake, burn the earth and build a tower for me!

src: Und wisset, daß der Gesandte Allahs unter euch ist. Würde er sich in so vielen Dingen nach euren Wünschen richten, würdet ihr sicher in Bedrängnis kommen; jedoch Allah hat euch den Glauben lieb gemacht und sehr begehrenswert für eure Herzen; und Er hat euch Unglauben, Widersetzlichkeit und Ungehorsam verabscheuenswert gemacht.
ref: Know that the Apostle of God is among you: If he agreed with you in most matters you would surely come to grief. But God has made faith more desirable to you, and attractive to your hearts, and rendered disbelief and sin and disobedience repugnant.
draft: And know that the Messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to comply with you in much of the matter, you would surely be in trouble; but Allah has endeared the faith to you and has adorned it in your hearts, and made disbelief, evil conduct and disobedience hateful to you.
hil: And know that the Messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to comply with you in many matters, you would certainly be in distress. However, Allah has made faith beloved to you and adorned it in your hearts, and made disbelief, disobedience, and rebellion repugnant to you.
compare: And know that the Messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to comply with you in much of the matter, you would surely be in trouble; but Allah has endeared the faith to you and has adorned it in your hearts, and made disbelief, evil conduct and disobedience hateful to you.

src: Sie werden nicht sprechen, ausgenommen der, dem der Erbarmer es erlaubt und der das Richtige sagt.
ref: None will speak except who is permitted by Ar-Rahman and says what is right.
draft: They will not speak, except for the one who the Merciful allows and who says the right thing.
hil: They will not speak, except for the one to whom the Merciful grants permission and who speaks the truth.
compare: They will not speak, except for the one to whom the Merciful grants permission and who speaks the truth.

src: (sie), die auf Lügen horchen, und die darauf aus sind, unrechtmäßig Erworbenes zu verschlingen.
ref: Eavesdropping for telling lies, earning through unlawful means!
draft: (They) who listen to lies and are inclined to devour unlawfully acquired possessions.
hil: Those who listen to lies and are inclined to devour unlawfully acquired possessions.
compare: Those who listen to lies and are inclined to devour unlawfully acquired possessions.

src: Jede Seele wird den Tod kosten, und euch wird euer Lohn am Tag der Auferstehung vollständig gegeben; und wer da vom Feuer ferngehalten und ins Paradies geführt wird, der soll glücklich sein. Und das irdische Leben ist nichts als ein trügerischer Nießbrauch.
ref: Every soul must taste death; and only on the Day of Resurrection will you be fully recompensed; so the one who is saved from the fire and is admitted into Paradise – he is undoubtedly successful; and the life of this world is just counterfeit wealth.
draft: Every soul will taste death, and you will be given your full compensation on the Day of Resurrection. And he who is drawn away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise, he indeed is successful. The life of this world is only the enjoyment of deception.
hil: Every soul shall taste death, and you will be given your full recompense on the Day of Resurrection. And whoever is kept away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise, he indeed is successful. And the life of this world is nothing but a deceptive enjoyment.
compare: Every soul will taste death, and you will be given your full compensation on the Day of Resurrection. And he who is drawn away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise, he indeed is successful. The life of this world is only the enjoyment of deception.

src: Also Vernichtung sei den Weggenossen der Gluthitze!
ref: Deprived (of all joys) will be the inmates of Hell.
draft: Also destruction be to the companions of the heat!
hil: So destruction should be to the comrades of the heat!
compare: So destruction should be to the comrades of the heat!

src: Sie möchten Allah und diejenigen, die glauben, betrügen. Aber sie betrügen nur sich selbst, ohne zu merken.
ref: They (try to) deceive God and those who believe, yet deceive none but themselves although they do not know.
draft: They want to deceive Allah and those who believe. But they only deceive themselves without realizing it.
hil: They want to deceive Allah and those who believe, but they only deceive themselves without realizing it.
compare: They want to deceive Allah and those who believe, but they only deceive themselves without realizing it.

src: Und ALLAH gewährt Rizq, wem er will, ohne Berechnung.
ref: And Allah provideth whomsoever He listeth without reckoning.
draft: And ALLAH grants rizq (sustenance), to whom he wills, without any calculation.
hil: And God grants sustenance to whomsoever He will, without calculation.
compare: And ALLAH grants rizq (sustenance), to whom he wills, without any calculation.

src: In Gärten und an Quellen,
ref: In these gardens and these springs,
draft: In gardens and at springs,
hil: In gardens and at springs,
compare: In gardens and at springs,

src: Unter ihnen gab es Rechtschaffene und solche, die dies nicht waren.
ref: Some of them righteous, and some of them short of that.
draft: Among them were righteous people and those who were not.
hil: Among them were righteous people and those who were not.
compare: Among them were righteous people and those who were not.

src: Fühlt ihr euch etwa sicher vor Dem, Dessen (Anweisung) im Himmel ist, daß ER mit euch die Erde versinkt, und daß sie gleich bebt?!
ref: Are you so unafraid that He who is in Heaven will not open up the earth to swallow you, when it will begin to tremble?
draft: Do you feel safe from Him whose instruction is in the sky, that He might cause the earth to swallow you up, and that it should shake?
hil: Do you feel safe from Him whose instruction is in the sky, that He might cause the earth to swallow you up, and that it should shake?
compare: Do you feel safe from Him whose instruction is in the sky, that He might cause the earth to swallow you up, and that it should shake?

src: Unser HERR! Lasse in unseren Herzen keine Falschheit entstehen, nachdem DU uns rechtgeleitet hast, und schenke uns von Dir aus Gnade! Gewiß, DU bist zweifellos Der großzügigste Schenkende.
ref: Our Lord, make not our hearts to swerve after that Thou hast guided us; and give us mercy from Thee; Thou art the Giver.
draft: "Our Lord! Do not let any falsehood arise in our hearts after You have guided us and grant us mercy from Yourself. You are surely the most giving."
hil: Our Lord! Do not allow any falsehood to arise in our hearts after You have guided us, and bless us with Your grace. Indeed, You are doubtless the most generous giver.
compare: "Our Lord! Do not let any falsehood arise in our hearts after You have guided us and grant us mercy from Yourself. You are surely the most giving."

src: Hättest du alles, was auf der Erde ist, dafür ausgegeben, hättest du ihre Herzen nicht vereint!
ref: Had you given away all the riches of the earth you could not have joined their hearts, but it is Allah Who joined their hearts.
draft: If you had spent everything on earth for it, you would not have united their hearts!
hil: If you had spent everything on earth for it, you would not have united their hearts!
compare: If you had spent everything on earth for it, you would not have united their hearts!

src: Wenn dem Menschen Unheil widerfährt, ruft er Uns an.
ref: When adversity touches the human being, he calls on Us.
draft: When humans encounter misfortune, they call upon Us.
hil: When affliction visits a man, he calls upon Us.
compare: When affliction visits a man, he calls upon Us.

src: (Dies ist) eine Verpflichtung von ALLAH, und ALLAH ist allwissend, allweise.
ref: God is all-knowing and all-wise.
draft: This is an obligation of ALLAH, and ALLAH is all-knowing, all-wise.
hil: This is a requirement of Allah, and Allah is all-knowing and all-wise.
compare: This is an obligation of ALLAH, and ALLAH is all-knowing, all-wise.

src: Dies ist eine Erinnerung.
ref: This is indeed a reminder.
draft: This is a reminder.
hil: This is a reminder.
compare: This is a reminder.

src: Für euch gibt es anstelle von Ihm weder Wali noch Fürbittenden. Wollt ihr euch etwa nicht entsinnen?!
ref: Apart from Him, you have no protector neither mediator; will you not remember?
draft: For you there is, instead of Him, neither a guardian nor an intercessor. Do you not want to remember?!
hil: Proclaim, “Allah”; say, “Have you appointed such as supporters besides Him, who can neither benefit nor harm themselves?”; say, “Will the blind and the sighted ever be equal?”
compare: For you there is, instead of Him, neither a guardian nor an intercessor. Do you not want to remember?!

src: Er sagte: "Meine Leute! Wie seht ihr es? Wenn ich über ein eindeutiges Zeichen von meinem HERRN verfüge und ER mir Gnade von Ihm erwies, die euch verborgen blieb, sollen wir diese euch etwa zur Pflicht machen, wenn ihr demgegenüber abgeneigt seid?
ref: He said: bethink ye, O my people! if I rested upon an evidence from my Lord, and a mercy hath come unto me from Him, and that hath been obscured unto you, Shall we make you adhere to it while ye are averse thereto?
draft: He said: "My people! How do you see it? If I have a clear sign from my LORD and HE showed me mercy from Him, which was hidden from you, should I make it an obligation for you if you are averse to it?
hil: {"output": "He said, 'My people, tell me, should I make this an obligation for you if you are averse to it when I have a clear evidence from my lord and he showed me mercy from himself, which was hidden from you?'}
compare: He said: "My people! How do you see it? If I have a clear sign from my LORD and HE showed me mercy from Him, which was hidden from you, should I make it an obligation for you if you are averse to it?

src: Oder wer wird ihr Beschützer sein?
ref: Or who will be their representative?
draft: Or who will be their protector?
hil: Or who will be their protector?
compare: Or who will be their protector?

src: Kehrt zurück zu eurem Vater, dann sagt: "Unser Vater! Dein Sohn hat gestohlen, und wir haben nur das bezeugt, was wir wußten. Und wir hatten über das Verborgene keine Kenntnis.
ref: Return you all to your father, and say, "Father, thy son stole; we do not testify except that we know; we were no guardians of the Unseen.
draft: Return to your father, then say: "Our father! Your son has stolen, and we have only testified to what we knew. And we had no knowledge of the hidden."
hil: Go to your father and tell him: "Oh father, your son has committed a theft. We bear witness to only what we know. We could not prevent the unknown."
compare: Return to your father, then say: "Our father! Your son has stolen, and we have only testified to what we knew. And we had no knowledge of the hidden."

src: Nein, sie leugnen die Stunde; und denen, welche die Stunde leugnen, haben Wir einen Höllenbrand bereitet.
ref: Yet they reject the Hour as untrue. We have prepared a Fire for those who deny the Resurrection.
draft: No, they deny the Hour; and those who deny the Hour are (caught) in a vast error.
hil: No, they deny the Hour; and for those who deny the Hour, We have prepared a Blaze.
compare: No, they deny the Hour; and for those who deny the Hour, We have prepared a Blaze.

src: Doch nie war ich mit dem Bittgebet zu Dir - HERR!  erfolglos.
ref: And in calling on Thee, my Lord, I have never been hitherto unprosperous.
draft: But I have never been unsuccessful with the plea to You - LORD!
hil: But I have never been unsuccessful with the plea to You, Lord.
compare: But I have never been unsuccessful with the plea to You, Lord.

src: Er sagte: "Nein! Vielmehr habt ihr selbst euch etwas eingeredet.
ref: (Their father) said: "It is not so; you have made up the story.
draft: He said: "No! Rather you have convinced yourselves of something."
hil: He said, "No, rather you have convinced yourselves of something."
compare: He said, "No, rather you have convinced yourselves of something."

src: ALLAH wird ihnen gewiß vergelten Besseres als das, wie sie handelten, und wird ihnen noch mehr von Seiner Gunst geben.
ref: That Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and add even more for them out of His Grace.
draft: ALLAH will certainly give them a better reward than what they did, and will give them even more of His grace.
hil: Allah will certainly reward them better than what they did and will give them even more of His grace.
compare: ALLAH will certainly give them a better reward than what they did, and will give them even more of His grace.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir glauben an den Herrn der Welten
ref: And said: "We have come to believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
draft: They said, "We believe in the Lord of the worlds."
hil: They said, "We believe in the Lord of the worlds."
compare: They said, "We believe in the Lord of the worlds."

src: So haben Wir bemessen.
ref: Then We facilitated (your birth).
draft: So we have measured.
hil: Thus We have measured.
compare: Thus We have measured.

src: Bereits sehen WIR das Schweifen deines Gesichts himmelwärts. So werden WIR dich gewiß eine Gebetsrichtung einnehmen lassen, an der du Wohlgefallen findest.
ref: We have seen thee turning thy face about in the heaven; now We will surely turn thee to a direction that shall satisfy thee.
draft: We already see the wandering of your face towards the sky. So we will certainly make you take a direction of prayer that you find pleasing.
hil: Already we see the swaying of your face towards the sky. Thus, we will certainly make you take a direction of prayer where you find satisfaction.
compare: We already see the wandering of your face towards the sky. So we will certainly make you take a direction of prayer that you find pleasing.

src: Die Gesandten unseres Herrn haben in der Tat die Wahrheit gebracht."
ref: The apostles of our Lord had indeed brought the truth."
draft: "The messengers of our Lord have indeed brought the truth."
hil: The messengers of our Lord have indeed brought the truth.
compare: "The messengers of our Lord have indeed brought the truth."

src: Und sollten sie für euch auf etwas davon freiwillig verzichten, dann nehmt es als Gutes Unschädliches an.
ref: But if they willingly forego some of it, then consume it with enjoyment and pleasure.
draft: And if they voluntarily renounce something of it for you, then take it as good and harmless.
hil: If they voluntarily renounce something of it for you, then take it as good and harmless.
compare: And if they voluntarily renounce something of it for you, then take it as good and harmless.

src: Er sagte: "Nein, sondern euer Ego machte euch etwas leicht! (Ich übe mich) in klagloser Geduld.
ref: He said, ‘No, your souls have made a matter seem decorous to you.
draft: He said, "No, but your ego made something easy for you! (I practice) in patient endurance."
hil: He said, 'No, but your ego made it easy for you! (I am practicing) in patient endurance.'
compare: He said, 'No, but your ego made it easy for you! (I am practicing) in patient endurance.'

src: Gott wollte feststellen, wer Ihn und seine Gesandten unterstützt, auch in Abwesenheit.
ref: That God may know who supports Him and His messengers invisibly.
draft: God wanted to determine who supports Him and His messengers, even in their absence.
hil: God wanted to determine who supports Him and His messengers, even in their absence.
compare: God wanted to determine who supports Him and His messengers, even in their absence.

src: Hätten sie doch dafür vier Zeugen gebracht! Und sollten sie nun die Zeugen nicht bringen, dann sind diese selbst bei ALLAH die wirklichen Lügner.
ref: Would that they had brought four witness to testify to their report. Since they brought none, they are liars before God.
draft: "If only they had brought four witnesses for it! And if they do not bring the witnesses now, then these people are the real liars even in the sight of Allah."
hil: If only they had brought four witnesses for it! And if they do not bring the witnesses now, then they are the real liars even in the sight of Allah.
compare: If only they had brought four witnesses for it! And if they do not bring the witnesses now, then they are the real liars even in the sight of Allah.

src: Gewiß, bereits entsandten WIR (Gesandte) zu Umam vor dir, dann hat diesen der Satan ihre (schlechten) Taten schön erscheinen lassen, so ist er ihr Wali heute.
ref: We have sent messengers before you to other nations. But Satan made their [foul] deeds seem fair to them and today he is their patron.
draft: Certainly, we have already sent messengers to Umam before you, then Satan made their (bad) deeds appear beautiful, so he is their Wali today.
hil: Certainly, We had sent messengers to Umam before you, then Satan made their (bad) deeds appear beautiful, so he is their Wali today.
compare: Certainly, we have already sent messengers to Umam before you, then Satan made their (bad) deeds appear beautiful, so he is their Wali today.

src: Mit denen, die ihr Vermögen spenden im Streben nach dem Wohlwollen Gottes und zur Festigung ihrer Seelen, ist es wie mit einem Garten auf einer Anhöhe.
ref: And the parable of those who spend their wealth seeking God’s approval, and to strengthen their souls, is that of a garden on a hillside.
draft: Those who donate their wealth in their striving for the goodwill of God and for the strengthening of their souls, it is like a garden on a hill.
hil: Those who donate their wealth in their striving for God's goodwill and for the strengthening of their souls are like a garden on a hill.
compare: Those who donate their wealth in their striving for God's goodwill and for the strengthening of their souls are like a garden on a hill.

src: Gewiß, bereits waren sie vorher um Fitna bemüht und wollten deine Angelegenheiten (durch Intrigen) durcheinander bringen, bis dieWahrheit kam und die Sache ALLAHs siegte, während sie (diesem) abgeneigt sind.
ref: They had tried to create disorder before and intrigued against you, but truth came out in the end and God's will prevailed, even though they did not like it.
draft: Certainly, they were already concerned about Fitna before and wanted to disrupt your affairs (through intrigues), until the truth came and the matter of Allah prevailed, while they are averse to it.
hil: Surely, they had already been concerned about causing Fitna and intended to disrupt your affairs (through intrigues), until the truth emerged and Allah's matter prevailed, while they are averse to it.
compare: Surely, they had already been concerned about causing Fitna and intended to disrupt your affairs (through intrigues), until the truth emerged and Allah's matter prevailed, while they are averse to it.

src: Ergötzt euch denn (eine Weile), bald jedoch werdet ihr es wissen.
ref: Please yourselves for a time; you will come to know soon.
draft: Enjoy yourselves (for a while), but soon you will know it.
hil: Therefore, enjoy yourselves (for a while), but soon you will know it.
compare: Enjoy yourselves (for a while), but soon you will know it.

src: Und wen ALLAH rechtleitet, ist zweifellos der Rechtgeleitete, und wen ER abirren läßt, für die findest du gewiß keine Wali anstelle von Ihm! Und WIR werden sie am Tag der Auferstehung auf ihren Gesichtern versammeln - blind, stumm und taub.
ref: Whomsoever God guides, he is rightly guided; and whom He leads astray -- thou wilt not find for them protectors, apart from Him.
draft: And whoever Allah guides, there is no doubt that he is guided, and whoever He misguides, you will not find a guardian for him. And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf.
hil: And whoever Allah guides, he is certainly the guided one, and whoever He lets go astray, for him you will find no protecting ally other than Him! And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf.
compare: And whoever Allah guides, there is no doubt that he is guided, and whoever He misguides, you will not find a guardian for him. And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf.

src: Da warfen sie sich nieder, außer Iblis. Er weigerte sich.
ref: They fell prostrate, but Iblis did not; he refused.
draft: There they threw themselves down, except Iblis. He refused.
hil: There they prostrated, except Iblis who refused.
compare: There they prostrated, except Iblis who refused.

src: Und darin haben sie vollkommen gereinigte Gattinnen. Und ewig werden sie darin bleiben.
ref: And they shall have fair spouses there, and live there abidingly.
draft: And therein they have fully purified spouses. And they will remain therein forever.
hil: And therein they have purified spouses, and they will abide therein forever.
compare: And therein they have fully purified spouses. And they will remain therein forever.

src: Nehmt euch daher keine Beschützer von ihnen, solange sie nicht auf Allahs Weg wandern. Und wenn sie sich abwenden, dann ergreift sie und tötet sie, wo immer ihr sie auffindet; und nehmt euch keinen von ihnen zum Beschützer oder zum Helfer
ref: Wherefore take not friends from among them until they migrate for the sake of Allah; and if they turn away, then lay hold of them and slay them, wheresoever ye find them, and take not from among them a friend or a helper.
draft: Therefore, do not take protectors among them until they emigrate for the cause of Allah . But if they turn away, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them and take not from among them any ally or helper.
hil: Do not take them as protectors until they emigrate for the cause of Allah. But if they turn away, seize them and kill them wherever you find them, and take neither a protector nor helper from among them.
compare: Therefore, do not take protectors among them until they emigrate for the cause of Allah . But if they turn away, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them and take not from among them any ally or helper.

src: So sollen sie Mich nicht um Beschleunigung bitten.
ref: So let them not ask Me to hasten (the punishment).
draft: They shouldn't ask me to speed up.
hil: They shall not ask me for acceleration.
compare: They shouldn't ask me to speed up.

src: Sie gehören nicht zu euch, und auch nicht zu ihnen.
ref: They are not of you, nor of them.
draft: They do not belong to you, nor to them.
hil: They do not belong to you or to them.
compare: They do not belong to you, nor to them.

src: Und der Sünde der Juden wegen haben Wir ihnen gute Dinge verboten, die ihnen erlaubt waren, wie auch, weil sie viele Hindernisse in Allahs Weg legten
ref: Because of the wickedness of some among the Jews, and because they obstructed people from the way of God, We forbade them many things which were lawful for them;
draft: And because of the sin of the Jews, We have forbidden them good things which were previously allowed to them, and also because they obstructed many people from Allah's path.
hil: And We have forbidden them good things which were previously allowed to them because of the sin of the Jews as well as they laid many obstacles on Allah's way.
compare: And because of the sin of the Jews, We have forbidden them good things which were previously allowed to them, and also because they obstructed many people from Allah's path.

src: Seine Leute kamen eilig zu ihm getrieben.
ref: His people came excited to him.
draft: His people came driven to him hastily.
hil: His people came rushing to him.
compare: His people came rushing to him.

src: Hinsichtlich derjenigen, in deren Herzen Falschheit ist, so folgen sie dem, was darin mehrdeutig ist  in Bestrebung nach Fitna und in Bestrebung nach (irriger) Auslegung.
ref: As for those in whose hearts is swerving, they follow the ambiguous part, desiring dissension, and desiring its interpretation; and none knows its interpretation, save only God.
draft: Regarding those in whose hearts there is falsehood, they follow what is ambiguous therein - in pursuit of Fitna and in pursuit of (erroneous) interpretation.
hil: Regarding those in whose hearts there is falsehood, they follow what is ambiguous therein - in pursuit of Fitna and in pursuit of (erroneous) interpretation.
compare: Regarding those in whose hearts there is falsehood, they follow what is ambiguous therein - in pursuit of Fitna and in pursuit of (erroneous) interpretation.

src: Vor dem Unheil dessen, was Er erschaffen hat,
ref: From the evil of what He has created,
draft: Before the disaster of what He has created,
hil: Before the calamity of what He has created,
compare: Before the disaster of what He has created,

src: Ist etwa derjenige, der ins Feuer geworfen wird, besser oder derjenige, der am Tage der Auferstehung sicher kommt?! Tut, was ihr wollt!
ref: Is he who is hurled into the Fire better? Or he who arrives safely on the Day of Resurrection?
draft: Is the one who is thrown into the fire better or the one who comes safely on the day of resurrection ?! Do what you want!
hil: {'output': 'Is the one who is thrown into the fire better or the one who comes safely on the Day of Resurrection? Do what you want!'}
compare: {'output': 'Is the one who is thrown into the fire better or the one who comes safely on the Day of Resurrection? Do what you want!'}

src: Dies sind die Gesandten; einige von ihnen haben Wir vor anderen bevorzugt. Unter ihnen gibt es manche, zu denen Allah gesprochen hat, und einige, die Er um Rangstufen erhöht hat.
ref: Of those messengers, some of whom We have caused to excel others, and of whom there are some unto whom Allah spake, while some of them He exalted (above others) in degree; and We gave Jesus, son of Mary, clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty) and We supported him with the holy Spirit.
draft: These are the messengers; some of them We have favored over others. Among them are those whom Allah has spoken to, and some of them He has raised in degrees of rank.
hil: These are the messengers; We have favored some of them over others. Among them are those to whom Allah has spoken, and some of them He has raised in ranks.
compare: These are the messengers; We have favored some of them over others. Among them are those to whom Allah has spoken, and some of them He has raised in ranks.

src: Dient ALLAH, meinem HERRN und eurem HERRN.
ref: Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord."
draft: "Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord."
hil: Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord.
compare: "Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord."

src: Ehefrauen des Propheten! Ihr seid nicht wie irgendeine (Gruppe) der Frauen, wenn ihr Taqwa gemäß handelt.
ref: O wives of the Prophet, you are not like other women.
draft: Wives of the Prophet! You are not like any (other) women, if you act according to Taqwa.
hil: Wives of the Prophet! You are not like any (other) women, if you act according to Taqwa.
compare: Wives of the Prophet! You are not like any (other) women, if you act according to Taqwa.

src: ALLAH möge ihnen vergeben. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: It may be that God will accept their repentance, for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: "ALLAH may forgive them. Surely, ALLAH is all-forgiving, all-merciful."
hil: May Allah forgive them. Surely, Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
compare: May Allah forgive them. Surely, Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

src: "Es gibt nur unseren ersten Tod, und wir werden nicht wiedererweckt werden.
ref: "There is no dying for us but once; and we shall not be raised again.
draft: "There is only our first death, and we will not be resurrected."
hil: There is only our first death, and we will not be resurrected.
compare: "There is only our first death, and we will not be resurrected."

src: Als er dort ankam, wurde ihm zugerufen: "Gesegnet ist wer im Feuer und wer in dessen Umgebung ist, und Preis sei Allah, dem Herrn der Weltenbewohner!
ref: But when he reached it, a voice called out: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and all around it. Praised be God, the Lord of all the worlds.
draft: As he arrived there, he was called out to: "Blessed is he who is in the fire and he who is in its surroundings, and praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds!
hil: Upon his arrival there, he was called out to: "Blessed is he who is in the fire and he who is in its surroundings, and praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds!"
compare: As he arrived there, he was called out to: "Blessed is he who is in the fire and he who is in its surroundings, and praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds!

src: Als ihr fortlieft und euch nach niemandem umdrehtet, während der Gesandte euch von hinten her rief. Da belohnte Er euch mit Kummer für (den) Kummer (des Propheten), damit ihr weder traurig wäret über das, was euch entgangen war, noch über das, was euch getroffen hatte. Und Allah ist Kundig dessen, was ihr tut.
ref: Remember, as you were rushing up (the hill) without turning back to look, though the Prophet was calling you from the rear, He requited you with anguish for an anguish that you do not fret for missed opportunity and what befell you, for God is aware of all that you do,
draft: As you walk away and do not turn to anyone while the envoy called to you from behind. He rewarded you with sorrow for (the) sorrow (of the Prophet), so that you would not be sad about what you had missed, nor about what had happened to you. And Allah is aware of what you do.
hil: As you ran away and did not turn to anyone while the envoy called out to you from behind, He rewarded you with sorrow for (the) sorrow (of the Prophet), so that you would not be sad about what you had missed, nor about what had happened to you. And Allah is aware of what you do.
compare: As you ran away and did not turn to anyone while the envoy called out to you from behind, He rewarded you with sorrow for (the) sorrow (of the Prophet), so that you would not be sad about what you had missed, nor about what had happened to you. And Allah is aware of what you do.

src: Am Morgen war er in der Stadt furchtsam und hielt (immer wieder) Ausschau. Auf einmal schrie derjenige, der ihn am Tag zuvor um Hilfe gebeten hatte, zu ihm um Beistand. Musa sagte zu ihm: "Du bist offenkundig einer, der wahrlich (zu Gewalttaten) verleitet."
ref: So he was in the city at morning fearing, waiting to see what happens – thereupon he sighted the one who had appealed to him the day before, crying out to him for help; Moosa said to him, “Indeed you are clearly astray.”
draft: In the morning he was in the city fearful and kept looking around. Suddenly the person who had asked him for help the day before shouted to him for assistance. Musa said to him: "You are obviously someone who is truly prone to violence."
hil: In the morning, he was fearful and kept looking around the city. Suddenly, the same person who had asked for his help the day before shouted for his assistance. Musa said to him, "You are obviously someone who is truly prone to violence."
compare: In the morning, he was fearful and kept looking around the city. Suddenly, the same person who had asked for his help the day before shouted for his assistance. Musa said to him, "You are obviously someone who is truly prone to violence."

src: Und WIR senden nach und nach vom Quran hinab, was eine Heilung und Gnade für die Mumin ist. Doch er bestärkt die Unrecht-Begehenden nur noch im Fehlgehen.
ref: What We have sent down of the Qur'an is a healing and a grace for the faithful, and adds only loss for the sinners.
draft: And gradually We are sending down from the Quran that which is healing and a mercy to the believers. But it only increases the wrongdoers in loss.
hil: And We reveal in stages from the Quran that which is a healing and a mercy for the believers. However, it only increases the wrongdoing of the transgressors.
compare: And gradually We are sending down from the Quran that which is healing and a mercy to the believers. But it only increases the wrongdoers in loss.

src: Solcherart erläutert ALLAH für euch Seine Ayat.
ref: Thus Allah makes clear His Ayat (Commandments and legal obligations) for you.
draft: Such Allah explains to you His verses.
hil: Thus does Allah explain His verses to you.
compare: Thus does Allah explain His verses to you.

src: Und gäbe es nicht das Wort des Richtens, würde bestimmt unter ihnen gerichtet.
ref: But for the decisive Word (of God) a sentence would have been passed amongst them.
draft: And if there were not the word of judgement, they would certainly be judged among them.
hil: And were it not for the word of judgement, they would certainly be judged among themselves.
compare: And were it not for the word of judgement, they would certainly be judged among themselves.

src: Sollen wir etwa Sudschud zu dem vollziehen, den du uns anweist?!"
ref: Should we adore whoever you ask us to?"
draft: "Should we really perform Sudschud as you instruct us?!"
hil: "Should we really perform Sudschud as you instruct us?!"
compare: "Should we really perform Sudschud as you instruct us?!"

src: Also richte deine Bittgebete an keinen anderen Gott neben ALLAH, sonst wirst du von den Gepeinigten.
ref: So call on no other god but God, lest you are condemned to torment;
draft: Therefore, direct your supplications to no other god besides Allah, otherwise you will be among the tormented.
hil: Therefore, direct your supplications to no other god besides Allah, otherwise you will be among the tormented.
compare: Therefore, direct your supplications to no other god besides Allah, otherwise you will be among the tormented.

src: Nach dem Gesetz des Königs hätte es ihm nicht zugestanden, seinen Bruder (als Sklaven) zu nehmen, außer daß Allah es wollte. Wir erhöhen, wen Wir wollen, um Rangstufen.
ref: He could not take his brother by the law of the king (as a slave), except that Allah willed it. (So Allah made the brothers to bind themselves with their way of "punishment, i.e. enslaving of a thief.")
draft: According to the law of the king, he would not have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah willed it. We elevate whom We will in degrees [of rank].
hil: According to the law of the king, he would not have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah willed it. We elevate whom We will in degrees [of rank].
compare: According to the law of the king, he would not have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah willed it. We elevate whom We will in degrees [of rank].

src: Diejenigen, die aus Furcht vor ihrem Herrn erschrecken,
ref: Surely those who live in awe of their Lord,
draft: Those who are afraid of their Lord,
hil: Those who are scared of their Lord because of fear
compare: Those who are afraid of their Lord,

src: Gut wart ihr, so betretet es; darin werdet ihr ewig weilen.»...
ref: So enter here to live for ever."
draft: Well you were, so enter into it; therein you will dwell forever.
hil: Good were you, so enter it; therein you will dwell forever.
compare: Good were you, so enter it; therein you will dwell forever.

src: O ihr, die ihr glaubt, fürchtet Allah; und eine jede Seele schaue nach dem, was sie für morgen vorausschickt.
ref: O you who believe, be fearful of God. Let each soul consider what it has sent (of good deeds) in advance for the morrow, and fear God.
draft: O you who believe, fear Allah; and let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow.
hil: O you who believe! Fear Allah, and let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow.
compare: O you who believe, fear Allah; and let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow.

src: Von Pharao. Er hatte hohe Gewalt und war einer der Maßlosen.
ref: From Firaun; he was indeed proud, among the transgressors.
draft: From Pharaoh. He had great power and was one of the intemperate.
hil: From Pharaoh. He had great power and was one of the intemperate.
compare: From Pharaoh. He had great power and was one of the intemperate.

src: ALLAH erwählt aus den Engeln Gesandte und aus den Menschen. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allhörend, allsehend.
ref: Allah chooses the Noble Messengers from the angels, and from men; indeed Allah is All Hearing, All Seeing.
draft: ALLAH chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Surely, ALLAH is all-hearing, all-seeing.
hil: Allah chooses messengers from among the angels and among the people. Surely, Allah is all-hearing, all-seeing.
compare: ALLAH chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Surely, ALLAH is all-hearing, all-seeing.

src: Beide versorgen WIR, diese und diese mit den Gaben deines HERRN.
ref: To each these as well as those We bestow from the Bounties of your Lord.
draft: Both WE provide this and this with the gifts of your LORD.
hil: Both of them We provide with the gifts of your Lord, this and this.
compare: Both of them We provide with the gifts of your Lord, this and this.

src: Und am Morgen war (der Garten) bereits verwüstet.
ref: So by the morning it seemed as though picked clean.
draft: And in the morning, (the garden) was already devastated.
hil: And in the morning, (the garden) was already devastated.
compare: And in the morning, (the garden) was already devastated.

src: Es gibt keine Gottheit außer Ihm, so richtet an Ihn Bittgebete als Aufrichtiger im Din Ihm gegenüber.
ref: There is no god but He. Therefore pray to Him with obedience all-exclusive.
draft: There is no deity except Him, so direct supplication towards Him as a sincere worshipper in religion towards Him.
hil: There is no god but Him, so direct supplication towards Him as a sincere worshipper in religion towards Him.
compare: There is no deity except Him, so direct supplication towards Him as a sincere worshipper in religion towards Him.

src: Er sagte: "Mein Vater! Tu, was dir geboten wurde.
ref: Do what you are commanded!
draft: He said, "My father! Do what you have been commanded."
hil: He said, 'My father! Do as you have been commanded.'
compare: He said, "My father! Do what you have been commanded."

src: Gewiß, darin sind doch Ayat für Leute, die hören.
ref: Verily there are signs in this for those who pay heed.
draft: Certainly, in that there are verses for people who listen.
hil: Certainly, in that there are signs for people who listen.
compare: Certainly, in that there are signs for people who listen.

src: Die Gänge der Himmel, daß ich zum Gott des Mose emporsteige. Ich halte ihn ja für einen Lügner.» So wurde dem Pharao sein böses Tun verlockend gemacht, und er wurde vom (rechten) Weg abgewiesen. Die List Pharaos ist dem Verderben erlegen.
ref: “The routes of the heavens, in order to glance at the God of Moosa – and indeed I think he is a liar”; this is how the evil deeds of Firaun were made seeming good to him, and he was stopped from the path; and the evil scheme of Firaun was destined to be ruined.
draft: The passages of the heavens, so that I ascend to the God of Moses. I consider him to be a liar. "Thus, Pharaoh was tempted into his evil deeds and led astray from the (righteous) path. The trickery of Pharaoh led to his downfall.
hil: The paths of the heavens, that I may ascend to the God of Moses. I consider him a liar. So, his evil deed was made enticing to Pharaoh, and he was led astray from the right path. Pharaoh's plan has fallen into ruin.
compare: The paths of the heavens, that I may ascend to the God of Moses. I consider him a liar. So, his evil deed was made enticing to Pharaoh, and he was led astray from the right path. Pharaoh's plan has fallen into ruin.

src: Diejenigen, über die das Urteil gefällt wird, sagen: "Unser Herr, dies sind jene, die wir irreführten.
ref: Those about whom the Word will have come true (to be punished) will say: "Our Lord! These are they whom we led astray.
draft: Those about whom a judgement is made say: "Our Lord, these are those whom we led astray."
hil: Those upon whom the judgment will be passed will say: "Our Lord, these are those we led astray."
compare: Those upon whom the judgment will be passed will say: "Our Lord, these are those we led astray."

src: O Prophet, wenn ihr euch von Frauen scheidet, dann scheidet euch von ihnen auf ihre Wartezeit hin, und berechnet die Wartezeit.
ref: O PROPHET WHEN you divorce women, divorce them at their appointed period, and calculate that period, and fear God, your Lord. Do not expel them from their houses, nor should they go away themselves, unless they are openly guilty of adultery.
draft: O Prophet, if you divorce women, divorce them when they have reached their period of waiting, and keep an account of the period of waiting.
hil: O Prophet, if you divorce women, divorce them after their period of waiting has been fulfilled, and keep an account of the waiting period.
compare: O Prophet, if you divorce women, divorce them after their period of waiting has been fulfilled, and keep an account of the waiting period.

src: Und wer von euch es sich nicht leisten kann, freie Mumin-Frauen zu heiraten, dann (heiratet er) von den Mumin-Dienerinnen, die euch gehören. Und ALLAH kennt euren Iman besser - die einen von euch sind wie die anderen.
ref: Any one of you who has not the affluence to be able to marry believing freewomen in wedlock, let him take believing handmaids that your right hands own; God knows very well your faith; the one of you is as the other.
draft: "And whoever among you cannot afford to marry free Moomin women, then (he may marry) from what your right hand possesses of Moomin female slaves. And Allah is most knowing about your faith. You [believers] are of one another."
hil: Whoever among you cannot afford to marry free believing women, may marry believing slave women whom you possess. And Allah is most aware of your faith. You are [all] the same to Him.
compare: "And whoever among you cannot afford to marry free Moomin women, then (he may marry) from what your right hand possesses of Moomin female slaves. And Allah is most knowing about your faith. You [believers] are of one another."

src: So komme ich zu euch mit einem Zeichen von eurem Herrn.
ref: I have brought you a miracle from your Lord.
draft: So I come to you with a sign from your Lord.
hil: So I come to you with a sign from your Lord.
compare: So I come to you with a sign from your Lord.

src: Diese eilen zu den guten Dingen um die Wette und werden darin die Allerersten sein.
ref: Are the ones who hasten to goodness and outpace the others.
draft: These hurry to the good things in a race and will be the very first in them.
hil: They race towards the good things and will be the very first in them.
compare: They race towards the good things and will be the very first in them.

src: Sag: "Habt ihr irgendein Wissen darüber, das ihr uns offenlegt?" Doch ihr folgt nur dem Spekulieren, und ihr lügt ja nur.
ref: You follow only assumptions and only make guesses.”
draft: Say, "Do you have any knowledge that you disclose to us?" But you only follow speculation, and you're just lying.
hil: Say to those you know: 'Have you any knowledge of what you reveal to us?' But you only follow speculation, and only lie.
compare: Say to those you know: 'Have you any knowledge of what you reveal to us?' But you only follow speculation, and only lie.

src: Und bittet ALLAH um etwas von Seiner Gunst!
ref: Ask God for His favours.
draft: And ask ALLAH for some of His grace!
hil: And ask Allah for some of His grace, verily Allah is all-knowing of everything.
compare: And ask ALLAH for some of His grace!

src: Und aus den Bergen hauet ihr euch Wohnungen geschickt aus.
ref: And dwellings hewed out of mountains ingeniously?
draft: And you cleverly cut dwellings for yourselves from the mountains.
hil: And you carve cleverly crafted dwellings for yourselves from the mountains.
compare: And you carve cleverly crafted dwellings for yourselves from the mountains.

src: Und die Entscheidungsträger von ihnen gingen los: "Geht weiter so, und seid duldsam in eurer Gottheiten Sache! Gewiß, dies ist eine Sache, die doch erstrebt wird.
ref: The chiefs among them departed saying: go, and persevere in your gods; verily this is a thing designed.
draft: " And their decision-makers went on: "Keep going, and be patient in your gods' cause! Indeed, this is a cause that is desirable."
hil: And their decision-makers set out: 'Keep going, and be patient in your gods' cause! Indeed, this is a cause that is sought after.
compare: " And their decision-makers went on: "Keep going, and be patient in your gods' cause! Indeed, this is a cause that is desirable."

src: So gibt es von euch keinen, der es von ihm zurückhält.
ref: And not one of you would have been able to stop (Us).
draft: So there is none of you who withholds it from him.
hil: There is none among you who withholds it from him.
compare: There is none among you who withholds it from him.

src: Diejenigen, gegen die der Spruch zu Recht fällig geworden ist, sagen: «Unser Herr, diese, die wir haben abirren lassen, haben wir abirren lassen, wie wir selbst abgeirrt waren. (Von ihnen) sagen wir uns vor Dir los.
ref: Those against whom the Word will have proved true will say, “Our Lord! These are they whom we led astray; we led them astray the way we ourselves went astray; we are unconcerned with them and we incline towards You – they never worshipped us!”
draft: Those against whom the verdict is rightly given say: "Our Lord, these whom we have led astray, we led them astray as we ourselves were astray. We declare our innocence to You concerning them".
hil: Those against whom the sentence has been confirmed say: 'Our Lord, we led these astray, just as we ourselves were led astray. We declare our innocence of them before you. They never served us.'
compare: Those against whom the verdict is rightly given say: "Our Lord, these whom we have led astray, we led them astray as we ourselves were astray. We declare our innocence to You concerning them".

src: ER sagte: "Verlasse es als ein Verachteter, Verfluchter.
ref: "Begone," said (God), "contemptible and rejected!
draft: He said, "Leave it as a despised, cursed one."
hil: He said, 'Leave it as a despised, cursed one.'
compare: He said, "Leave it as a despised, cursed one."

src: Hätte Gott bei ihnen etwas Gutes festgestellt, hätte Er sie hören lassen. Und wenn Er sie hätte hören lassen, so hätten sie sich (dennoch) abgekehrt und abgewandt.
ref: And had Allah found any goodness in them, He would have made them hear; and had He made them hear they would, in the end, have turned away and gone back.
draft: If God had found any good in them, He would have made them listen. And if He had made them listen, they would (still) have turned away and gone astray.
hil: If God had found any good in them, He would have made them hear it. And even if He had made them hear it, they would have turned away and gone astray nonetheless.
compare: If God had found any good in them, He would have made them listen. And if He had made them listen, they would (still) have turned away and gone astray.

src: Doch nur die verständigen Menschen besinnen sich.
ref: They alone take warning who are wise,
draft: But only the sensible people reflect.
hil: Only the wise reflect.
compare: Only the wise reflect.

src: Als sie dann vor Yusuf traten, nahm er seine Eltern bei sich auf und sprach: "Zieht in Ägypten in Sicherheit ein, wie Allah es will."
ref: When they went back to Joseph he gave his father and mother a place of honour, and said: "Enter Egypt in peace by the will of God."
draft: When they then appeared before Yusuf, he took his parents to him and said: "Settle in safety in Egypt, as Allah wills."
hil: When they appeared before Yusuf, he took his parents with him and said, "Settle in safety in Egypt, as Allah wills."
compare: When they then appeared before Yusuf, he took his parents to him and said: "Settle in safety in Egypt, as Allah wills."

src: ER läßt die Nacht den Tag überdecken.
ref: He brings the night as a cover over the day.
draft: He lets the night cover the day.
hil: He causes the night to cover the day.
compare: He causes the night to cover the day.

src: Und haltet nicht die Kafir-Ehepartner!
ref: Do not retain your (marriage) ties with unbelieving women.
draft: And do not hold the non-believing spouses!
hil: And do not hold the non-believing spouses.
compare: And do not hold the non-believing spouses!

src: Dienet Ihm.
ref: So worship Him.
draft: Serve Him.
hil: Serve Him.
compare: Serve Him.

src: 'Isa, der Sohn Maryams, sagte: "O Allah, unser Herr, sende zu uns einen Tisch (mit Speisen) vom Himmel herab, der für uns, für den ersten von uns und den letzten von uns, ein Fest sein soll und ein Zeichen von Dir. Und versorge uns.
ref: Eisa, the son of Maryam, said, “O Allah, O our Lord! Send down to us a table spread from heaven, so that it may become a day of celebration for us – for our former and latter people – and a sign from You; and give us sustenance – and You are the Best Provider Of Sustenance.”
draft: Isa, son of Maryam, said: "O Allah, Our Lord, send down for us a table [spread with food] from heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us.
hil: Isa, son of Maryam, said: 'O Allah, Our Lord, send down for us a table [spread with food] from heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us.'
compare: Isa, son of Maryam, said: "O Allah, Our Lord, send down for us a table [spread with food] from heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us.

src: Diejenigen, denen WIR die Schrift zuteil werden ließen, tragen sie vor, wie es ihr gebührt. Diese verinnerlichen den Iman daran.
ref: Those (who embraced Islam from Bani Israel) to whom We gave the Book [the Taurat (Torah)] [or those (Muhammad's Peace be upon him companions) to whom We have given the Book (the Quran)] recite it (i.e. obey its orders and follow its teachings) as it should be recited (i.e. followed), they are the ones that believe therein.
draft: Those to whom WE have given the scripture recite it with its true recital. They [are the ones who] believe in it.
hil: Those to whom WE have given the scripture recite it with its true recital. They [are the ones who] believe in it.
compare: Those to whom WE have given the scripture recite it with its true recital. They [are the ones who] believe in it.

src: Hierauf nahm Allah ihre Reue an. Dann aber wurden (wieder) viele von ihnen blind und taub.
ref: Thereafter Allah relented toward them, then they again blinded and deafened themselves.
draft: Then Allah accepted their repentance. But then many of them became blind and deaf again.
hil: Then Allah accepted their repentance, but then many of them became blind and deaf again.
compare: Then Allah accepted their repentance. But then many of them became blind and deaf again.

src: Aber diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, sind es, die der List erliegen.
ref: So the conspiracy will befall only upon the disbelievers.
draft: But those who are unbelievers are the ones who fall for the trickery.
hil: But it is those who are unbelievers that fall to the trickery.
compare: But it is those who are unbelievers that fall to the trickery.

src: Also führe den bewaffneten Kampf fi-sabilillah!
ref: So fight on in the way of God (irrespective of the others).
draft: So carry out the armed struggle fi-sabilillah!
hil: Fight in the cause of Allah with your possessions and your persons.
compare: So carry out the armed struggle fi-sabilillah!

src: An jenem Tag waren sie dem Unglauben näher als dem Glauben, sie sagten ja mit ihrem Munde, was nicht in ihrem Herzen war. Und Gott weiß besser, was sie verschweigen.
ref: They that day were nearer to unbelief than to belief, saying with their mouths that which never was in their hearts; and God knows very well the things they hide;
draft: On that day, they were closer to disbelief than to faith, they said with their mouth what was not in their heart. And God knows better what they are concealing.
hil: On that day, they were closer to disbelief than to faith, they said with their mouth what was not in their heart. And God knows better what they are concealing.
compare: On that day, they were closer to disbelief than to faith, they said with their mouth what was not in their heart. And God knows better what they are concealing.

src: Nehmen sie etwa nicht wahr, daß WIR gewiß Uns der Erde zuwenden und sie von ihren Enden einengen?!
ref: Do they not see Us advancing into the land, reducing its frontiers?
draft: Do they not realize that we certainly turn to the Earth and narrow it from its ends?!
hil: Do they not perceive that we are certainly turning towards the Earth and compressing it at its ends?!
compare: Do they not perceive that we are certainly turning towards the Earth and compressing it at its ends?!

src: Und erbärmlich ist sie als (ihr) Werden.
ref: What a wretched retreat!
draft: And it is miserable as (her) becoming.
hil: And miserable is her becoming.
compare: And miserable is her becoming.

src: Wenn dann der Tod an einen von ihnen herantritt, sagt er: "Mein Herr, bringe mich zurück
ref: (But the unbelievers will persist) until when death comes to one of them he will say: "O Lord, send me back again
draft: When death approaches one of them, he says, "My Lord, bring me back."
hil: When death approaches one of them, he says, "My Lord, bring me back."
compare: When death approaches one of them, he says, "My Lord, bring me back."

src: Auf solche (Sünder) wird ein böses Unheil niederfallen; und Allah ist zornig auf sie; und Er hat sie verflucht und Gahannam für sie bereitet.
ref: They shall be afflicted with misfortune, Allah is wroth with them. He has laid His curse upon them and has prepared for them Hell.
draft: Such (sinners) will suffer a terrible fate; and Allah is angry with them; and He has cursed them and prepared Gehenna for them.
hil: Those (sinners) will face a terrible fate; and Allah is angry with them; and He has cursed them and prepared Gehenna for them.
compare: Those (sinners) will face a terrible fate; and Allah is angry with them; and He has cursed them and prepared Gehenna for them.

src: Sag: Allah hat das überzeugende Beweismittel.
ref: Say: "To God belongs the consummate argument.
draft: Say: Allah has the convincing proof.
hil: Say: Allah has the convincing evidence.
compare: Say: Allah has the convincing proof.

src: Das ist ein Warner nach Art der früheren Warner.
ref: He who warns you is one of the warners of old.
draft: This is a warning in the style of earlier warnings.
hil: This is a Warner in the manner of the earlier Warners.
compare: This is a Warner in the manner of the earlier Warners.

src: Sie sagen: «Sie sind uns entschwunden. Nein, wir riefen früher nichts an.»
ref: They will say: they have failed us: aye! we have not been calling upon aught afore.
draft: They say, "You have disappeared from us. No, we didn't used to call."
hil: They say, "They have disappeared from us."
compare: They say, "You have disappeared from us. No, we didn't used to call."

src: (Sie ist) als Unterkunft von Einem Allvergebenden, Allgnädigen."
ref: As a gift from the forgiving, ever-merciful (God)."
draft: "(She is) a dwelling of an all-forgiving, all-gracious one."
hil: She is a home to an all-forgiving, all-gracious one.
compare: "(She is) a dwelling of an all-forgiving, all-gracious one."

src: Und Wir hoben den Berg über sie bei (der Entgegennahme von) ihrem Abkommen empor.
ref: And We raised the Mount over them for their bond.
draft: And we lifted the mountain over them upon (receiving) their agreement.
