hil: On the day when We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for records. As We began the first creation, We shall repeat it.
compare: On the day when We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for records. As We began the first creation, We shall repeat it.

src: Und den Juden haben Wir alles Getier untersagt, das Krallen hat; und von den Rindern und vom Kleinvieh haben Wir ihnen das Fett verboten, ausgenommen das, was an ihrem Rücken sitzt oder in den Eingeweiden oder mit den Knochen verwachsen ist. Damit haben Wir ihnen ihre Auflehnung vergolten. Und siehe, Wir sind Wahrhaftig.
ref: And for the Jews We forbade all animals with claws; and forbade them the fat of oxen and sheep except which is on their backs or joined to their intestines or to the bone; We awarded this to them for their rebellion; and indeed, surely, We are truthful.
draft: And We have forbidden to the Jews everything that has claws [i.e., some predatory animals]​.​​ And from the cattle and the sheep, We forbade them their fat, except what adheres to their backs or the entrails or what is joined with bone. [By] that We repaid them for their injustice. And indeed, We are truthful [in Our requital].
hil: We have made unlawful for the Jews all animals with claws, and the fat of the oxen and sheep, except that on their backs or their intestines, or which remains attached to their bones. This is in retribution for their rebellion. And surely, We are truthful.
compare: And We have forbidden to the Jews everything that has claws [i.e., some predatory animals]​.​​ And from the cattle and the sheep, We forbade them their fat, except what adheres to their backs or the entrails or what is joined with bone. [By] that We repaid them for their injustice. And indeed, We are truthful [in Our requital].

src: Sind diese (Mumin) etwa diejenigen, von denen ihr geschworen habt, daß ALLAH ihnen keinerlei Gnade erweisen würde?!
ref: “Are these the people (Muslims) regarding whom you swore that Allah would not have mercy on them at all?
draft: Are these (Moomin) the ones whom you swore that Allah would not show them any mercy?!
hil: Are these the ones whom you had sworn that Allah would not have mercy on them?
compare: Are these (Moomin) the ones whom you swore that Allah would not show them any mercy?!

src: Und ermahne damit diejenigen, die fürchten, zu ihrem HERRN versammelt zu werden, während es für sie (dabei) anstelle von Ihm weder Wali noch Fürbittenden gibt, damit sie Taqwa gemäß handeln.
ref: Warn those who fear, through this (Qur'an), that they will be gathered before their Lord, and they will have none to protect or intercede for them apart from Him. They may haply take heed for themselves.
draft: And thereby admonish those who fear to be gathered to their Lord that for them there will be no protector or intercessor besides Him, that they may become righteous.
hil: And remind those who fear to be gathered to their Lord that for them there will be no protector or intercessor besides Him, so that they may act according to Taqwa.
compare: And thereby admonish those who fear to be gathered to their Lord that for them there will be no protector or intercessor besides Him, that they may become righteous.

src: Und gewiß, wir sind doch wahrhaftig."
ref: We are verily speaking the truth.'"
draft: And certainly, we are truly.
hil: And surely, we are truly.
compare: And certainly, we are truly.

src: Wenn euch Gutes trifft, werden sie traurig. Wenn euch jedoch Übel überkommt, freuen sie sich darüber. Doch wenn ihr euch in Geduld übt und Taqwa gemäß handelt, wird ihre Heimtücke euch nicht im Geringsten schaden. Gewiß, ALLAH ist dessen, was sie tun, (mit Seinem Wissen) allumfassend.
ref: If good comes your way, they are vexed; but if evil befalls you they are pleased and rejoice; yet if you are patient and guard yourselves against evil, their cunning will not harm you in the least, for whatsoever they do is well within the reach of God.
draft: When good befalls you, it grieves them; but if any ill happens to you, they rejoice at it. But if you are steadfast and mindful of Allah, their guile will not harm you in the least: for Allah encompasses all that they do.
hil: "Those of you who have internalized the faith! Strive to fulfill your obligation to ALLAH and be witnesses in a just manner! And the hostility of a community should not lead you to injustice. Be just, as this is closer to Taqwa, and act in accordance with Taqwa towards ALLAH! Surely, ALLAH is aware of what you do."
compare: When good befalls you, it grieves them; but if any ill happens to you, they rejoice at it. But if you are steadfast and mindful of Allah, their guile will not harm you in the least: for Allah encompasses all that they do.

src: Darin werden sie auf immer ewig weilen.
ref: Which they will enjoy for ever.
draft: They will dwell there forever and ever.
hil: They will dwell therein forever and ever.
compare: They will dwell there forever and ever.

src: Dies ist für das, was ihr euch erworben habt. Und gewiß ist ALLAH den Dienern in keiner Weise ein Unrecht- Zufügender."
ref: “This is the recompense of what your own hands have sent ahead, and Allah does not oppress His bondmen.”
draft: "This is for what you have acquired. And indeed, Allah does not wrong the servants in any way."
hil: This is for what you have acquired. And surely Allah is not unjust to His servants in any way.
compare: This is for what you have acquired. And surely Allah is not unjust to His servants in any way.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Nehmt kein Riba in vervielfacht verdoppelter Höhe ein, und handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber, damit ihr erfolgreich seid.
ref: O you who believe, do not practice usury, charging doubled and redoubled (interest); but have fear of God: you may well attain your goal.
draft: You, who have internalized the Imam! Do not take riba multiplied in double amount, and act according to Taqwa towards ALLAH, so that you may be successful.
hil: Those of you who have internalized faith! Do not take riba multiplied in double amount, and act with Taqwa towards Allah, so that you may be successful.
compare: Those of you who have internalized faith! Do not take riba multiplied in double amount, and act with Taqwa towards Allah, so that you may be successful.

src: denjenigen, deren Leben die Engel beenden, während sie rein sind. Sie (die Engel) sagen: "Salam sei mit euch, tretet in Dschanna ein wegen dem, was ihr zu tun pflegtet."
ref: When the angels receive the souls of those who are blameless they will say: "Peace on you. Enter Paradise as recompense for what you did."
draft: Those whose lives the angels end while they are pure. They (the angels) say: "Peace be upon you, enter Paradise because of what you used to do."
hil: Indeed, those whose lives the angels bring to an end while they are pure, the angels say, 'Enter Paradise because of what you used to do.'
compare: Those whose lives the angels end while they are pure. They (the angels) say: "Peace be upon you, enter Paradise because of what you used to do."

src: Und wenn ihr krank oder auf Reisen seid oder der eine von euch von der Notdurft kommt oder ihr die Frauen (intim) berührt habt und kein Wasser finden könnt, dann sucht reine Erdoberfläche und streicht euch über eure Gesichter und Hände (bis zu den Ellbogen).
ref: And if you are ill, or on a journey, or one of you comes after answering the call of nature, or you have been in contact with women (by sexual relations) and you find no water, perform Tayammum with clean earth and rub therewith your faces and hands (Tayammum).
draft: And if you are sick or on a journey or one of you comes from the toilet or you have touched women (intimately) and cannot find water, then look for clean soil and wipe your faces and hands with it (up to the elbows).
hil: If you are sick or traveling or if one of you has come from using the toilet, or you have been in contact with women and cannot find water, then search for clean earth and wipe your faces and hands with it (up to the elbows).
compare: And if you are sick or on a journey or one of you comes from the toilet or you have touched women (intimately) and cannot find water, then look for clean soil and wipe your faces and hands with it (up to the elbows).

src: Sag: "Ich suche Schutz bei Dem HERRN des Morgengrauens
ref: SAY: "I SEEK refuge with the Lord of rising day
draft: Say: "I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn."
hil: Say, 'I seek refuge with the Lord of the Daybreak.'
compare: Say: "I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn."

src: Durch sie gewinnt ihr Wärme und (andere) Produkte. Und ihr ernährt euch von ihnen.
ref: He hath created them. For you in them there is warmth and other profits and of them ye eat.
draft: Through them you gain warmth and (other) products. And you nourish yourselves from them.
hil: You gain warmth and (other) products through them. And you nourish yourselves from them.
compare: Through them you gain warmth and (other) products. And you nourish yourselves from them.

src: Und wenn ihr den Iman und Taqwa verinnerlicht, läßt er euch eure Belohnung zuteil werden und verlangt von euch nicht euer Vermögen.
ref: If you believe and fear God, he will give you your reward, and will not ask for your possessions.
draft: And if you internalize the Iman and Taqwa, he will let your reward come to you and will not demand your wealth from you.
hil: And if you internalize faith and fear of God, He will enable your reward to come to you and will not demand your wealth from you.
compare: And if you internalize faith and fear of God, He will enable your reward to come to you and will not demand your wealth from you.

src: Diejenigen von den Leuten des Buches und von den Polytheisten, die nicht glauben, mögen es nicht gern, daß auf euch etwas Gutes von eurem Herrn herabgesandt wird. Gott aber schenkt seine Barmherzigkeit in besonderer Weise, wem Er will. Und Gott besitzt große Huld.
ref: Those who disbelieve – the People given the Book(s) or the polytheists – do not wish that any good be sent down upon you from your Lord; and Allah chooses whomever He wills by His Mercy; and Allah is the Most Munificent.
draft: Those of the People of the Book and the polytheists who do not believe, do not like that any good should be sent down to you from your Lord's side. But God particularly selects for His mercy whom He wills. And God is Possessor of great bounty.
hil: Those without faith among the people of the Book and those who worship idols do not wish that good should come to you from your Lord. But God chooses whom He likes for His grace, and the bounty of God is infinite
compare: Those without faith among the people of the Book and those who worship idols do not wish that good should come to you from your Lord. But God chooses whom He likes for His grace, and the bounty of God is infinite

src: Also manche von ihnen sind rechtgeleitet, und viele von ihnen sind Fasiq.
ref: Then of them some are guided ones, and many of them are transgressors.
draft: Some of them are guided, and many of them are disobedient.
hil: Some of them are guided, while many of them are disobedient.
compare: Some of them are guided, while many of them are disobedient.

src: Und gewiß, bereits vor dir wurden Gesandte der Lüge bezichtigt, so haben sie sich in Geduld geübt für das, weswegen sie der Lüge bezichtigt wurden und ihnen Schaden zugefügt wurde, bis Unser Sieg ihnen zuteil wurde. Und es gibt keinen, der ALLAHs Versprechen abändern kann.
ref: Rejected were the messengers before thee: with patience and constancy they bore their rejection and their wrongs, until Our aid did reach them: there is none that can alter the words (and decrees) of Allah.
draft: And certainly, messengers before you were accused of lying, so they bore patiently with that which they were accused of, and were harmed until Our victory came to them. And there is no one who can change the promise of Allah.
hil: And certainly, messengers before you were accused of lies, but they persevered with patience for what they were accused of, and were harmed until Our victory came to them. And no one can alter the promise of Allah.
compare: And certainly, messengers before you were accused of lying, so they bore patiently with that which they were accused of, and were harmed until Our victory came to them. And there is no one who can change the promise of Allah.

src: So (war es).
ref: Thus (it was)!
draft: So (it was).
hil: Thus (it was).
compare: So (it was).

src: Sprich: Ob ihr das geheimhaltet, was in eurem Inneren ist, oder es offenlegt, Gott weiß es.
ref: Say: 'Whether you hide what is in your breasts or publish it, God knows it.
draft: Speak: Whether you keep secret what is in your inner being or reveal it, God knows it.
hil: Say: Whether you keep secret what is in your inner being or reveal it, Allah knows it.
compare: Speak: Whether you keep secret what is in your inner being or reveal it, God knows it.

src: Aber dann, am Tag der Auferstehung verleugnet ihr einander und verflucht ihr einander.
ref: But then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will disown one another, and curse one another.
draft: But then, on the day of resurrection, you will deny each other and curse each other.
hil: But then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will disown each other and curse each other.
compare: But then, on the day of resurrection, you will deny each other and curse each other.

src: Und WIR schmückten den untersten Himmel mit Lampen und Bewahrendem.
ref: And We adorned the nearest (lowest) heaven with lamps (stars) to be an adornment as well as to guard (from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils).
draft: And WE adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and preservers.
hil: We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps to be an adornment as well as to guard from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils. Such is the Decree of Him the All-Mighty, the All-Knower.
compare: And WE adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and preservers.

src: So ertrage geduldig, was sie sagen, und lobpreise deinen Herrn vor dem Aufgang der Sonne und vor dem (Sonnen-)untergang
ref: So you bear with patience what they say, and sing the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun and its setting,
draft: So patiently endure what they say and glorify your Lord before sunrise and before the sunset.
hil: Patiently endure what they say and glorify your Lord at the break of dawn and at sunset.
compare: Patiently endure what they say and glorify your Lord at the break of dawn and at sunset.

src: O die ihr glaubt, berauschender Trank, Glücksspiel, Opfersteine und Lospfeile sind nur ein Greuel vom Werk des Satans.
ref: O believers, this wine and gambling, these idols, and these arrows you use for divination, are all acts of Satan; so keep away from them.
draft: O you who believe, intoxicants, gambling, sacrificial stones, and divining arrows are but a detestable act of Satan's handiwork.
hil: O you who believe, intoxicants, gambling, sacrificial stones, and divining arrows are but a detestable act of Satan's handiwork.
compare: O you who believe, intoxicants, gambling, sacrificial stones, and divining arrows are but a detestable act of Satan's handiwork.

src: Diese jedoch lehrten niemanden, ohne zu sagen: «Wir sind nur eine Versuchung, so werde nicht ungläubig.»
ref: They learnt what led to discord between husband and wife.
draft: However, they did not teach anyone without saying, "We are only a temptation, so do not disbelieve."
hil: And yet they taught no one without saying, 'We are only a temptation, so do not disbelieve.'
compare: And yet they taught no one without saying, 'We are only a temptation, so do not disbelieve.'

src: Und wer dies tut, der fügt sich selbst Unrecht zu.
ref: He who does so will wrong himself.
draft: And whoever does this, does himself an injustice.
hil: Whoever does this does himself wrong.
compare: Whoever does this does himself wrong.

src: Sie sagen: «Die Wahrheit.» Und Er ist der Erhabene, der Große.
ref: They say, “All that He has proclaimed is the Truth; and He is the Supreme, the Great.”
draft: They say, "The truth." And He is the Sublime, the Great.
hil: They say, "The truth." And He is the Sublime, the Great.
compare: They say, "The truth." And He is the Sublime, the Great.

src: Und WIR prüften sie mit gottgefälligen guten Taten und mit den gottmißfälligen Taten, damit sie umkehren.
ref: And We tried them with good (blessings) and evil (calamities) in order that they might turn (to Allah's Obedience).
draft: And WE tested them with god-pleasing good deeds and with the god-displeasing deeds, so that they may repent.
hil: And WE tested them with god-pleasing good deeds and with the god-displeasing deeds, so that they may repent.
compare: And WE tested them with god-pleasing good deeds and with the god-displeasing deeds, so that they may repent.

src: Wenn Er damit die von seinen Dienern, die Er will, trifft, da sind sie froh,
ref: Then, when He makes it fall upon whom He wills of His servants, behold, they rejoice.
draft: If He hits those of His servants whom He wills, they are happy.
hil: If He thus hits those of His servants whom He wills, then they are happy.
compare: If He thus hits those of His servants whom He wills, then they are happy.

src: Für die Ungläubigen nicht leicht.
ref: Dolorous for the unbelievers.
draft: For the unbelievers not easy.
hil: For the unbelievers not easy.
compare: For the unbelievers not easy.

src: Und sie schreien darin laut: "Unser Herr, bringe uns heraus, so werden wir rechtschaffen handeln, anders als das, was wir zu tun pflegten." - "Haben Wir euch nicht ein so langes Leben gewährt, daß jeder, der hätte bedenken wollen, darin hätte bedenken können? Und ist nicht der Warner zu euch gekommen?
ref: And they will cry out therein, "Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you?
draft: And they cry out loud in it: "Our Lord, bring us out, so we will act righteously, different from what we used to do." - "Did We not grant you such a long life that anyone who would have thought about it could have thought about it? And has not the Warner come to you?
hil: And they cry out loud in it: 'Our Lord, bring us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we used to do'. 'Did We not grant you such a long life that anybody who would have thought about it could have thought? And has not the Warner come to you?'
compare: And they cry out loud in it: 'Our Lord, bring us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we used to do'. 'Did We not grant you such a long life that anybody who would have thought about it could have thought? And has not the Warner come to you?'

src: Bringt mir Eisenstücke!" Als er dann (die Lücke) zwischen den beiden Wallabhängen auf gleicher Höhe zuschütten ließ, sagte er: "Blast!"
ref: Bring me ingots of iron," (which they did) until the space between two mountain sides was filled up.
draft: "Bring me pieces of iron!" When he then had the gap filled in at the same height between the two ramparts, he said, "Blow!"
hil: "Bring me pieces of iron!" When he then had the gap filled in between the two ramparts at the same height, he said, "Fill it up!"
compare: "Bring me pieces of iron!" When he then had the gap filled in between the two ramparts at the same height, he said, "Fill it up!"

src: Und verrichtet das Gebet und entrichtet die Abgabe.
ref: Fulfil your devotional obligations and pay the zakat.
draft: And perform the prayer and pay the alms.
hil: And perform the prayer and pay the alms.
compare: And perform the prayer and pay the alms.

src: Also hinsichtlich des Schaums, so wird er beiseite geworfen, doch hinsichtlich dessen, das den Menschen nützt, so verbleibt es in der Erde.
ref: The scum disappears like the foam on the bank, and that which is useful to man remains on the earth.
draft: Regarding the foam, it is discarded, but regarding that which benefits people, it remains in the earth.
hil: Regarding the foam, it is cast away, but as for that which benefits people, it remains in the earth.
compare: Regarding the foam, it is discarded, but regarding that which benefits people, it remains in the earth.

src: Gewiß, bereits haben WIR Nuh zu seinen Leuten entsandt, dann sagte er: "Meine Leute!
ref: Indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people and he said: "O my people!
draft: Certainly, we have already sent Noah to his people, then he said: "My people!
hil: Assuredly, We sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people!'
compare: Assuredly, We sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people!'

src: Sie sagten: "Salih! Bereits hast du unter uns Vertrauen vor dieser (Aufforderung) genossen.
ref: They said, 'Salih, thou hast hitherto been a source of hope among us.
draft: They said: "Salih! You have already gained trust among us before this (request).
hil: They said, "Salih! You have already gained trust among us before this (request)."
compare: They said: "Salih! You have already gained trust among us before this (request).

src: Und wer Kufr betreibt ALLAH, Seinen Engeln, Seinen Schriften, Seinen Gesandten und dem Jüngsten Tag gegenüber, der ist bereits weit in die Irre gegangen.
ref: But he who believes not in God and His angels and the Books and the prophets and the Last Day, has wandered far away.
draft: And anyone who engages in disbelief, is surely astray, has denied Allah, His angels, His scriptures, His messengers, and the Last Day.
hil: And he who disbelieves in Allah, His angels, His scriptures, His messengers, and the Last Day has already strayed far away.
compare: And anyone who engages in disbelief, is surely astray, has denied Allah, His angels, His scriptures, His messengers, and the Last Day.

src: Gewiß, Wir haben um ihre Hälse Fesseln gelegt.
ref: We have enchained their necks up to their chins.
draft: Certainly, we have put bonds around their necks.
hil: Certainly, we have placed chains around their necks.
compare: Certainly, we have placed chains around their necks.

src: Das sind die, für die es die guten Dinge geben wird, und das sind diejenigen, denen es wohl ergeht.
ref: These are they for whom are goods, and these: they are the blissful.
draft: These are the ones for whom there will be good things, and these are the ones who will fare well.
hil: These are the ones for whom there will be good things and these are the ones who will fare well.
compare: These are the ones for whom there will be good things, and these are the ones who will fare well.

src: und ehrerbietig gegen meine Mutter (zu sein); Er hat mich nicht gewalttätig und unselig gemacht.
ref: And be dutiful to my mother. He has not made me haughty or rebellious.
draft: And to be respectful to my mother; he did not make me violent or unhappy.
hil: And to be respectful to my mother; he did not make me violent or unhappy.
compare: And to be respectful to my mother; he did not make me violent or unhappy.

src: Dies ist besser für euch und reiner. Und wenn ihr (es) nicht vermögt, also gewiß, ALLAH ist allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: Yet if you find not means, God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
draft: This is better for you and purer. And if you are unable, then certainly, Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
hil: This is better for you and purer. And if you are unable, then certainly, Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
compare: This is better for you and purer. And if you are unable, then certainly, Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

src: Bei Gott steht ein großartiger Lohn bereit.
ref: Indeed God has greater rewards with Him.
draft: A great reward awaits at God's.
hil: With Him is a great reward.
compare: With Him is a great reward.

src: Dann gaben Wir ihn seiner Mutter zurück, damit ihr Auge mit Freude erfüllt würde und damit sie sich nicht grämte und damit sie wüßte, daß Allahs Verheißung wahr sei. Jedoch die meisten von ihnen wissen es nicht.
ref: Thus We restored him to his mother that she may be tranquil and not grieve, and know that the promise of God is true, though most men do not know.
draft: Then We returned him to his mother so that her eye may be filled with joy and she may not grieve and that she would know that Allah's promise is true. But most of them do not know.
hil: We restored him to his mother that she might be comforted and not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of them do not know.
compare: We restored him to his mother that she might be comforted and not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of them do not know.

src: Doch wahrlich, er (Jesus) ist ein Vorzeichen der Stunde.
ref: He is certainly the sign of the Hour (of change).
draft: But truly, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour.
hil: But truly, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour.
compare: But truly, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour.

src: Aber nein! Ihr werdet es bald erfahren.
ref: But you will come to know soon; --
draft: But no! You will soon find out.
hil: But no! You will soon find out.
compare: But no! You will soon find out.

src: Und sie haben gesagt: .Verlaßt doch nicht eure Götter; verlaßt doch nicht Wadd, noch Suwa", noch Yagut,Ya'uq und Nasr.'
ref: And said: 'Do not abandon your gods, and do not abandon Wadda or Suwa', or Yaghuth, Ya'uq or Nasr.'
draft: And they said, "Do not leave your gods; do not leave Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yagut, Ya'uq and Nasr."
hil: And they said, 'Do not abandon your gods; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yagut, Ya'uq and Nasr.'
compare: And they said, "Do not leave your gods; do not leave Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yagut, Ya'uq and Nasr."

src: "Unser Herr, belange uns nicht, wenn wir (etwas) vergessen oder einen Fehler begehen. Unser Herr, lege uns keine Bürde auf, wie Du sie denjenigen vor uns auferlegt hast.
ref: Do not seize us if we forget or are mistaken; our Lord!
draft: "Our Lord, do not blame us if we forget something or make a mistake. Our Lord, do not burden us as you have burdened those before us."
hil: Our Lord, do not hold us accountable if we forget or make a mistake. Our Lord, do not burden us as you burdened those before us.
compare: Our Lord, do not hold us accountable if we forget or make a mistake. Our Lord, do not burden us as you burdened those before us.

src: Und so erweckten Wir sie auf, damit sie sich gegenseitig fragten. Einer von ihnen sagte: "Wie lange habt ihr verweilt?" Sie sagten: "Verweilt haben wir einen Tag oder den Teil eines Tages." Sie sagten: "Euer Herr weiß am besten, wie (lange) ihr verweilt habt. So schickt einen von euch mit diesen euren Silbermünzen in die Stadt; er soll sehen, welche ihre reinste Speise ist, und euch davon eine Versorgung bringen. Er soll behutsam sein und ja niemanden etwas von euch merken lassen.
ref: And similarly We awakened them so that they may enquire about each other; a speaker among them said, “How long have you stayed here?” Some among them said, “We have stayed a day or part of a day”; the others said, “Your Lord well knows how long you have stayed; therefore send one of you to the city with this silver coin – he may then check which food available there is purer, in order to bring some of it for you to eat – and he must be courteous and not inform anyone about you.”
draft: And so we raised them up asking themselves about each other. One of them said, "How long have you stayed?" They said, "We have stayed a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord knows best how long you have stayed. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city, and let him look for the cleanest way of food for you and bring you some of it. And let him certainly be cautious and not reveal your identity to anyone."
hil: We raised them up so that they asked each other. One of them said, "How long did you stay?" They said, "We stayed for a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord knows best how long you stayed. So send one of you with your silver coins to the city; he should see what their purest food is, and bring you some of it. Let him be careful and not reveal anything about you to anyone."
compare: And so we raised them up asking themselves about each other. One of them said, "How long have you stayed?" They said, "We have stayed a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord knows best how long you have stayed. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city, and let him look for the cleanest way of food for you and bring you some of it. And let him certainly be cautious and not reveal your identity to anyone."

src: An jenem Tag gehört die Königsherrschaft Gott (allein). Er wird zwischen ihnen urteilen. Dann werden diejenigen, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, in den Gärten der Wonne sein.
ref: For Allah only is the kingship on that day; He will judge between them; so those who believed and did good deeds are in Gardens of content.
draft: On that day, the kingship belongs to God (alone). He will judge between them. Then those who believe and do good works will be in the gardens of bliss.
hil: On that day, the sovereignty belongs to God alone. He will judge among them. Then those who believed and did good deeds will be admitted into gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein forever. This is truly Allah's promise, and who is more truthful in word than Allah?
compare: On that day, the kingship belongs to God (alone). He will judge between them. Then those who believe and do good works will be in the gardens of bliss.

src: Und wäre nicht über euch Allahs Huld und Seine Barmherzigkeit, nicht einer von euch wäre rein geworden; doch Allah macht rein, wen Er will.
ref: Were it not for God’s grace towards you, and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever. But God purifies whomever He wills.
draft: And if it had not been for Allah's grace and His mercy upon you, none of you would have been pure, but Allah purifies whom He wills.
hil: If it were not for Allah's grace and His mercy upon you, none of you would have been purified, but Allah purifies whom He wills.
compare: If it were not for Allah's grace and His mercy upon you, none of you would have been purified, but Allah purifies whom He wills.

src: Und ALLAH ist immer über alles allmächtig.
ref: God is powerful over everything.
draft: And ALLAH is always almighty over everything.
hil: And Allah is always almighty over everything.
compare: And ALLAH is always almighty over everything.

src: Auch kennt ER, was auf dem Festland und was im Meer ist.
ref: He knows what is in land and sea; not a leaf falls, but He knows it.
draft: Also, HE knows what is on the mainland and what is in the sea.
hil: He knows what is on the land and in the sea.
compare: He knows what is on the land and in the sea.

src: Sagen sie: "Wir teilten Dir mit, keiner von uns ist Zeuge."
ref: They will answer: "We profess to You not one of us can vouch for them."
draft: They said: "We informed you that none of us is a witness."
hil: They said, "We informed you that none of us is a witness."
compare: They said: "We informed you that none of us is a witness."

src: Und er sagte: «O meine Söhne, geht nicht durch ein einziges Tor hinein.
ref: And he said: O my sons!
draft: And he said, "Oh my sons, do not enter through a single gate."
hil: And he said, "My sons, do not enter through a single gate."
compare: And he said, "My sons, do not enter through a single gate."

src: Auch der Warner kam zu euch. Also erfahrt (die Peinigung)!
ref: To you the warner came; taste you now!
draft: Also the Warner came to you. So (learn about the punishment)!
hil: O you who believe, the Warner has come to warn you, so learn about the punishment!
compare: O you who believe, the Warner has come to warn you, so learn about the punishment!

src: (Dies ist) eine Offenbarung von Ihm, Der die Erde und die hohen Himmel erschuf.
ref: A revelation from Him who created the earth and the high ascending skies,
draft: This is a revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens.
hil: This is a revelation from Him who created the Earth and the lofty heavens.
compare: This is a revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens.

src: Und gebt ihnen etwas vom Vermögen Gottes, das Er euch gegeben hat. Und zwingt nicht eure Sklavinnen, wenn sie sich unter Schutz stellen wollen, zur Hurerei im Trachten nach den Gütern des diesseitigen Lebens.
ref: And constrain not your slave-girls to prostitution, if they desire to live in chastity, that you may seek the chance goods of the present life.
draft: And give them something from the property of God that He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, in order to seek the enjoyment of worldly life.
hil: Give them something from the property of God that He has given you. And do not force your slave girls into prostitution if they desire chastity, to seek the temporary benefits of worldly life.
compare: And give them something from the property of God that He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, in order to seek the enjoyment of worldly life.

src: Er hört alles und ist nahe.
ref: He is all-hearing and all-too-near."
draft: He hears everything and is close.
hil: He hears everything and is near.
compare: He hears everything and is close.

src: Und in der Morgendämmerung baten sie um Vergebung,
ref: And every morning asked forgiveness,
draft: And in the dawn they asked for forgiveness.
hil: And at dawn they asked for forgiveness.
compare: And in the dawn they asked for forgiveness.

src: Weder darf die Sonne den Mond einholen, noch kommt die Nacht dem Tag zuvor.
ref: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor does the night outstrip the day.
draft: Neither may the sun overtake the moon nor does the night come before the day.
hil: Neither shall the sun overtake the moon, nor shall the night outpace the day.
compare: Neither may the sun overtake the moon nor does the night come before the day.

src: Ihr dient anstatt Allahs nur Götzen und schafft (dabei nur) ungeheuerliche Lüge.
ref: You worship idols in place of God and invent lies.
draft: You worship idols instead of Allah and create (therefore only) monstrous lies.
hil: You worship only idols instead of Allah and thus create monstrous lies.
compare: You worship only idols instead of Allah and thus create monstrous lies.

src: (Erlaubt sind) auch die unter Schutz gestellten gläubigen Frauen und die unter Schutz gestellten Frauen aus den Reihen derer, denen vor euch das Buch zugekommen ist, wenn ihr ihnen ihren Lohn zukommen laßt und mit ihnen in der Absicht lebt, (sie) unter Schutz zu stellen, nicht Unzucht zu treiben und (sie) nicht als heimliche Konkubinen zu nehmen.
ref: The food (slaughtered cattle, eatable animals, etc.) of the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) is lawful to you and yours is lawful to them. (Lawful to you in marriage) are chaste women from the believers and chaste women from those who were given the Scripture (Jews and Christians) before your time, when you have given their due Mahr (bridal money given by the husband to his wife at the time of marriage), desiring chastity (i.e. taking them in legal wedlock) not committing illegal sexual intercourse, nor taking them as girl-friends.
draft: "Permissible are also the believing women who are under protection and the women of those who were given the Scripture before you, as long as you give them their dowries and live chastely with them and do not take them as secret concubines."
hil: Permissible are also the believing women who are under protection and the women of those who were given the Scripture before you, as long as you give them their dowries and live chastely with them and do not take them as secret concubines.
compare: "Permissible are also the believing women who are under protection and the women of those who were given the Scripture before you, as long as you give them their dowries and live chastely with them and do not take them as secret concubines."

src: Und Wir ließen ihn all unsere Zeichen schauen, aber er erklärte (sie) für Lüge und weigerte sich.
ref: So We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused,
draft: And We showed him all Our signs, but he rejected them and refused.
hil: And We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused.
compare: And We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused.

src: An jenem Tag trifft (die Stunde) ein, die eintreffen wird,
ref: On that Day will come what is to come.
draft: On that day will come (the hour) that will arrive.
hil: On that day will come (the Hour) which will inevitably come.
compare: On that day will come (the Hour) which will inevitably come.

src: Er (David) sagte: "Wahrlich, er hat ein Unrecht an dir verübt, als er dein Mutterschaf zu seinen eigenen Mutterschafen hinzu verlangte. Und gewiß, viele Teilhaber vergehen sich gegeneinander; nur die (sind davon) ausgenommen, die glauben und gute Werke tun; und das sind wenige." Und David merkte, daß Wir ihn auf die Probe gestellt hatten; also bat er seinen Herrn um Verzeihung und fiel betend nieder und bekehrte sich.
ref: He said: Surely he has been unjust to you in demanding your ewe (to add) to his own ewes; and most surely most of the partners act wrongfully towards one another, save those who believe and do good, and very few are they; and Dawood was sure that We had tried him, so he sought the protection of his Lord and he fell down bowing and turned time after time (to Him).
draft: He (David) said: "Truly, he has wronged you by demanding your ewe lamb to be added to his own sheep. And indeed, many partners wrong one another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they". And David realized that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing (in prostration) and turned (to Allah in repentance).
hil: He (David) said, 'Indeed he has wronged you by demanding your ewe lamb to be added to his own sheep. And indeed, many partners wrong one another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they.' And David realized that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing (in prostration) and turned (to Allah in repentance).
compare: He (David) said, 'Indeed he has wronged you by demanding your ewe lamb to be added to his own sheep. And indeed, many partners wrong one another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they.' And David realized that We had tried him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing (in prostration) and turned (to Allah in repentance).

src: Sag: "Gibt es unter den von euch (ALLAH) beigesellten Partnern einen, der zur Wahrheit rechtleitet?" Sag: "ALLAH leitet zur Wahrheit recht!"
ref: Say: 'Do any of your partners guide you to the truth' Say: 'Allah, He guides to the truth.
draft: Say: "Is there any among those you (Allah) associate partners with who guides the truth?" Say: "Allah guides to the truth!"
hil: Say, "Is there any among those you (Allah) associate partners with who guides to the truth?" Say, "Allah guides to the truth!"
compare: Say, "Is there any among those you (Allah) associate partners with who guides to the truth?" Say, "Allah guides to the truth!"

src: Und wer krank oder auf Reisen war, (fastet) an anderen Tagen die gleiche Anzahl.
ref: Whoever of you witnesses the month, shall fast it.
draft: And whoever was sick or traveling, (fasts) the same number on other days.
hil: And whoever has been sick or on a journey, (shall fast) the same number of days later on.
compare: And whoever has been sick or on a journey, (shall fast) the same number of days later on.

src: ER wird sie doch in einen Eingang eingehen lassen, an dem sie Wohlgefallen finden werden. Und gewiß, ALLAH ist zweifelsohne allwissend, allnachsichtig.
ref: He will certainly admit them to a place they will love; and indeed Allah is All Knowing, Most Forbearing.
draft: He will allow them to enter a entrance where they will find pleasure. And surely, ALLAH is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.
hil: He will surely admit them into an entrance where they will find pleasure. And certainly, ALLAH is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.
compare: He will surely admit them into an entrance where they will find pleasure. And certainly, ALLAH is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.

src: Da ergriff Ich sie.
ref: Then I seized them.
draft: I caught her.
hil: I seized her.
compare: I seized her.

src: Habt ihr das Was ser betrachtet, das ihr trinkt?
ref: Consider the water that you drink.
draft: Have you considered the water you are drinking?
hil: Have you considered the water you are drinking?
compare: Have you considered the water you are drinking?

src: enn sie so glauben, wie ihr glaubt, dann werden sie rechtgeleitet sein; wenn sie sich aber abwenden, so sind sie nur in Abspaltung geraten.
ref: So if they believe in the like of that which ye believe in, surely they are guided; but if they turn away, then they are but in Cleavage.
draft: If they believe as you believe, then they are rightly guided; but if they turn away, then they have only rebelled.
hil: If they believe as you believe, they will be rightly guided; but if they turn away, they are only in rebellion.
compare: If they believe as you believe, they will be rightly guided; but if they turn away, they are only in rebellion.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir ahnen Böses von dir und von denen, die mit dir sind." Er sagte: "Euer Unheil ist bereits bei Allah. Nein, ihr seid ein Volk, das geprüft wird."
ref: They said, “We consider you an evil omen, and your companions”; he said, “Your evil omen is with Allah – in fact you people have fallen into trial.”
draft: They said, "We suspect evil from you and those who are with you." He said, "Your misfortune is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested."
hil: They said, 'We betoken evil from you and those who are with you.' He said, 'Your misfortune is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested.'
compare: They said, "We suspect evil from you and those who are with you." He said, "Your misfortune is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested."

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Entsinnt euch der Gabe ALLAHs euch gegenüber, als ein Volk euch Schaden zufügen wollte und ER sie von euch abgehalten hat. Und handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber. Und ALLAH gegenüber sollen die Mumin Tawakkul üben!
ref: O believers, remember God's blessing upon you, when a certain people purposed to stretch against you their hands, and He restrained their hands from you; and fear God; and in God let the believers put all their trust.
draft: You who have internalized the Imam! Remember Allah's gift to you when a people sought to harm you and He prevented them. And act according to Taqwa towards Allah. And the Mumin should have Tawakkul towards Allah!
hil: You who have internalized faith! Remember Allah's gift to you when a people sought to harm you and He prevented them. And act with Taqwa towards Allah. And believers should have Tawakkul towards Allah!
compare: You who have internalized faith! Remember Allah's gift to you when a people sought to harm you and He prevented them. And act with Taqwa towards Allah. And believers should have Tawakkul towards Allah!

src: Auch vor dir schickten Wir keine Gesandten, die keine Speise aßen oder nicht auf den Märkten umhergingen. Allein, Wir machen die einen unter euch zur Prüfung für die anderen.
ref: And all the Noble Messengers We sent before you were like this – eating food and walking in the markets; and We have made some of you a test for others; so will you, O people, patiently endure?
draft: Also before you, We did not send messengers who did not eat food or did not walk around in the markets. But We make some of you a test for others.
hil: We did not send Messengers before you who did not eat food or walk in the markets. Rather, We make some of you a trial for others.
compare: Also before you, We did not send messengers who did not eat food or did not walk around in the markets. But We make some of you a test for others.

src: So ließen WIR die 'Alaqa zu einer Mudgha werden, und WIR ließen die Mudgha zu Knochen werden, und die Knochen bedeckten WIR mit Fleisch, dann ließen WIR ihn als eine andere Schöpfung entstehen.
ref: Then We developed the lump into bones. Then We clothed the bones with flesh.
draft: So we made the 'Alaqa into a mudgha, and We made the mudgha into bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation.
hil: We allowed the 'Alaqa to become a mudgha, and We allowed the mudgha to become bones, and We covered the bones with flesh, then We created it as another creation.
compare: So we made the 'Alaqa into a mudgha, and We made the mudgha into bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation.

src: Und ALLAH vergibt den Mumin-Männern und den Mumin-Frauen. Und ALLAH ist immer allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: But Allah pardoneth believing men and believing women, and Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
draft: And Allah forgives the believing men and the believing women. And Allah is always all-forgiving, all-merciful.
hil: And Allah forgives the believing men and women, and Allah is ever-forgiving, ever-merciful.
compare: And Allah forgives the believing men and the believing women. And Allah is always all-forgiving, all-merciful.

src: Dann hat er (Schu'aib) sich von ihnen abgewendet und sagte: "Meine Leute! Gewiß, bereits habe ich euch die Botschaft meines HERRN verkündet und euch Ratschläge gemacht, also weshalb soll ich kufr-betreibenden Leuten nachtrauern?!
ref: So he turned his back on them, and said, 'O my people, I have delivered to you the Messages of my Lord, and advised you sincerely; how should I grieve for a people of unbelievers?'
draft: Then he (Shu'aib) turned away from them and said: "O my people! I have indeed conveyed to you the Message of my LORD and given you good advice, but you like not good advisers."
hil: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I have indeed conveyed to you the message of my Lord and offered you sincere advice, so why should I mourn for those who engage in disbelief?"
compare: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I have indeed conveyed to you the message of my Lord and offered you sincere advice, so why should I mourn for those who engage in disbelief?"

src: Ihr, die den Iman bekundet habt! Verinnerlicht den Iman an ALLAH, an Seinen Gesandten, an die Schrift, die ER Seinem Gesandten nach und nach hinabsandte und an die Schrift, die ER vorher hinabsandte.
ref: O believers, believe in God and His Messenger and the Book He has revealed to His Apostle, and the Books revealed before.
draft: You who have declared belief! Internalize the faith in Allah, in His Messenger, in the scripture that He sent down to His Messenger gradually, and in the scripture He sent down before.
hil: O believers, internalize your faith in Allah, in His Messenger, in the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger gradually and in the Book that He sent down before.
compare: O believers, internalize your faith in Allah, in His Messenger, in the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger gradually and in the Book that He sent down before.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir sind zu einem Volk von Übeltätern gesandt,
ref: "We have been sent," they said, "to (punish) a sinful people,
draft: They said: "We are sent to a people of evildoers,"
hil: They said, "We have been sent to a people of evildoers."
compare: They said, "We have been sent to a people of evildoers."

src: Und was euch an Dingen zuteil wurde, ist nur Verbrauchsgut des Diesseits und dessen Schmuck.
ref: Whatsoever has been given you is the stuff this life is made of, and only its embellishment.
draft: And what came to you of things is only [the enjoyment of] worldly life and its adornment.
hil: And what you have been given are only consumables and adornment of this world. And that which is with Allah is better and more lasting. Do you not have any sense?
compare: And what came to you of things is only [the enjoyment of] worldly life and its adornment.

src: Aber sie möchten nicht an das glauben, was sie zuvor geleugnet hatten. So versiegelt Allah die Herzen der Ungläubigen.
ref: Thus it is that Allah seals the hearts of those who deny the truth.
draft: But they do not want to believe in what they had previously denied. So Allah seals the hearts of the disbelievers.
hil: But they refuse to believe in what they had previously denied. Thus, Allah seals the hearts of the disbelievers.
compare: But they do not want to believe in what they had previously denied. So Allah seals the hearts of the disbelievers.

src: Gewiß, Wir haben die Tora hinabgesandt, in der Rechtleitung und Licht sind, womit die Propheten, die sich (Allah) ergeben hatten, für diejenigen, die dem Judentum angehören, walten, und so auch die Leute des Herrn und die Gelehrten, nach dem, was ihnen von der Schrift Allahs anvertraut worden war und worüber sie Zeugen waren. So fürchtet nicht die Menschen, sondern fürchtet Mich.
ref: Verily We sent down the Taurat wherein was a guidance and a light. By it the prophets who submitted themselves judged those who were judaised, and so did the divines and the priests by that wherewith they were entrusted of the Book of Allah and they had become witnesses thereof.
draft: Certainly, We have sent down the Torah, in which there is guidance and light, with which the prophets who had submitted to Allah judged for the Jews, and so did the people of the Lord and the scholars, according to what was entrusted to them from Allah's scripture and of which they were witnesses. So do not fear the people, but fear Me.
hil: Certainly, We have sent down the Torah, in which there is guidance and light, with which the prophets who had submitted to Allah judged for the Jews, and so did the people of the Lord and the scholars, according to what was entrusted to them from Allah's scripture and of which they were witnesses. So do not fear people but fear Me.
compare: Certainly, We have sent down the Torah, in which there is guidance and light, with which the prophets who had submitted to Allah judged for the Jews, and so did the people of the Lord and the scholars, according to what was entrusted to them from Allah's scripture and of which they were witnesses. So do not fear the people, but fear Me.

src: Und diejenigen, denen Wissen und Glauben zugekommen sind, sagen: «Nach dem Buch Gottes habt ihr bis zum Tag der Auferweckung verweilt. Und das ist der Tag der Auferweckung.
ref: Those who have received knowledge and have faith will say, "By the decree of God, you have remained for the exact period which was mentioned in the Book of God about the Day of Resurrection.
draft: And those to whom knowledge and faith have come say, "You have remained until the Day of Resurrection according to the Book of God. And this is the Day of Resurrection."
hil: Those to whom knowledge and faith have come say, 'You have remained until the Day of Resurrection according to the Book of God. And this is the Day of Resurrection.'
compare: And those to whom knowledge and faith have come say, "You have remained until the Day of Resurrection according to the Book of God. And this is the Day of Resurrection."

src: Diejenigen von euch, die sie zu Freunden nehmen, das sind die, die Unrecht tun.
ref: Whosoever of you then befriendeth them then those! they are the wrong-doers.
draft: Those of you who take them as friends are the ones who do wrong.
hil: Those who take them as friends are the ones who do wrong.
compare: Those who take them as friends are the ones who do wrong.

src: Fir'aun hatte sein Volk in die Irre geführt und nicht rechtgeleitet.
ref: The Pharaoh had led his people astray, and did not rightly guide them.
draft: Pharaoh had led his people astray and did not guide them properly.
hil: Pharaoh had led his people astray and did not guide them properly.
compare: Pharaoh had led his people astray and did not guide them properly.

src: Gewiß, dieser ist ein Feind für dich und für deine Gattin. Also lasst ihn nicht euch beide aus der Dschanna herausbringen, sonst mußt du dich mühen.
ref: This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil.
draft: Certainly, he is an enemy for you and your wife. So do not let him bring you both out of the Jannah, otherwise you will have to struggle.
hil: "Certainly, he is an enemy for you and your wife. So do not let him take you both out of the Jannah, otherwise you
compare: "Certainly, he is an enemy for you and your wife. So do not let him take you both out of the Jannah, otherwise you

src: ER vergibt, wem ER will, und peinigt, wen ER will.
ref: No: You are only mortals, of His creation."
draft: HE forgives whom HE wills, and punishes whom HE wills.
hil: HE forgives whom HE pleases, and afflicts whom HE pleases.
compare: HE forgives whom HE wills, and punishes whom HE wills.

src: Das sind die Parteien.
ref: These were the hordes.
draft: These are the parties.
hil: These are the parties.
compare: These are the parties.

src: Und sie pflegten zu sagen: "Wie?
ref: And said: "What!
draft: And they used to say: "What?
hil: And they used to say, 'What?'
compare: And they used to say: "What?

src: Das ist der Genuß im diesseitigen Leben. Doch bei Allah ist die schöne Heimstatt.
ref: That is the enjoyment of the present life; but God -- with Him is the fairest resort.
draft: "This is the enjoyment in this worldly life. But with Allah is the beautiful abode."
hil: This is the enjoyment of earthly life, but with Allah is the beautiful abode.
compare: "This is the enjoyment in this worldly life. But with Allah is the beautiful abode."

src: So legen Wir die Zeichen ausführlich dar, - auf daß sie umkehren mögen.
ref: That is how We explain Our signs distinctly so that they may come back (to the right path).
draft: We explain the signs in detail, so that they may repent.
hil: We explain Our signs in detail, so that they may repent.
compare: We explain Our signs in detail, so that they may repent.

src: Das ist die Frohbotschaft, die Gott seinen Dienern, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, verkündet. Sprich: Ich verlange von euch keinen Lohn dafür, es sei denn die Liebe wie zu den Verwandten.
ref: That is that whereof Allah giveth the glad tidings Unto His bondmen who believe and work righteous works, Say thou: I ask of you no hire therefor save affection in respect of kinship.
draft: This is the good news that God announces to his servants who believe and do good deeds. Say: I do not ask you for any wage for it, except love as for the relatives.
hil: This is the good news that God gives to those who believe and do good deeds. Say: I do not ask you for any wages for it, except the love you have for your relatives.
compare: This is the good news that God gives to those who believe and do good deeds. Say: I do not ask you for any wages for it, except the love you have for your relatives.

src: Und vor Mir (allein) sollt ihr Ehrfurcht haben.
ref: Me, you must fear.
draft: And before me (alone) you shall have reverence.
hil: And you shall have reverence before Me (alone).
compare: And before me (alone) you shall have reverence.

src: Und Wir haben ihn als Koran in Abschnitte geteilt, damit du ihn den Menschen ohne Hast verliest. Und Wir haben ihn nach und nach hinabgesandt.
ref: And We sent down the Qur’an in parts, that you may gradually recite it to the people, and We sent it down slowly in stages.
draft: And We have divided it (i.e., the Quran) into distinct sections that you may recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down gradually.
hil: And We have divided it into distinct sections (the Quran), that you (Prophet Muhammad) may recite it to the people over a prolonged period, and We have sent it down gradually.
compare: And We have divided it into distinct sections (the Quran), that you (Prophet Muhammad) may recite it to the people over a prolonged period, and We have sent it down gradually.

src: Sollte Der Allgnade Erweisende mir Schaden zufügen, würden weder ihre Fürbitte mir etwas nützen, noch würden sie mich erretten.
ref: So that if the Most Gracious should wish me any harm, their intercession would be of no use to me, nor would they be able to save me?”
draft: If the gracious one were to harm me, neither their intercession would do me any good, nor would they save me.
hil: If the Merciful were to cause harm to me, neither their intercession would benefit me nor would they be able to rescue me.
compare: If the Merciful were to cause harm to me, neither their intercession would benefit me nor would they be able to rescue me.

src: Und (einen Teil) der Nacht, verbringe ihn damit, zusätzlich für dich.
ref: And in some parts of the night (also) offer the Salat (prayer) with it (i.e. recite the Quran in the prayer), as an additional prayer (Tahajjud optional prayer Nawafil) for you (O Muhammad SAW).
draft: And (a part) of the night, spend it with doing something extra for yourself.
hil: And spend (a part) of the night by doing something extra for yourself.
compare: And spend (a part) of the night by doing something extra for yourself.

src: Ein anderer Teil sorgte sich jedoch nur um sich selbst, sie dachten von ALLAH alles andere als das Wahre, eben das Denken der unwissenden Gemeinschaft, sie sagten: "Haben wir in dieser Angelegenheit irgendwelchen Einfluß?!"
ref: Slumber overtook a party of you, while another party was thinking about themselves (as how to save their ownselves, ignoring the others and the Prophet SAW) and thought wrongly of Allah - the thought of ignorance.
draft: Another part, however, was only concerned with themselves. They thought of ALLAH anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community. They said, "Do we have any influence in this matter?!"
hil: Another part, however, was only concerned with themselves. They thought of Allah anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community. They said, 'Do we have any influence in this matter?!'
compare: Another part, however, was only concerned with themselves. They thought of ALLAH anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community. They said, "Do we have any influence in this matter?!"

src: Handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber, strebt nach dem, womit ihr Sein Wohlgefallen erreicht und leistet Dschihad fi-sabilillah, damit ihr erfolgreich werdet.
ref: Fear Allah, and seek the means towards Him, and strive in His cause, in the hope of attaining success.
draft: Act with Taqwa towards Allah, seek what will please Him, and strive in the path of Allah so that you may be successful.
hil: Act with Taqwa towards Allah, seek what will please Him, and strive in the path of Allah so that you may be successful.
compare: Act with Taqwa towards Allah, seek what will please Him, and strive in the path of Allah so that you may be successful.

src: (Dies), außer das Wort Ibrahims zu seinem Vater: "Ich werde ganz gewiß für dich um Vergebung bitten; doch vermag ich für dich vor Allah gar nichts auszurichten.
ref: (Except that Abraham said unto his father, 'Certainly I shall ask pardon for thee; but I have no power to do aught for thee against God.')
draft: "Dies", except for Ibrahim's words to his father: "I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I cannot accomplish anything for you in front of Allah."
hil: Except for the words of Abraham to his father: 'I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I cannot accomplish anything for you in front of Allah.'
compare: "Dies", except for Ibrahim's words to his father: "I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I cannot accomplish anything for you in front of Allah."

src: Also manche von ihnen haben den Iman verinnerlicht und manche von ihnen haben Kufr betrieben. Und hätte ALLAH es gewollt, hätten sie den bewaffneten Kampf gegenseitig nicht geführt, doch ALLAH macht, was ER will.
ref: If Allah had willed, they would not have fought against one another, but Allah does what He likes.
draft: Some of them have internalized faith and some of them have committed kufr. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other in armed combat, but Allah does what He pleases.
hil: Some of them have internalized faith and some of them have committed disbelief. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other in armed combat, but Allah does what He pleases.
compare: Some of them have internalized faith and some of them have committed disbelief. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other in armed combat, but Allah does what He pleases.

src: Er sagte: "Gewiß, bereits tat er dir Unrecht mit seiner Forderung zur Überlassung deines Schafsweibchen zu seinen Schafsweibchen. Und gewiß, die meisten der Beteiligten begehen doch Übertretungen die einen von ihnen gegen die anderen außer denjenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht und gottgefällig Gutes getan haben. Doch diese sind wenige." Und Dawud dachte, daß WIR ihn nur einer Fitna unterzogen haben. Dann bat er seinen HERRN um Vergebung, fiel in Ruku' nieder und war umkehrend.
ref: Said he, 'Assuredly he has wronged thee in asking for thy ewe in addition to his sheep; and indeed many intermixers do injury one against the other, save those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- and how few they are!' And David thought that We had only tried him; therefore he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he fell down, bowing, and he repented.
draft: He said, "Certainly, he had already wronged you with his demand to take your female sheep to his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other, except for those who have internalized the iman and done good deeds pleasing to God. But these are few." And Dawud thought that WE had only subjected him to a fitnah. Then he asked his LORD for forgiveness, fell into Ruku' and was repentant.
hil: He said, "Certainly, he already wronged you by demanding your female sheep to be given to his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other, except for those who believe and do good deeds pleasing to God. But these are few." And Dawud thought that WE had only subjected him to a trial. Then he asked his LORD for forgiveness, fell into Ruku' and was repentant."
compare: He said, "Certainly, he had already wronged you with his demand to take your female sheep to his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other, except for those who have internalized the iman and done good deeds pleasing to God. But these are few." And Dawud thought that WE had only subjected him to a fitnah. Then he asked his LORD for forgiveness, fell into Ruku' and was repentant.

src: Dies (geschah deshalb), weil sie immer wieder die Zeichen Allahs leugneten und die Propheten zu Unrecht töteten; dies (geschah), weil sie sich auflehnten und immer wieder übertraten.
ref: This, because they were ever disbelieving in the signs of Allah and slaying the prophets without justice. This, because they disobeyed and were ever trespassing.
draft: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets; this happened because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.
hil: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of God, killed the prophets unjustly, and rebelled and transgressed repeatedly.
compare: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets; this happened because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.

src: (Hätten Wir dich nicht entsandt), würden sie sagen, wenn sie ein Unglück trifft wegen dessen, was ihre Hände vorausgeschickt haben: "Unser Herr, hättest Du doch einen Gesandten zu uns gesandt, so daß wir Deinen Zeichen hätten folgen können und zu den Gläubigen'hätten gehören können!"
ref: And in case disaster comes upon them for what they have done themselves, they should say: "O Lord, why did You not send an apostle to us that we should have followed Your commands, and been with those who are believers;"
draft: "If We had not sent you, they would say, when disaster afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, "If only we had a messenger so we could follow his signs and be among the believers.""
hil: "If We had not sent you, they would say, when disaster afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, 'If only we had a messenger so we could follow his signs and be among the believers.'"
compare: "If We had not sent you, they would say, when disaster afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, "If only we had a messenger so we could follow his signs and be among the believers.""

src: An dem Tag, wenn ER sie allesamt erweckt, werden sie Ihm schwören, wie sie euch schwören, und sie denken, sie verfügen über etwas (Nützliches).
ref: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all together (for their account), then they will swear to Him as they swear to you (O Muslims).
draft: On the day when He resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you and they think they have something useful.
hil: On the day when God resurrects them all together, they will swear to Him as they swore to you and think that they have a good case, but they are certainly liars.
compare: On the day when He resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you and they think they have something useful.

src: Vielleicht tue ich Gutes in dem, was ich hinterlassen habe.» Nein, das ist nur ein Wort, das er (so) sagt.
ref: "In order that I may work righteousness in the things I neglected." - "By no means!
draft: "Maybe I am doing good in what I have left behind." "No, that's just a word he says."
hil: "Maybe I am doing good in what I have left behind." "No, that's just something he says."
compare: "Maybe I am doing good in what I have left behind." "No, that's just something he says."

src: Dann konnten sie weder aufstehen, noch wurde ihnen beigestanden.
ref: And neither stand up nor defend themselves.
draft: Then they could neither get up nor were they assisted.
hil: They were neither able to rise nor were they assisted.
compare: Then they could neither get up nor were they assisted.

src: Ich bitte euch nicht um eine Belohnung dafür. Meine Belohnung obliegt doch nur Demjenigen, Der mich erschuf.
ref: “O my people, I ask you no wage for it; my wage lies with Him who originated me.
draft: I do not ask you for a reward for it. My reward is only up to the One Who created me.
hil: My reward is only up to the One Who created me, I'm not asking for a reward from you.
compare: I do not ask you for a reward for it. My reward is only up to the One Who created me.

src: Dann entsandten Wir nach ihnen Mose mit unseren Zeichen zu Pharao und seinen Vornehmen.
ref: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite, but they wronged them.
draft: Then We sent Moses to them with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs.
hil: We sent Moses to Pharaoh and his leaders with Our signs.
compare: Then We sent Moses to them with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs.

src: Und Al'ahrsch von deinem HERRN tragen über ihnen an diesem Tag acht.
ref: And on that Day, eight (of them) will carry the Throne of your Lord above them.
draft: And the burden from your Lord will be carried over them on this day by eight.
hil: And on this day, eight will bear the load from your Lord over them.
compare: And on this day, eight will bear the load from your Lord over them.

src: Wenn die Heuchler und diejenigen, in deren Herzen Krankheit ist, und diejenigen, die beunruhigende Falschmeldungen in der Stadt verbreiten, (damit) nicht aufhören, werden Wir dich bestimmt gegen sie antreiben.
ref: If the hypocrites and those who have a disease in their hearts, and those who make a commotion in the City do not desist, We will surely urge you against them.
draft: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease and those who spread disturbing rumors in the city do not cease, We will most certainly drive you against them.
hil: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts there is sickness and those who spread disturbing false news in the city do not stop, We will surely urge you on against them.
compare: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease and those who spread disturbing rumors in the city do not cease, We will most certainly drive you against them.

src: Und die weiblichen Guten sind für die männlichen Guten, und die männlichen Guten sind für die weiblichen Guten bestimmt, diese sind unschuldig hinsichtlich dessen, was sie (die anderen an Ifk-Lüge) sagen. Für sie ist Vergebung und edles Rizq bestimmt.
ref: Good statements are for good people (or good women for good men) and good people for good statements (or good men for good women), such (good people) are innocent of (each and every) bad statement which they say, for them is Forgiveness, and Rizqun Karim (generous provision i.e. Paradise).
draft: And the female righteous are intended for the male righteous, and the male righteous are intended for the female righteous. They are innocent of what the others say about Ifk-Lie. Forgiveness and noble Rizq are intended for them.
hil: The female good are intended for the male good, and the male good are intended for the female good. They are innocent of what the others say about the Ifk-lie. Forgiveness and noble sustenance is destined for them.
compare: And the female righteous are intended for the male righteous, and the male righteous are intended for the female righteous. They are innocent of what the others say about Ifk-Lie. Forgiveness and noble Rizq are intended for them.

src: (Es gilt) schöne Geduld (zu üben). Gott ist der, der um Hilfe gebeten wird gegen das, was ihr beschreibt.»
ref: He said: nay! your selves have embellished for you an affair; so seemly patience! and Allah is to be implored for help in that which ye ascribe
draft: "Beautiful patience (is to be practiced). God is the one who is asked for help against what you describe."
hil: Beautiful patience should be practiced. God is the one to be asked for help against what you describe.
compare: Beautiful patience should be practiced. God is the one to be asked for help against what you describe.

src: Doch es ist nichts als eine Ermahnung für die Weltenbewohner.
ref: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.
draft: But it is nothing more than a reminder for the inhabitants of the worlds.
hil: Yet it is nothing but a reminder to the inhabitants of the worlds.
compare: Yet it is nothing but a reminder to the inhabitants of the worlds.

src: Oder glaubt ihr in Sicherheit davor zu sein, daß Er euch ein anderes Mal aufs Meer zurückbringt und einen verheerenden Wind gegen euch sendet und euch ertrinken läßt, weil ihr ungläubig seid, und (daß) ihr dann für euch keinen Gefolgsmann findet, der Uns deswegen belangen könnte?
ref: Or you feel so secure that He will not send you back (to sea) again or send a gravel-hurtling storm against you, and drown you for your ingratitude? Then you will not find any avenger against Us.
draft: Or do you think you are safe from Him returning you to the sea another time and sending a devastating wind against you, drowning you because you are unbelievers, and then finding no defender for yourselves who could help you against Us?
hil: Do you think that you are safe from Him returning you to the sea another time and sending a devastating wind against you, drowning you because you are unbelievers, and then finding no defender for yourselves who could help you against Us?
compare: Or do you think you are safe from Him returning you to the sea another time and sending a devastating wind against you, drowning you because you are unbelievers, and then finding no defender for yourselves who could help you against Us?

src: Doch WIR sehen mit euch nicht eure Fürbittenden, die ihr unter euch als Partner (für ALLAH) angenommen habt.
ref: We do not see your intercessors with you who, you imagined, had partnership with you.
draft: However, we do not see with you your intercessors whom you have taken as partners (for Allah) among yourselves.
hil: However, We do not see with you those whom you have assumed as partners for Allah among yourselves as intercessors.
compare: However, we do not see with you your intercessors whom you have taken as partners (for Allah) among yourselves.

src: Seht ihr denn nicht?
ref: Can you not perceive?
draft: Do you not see?
hil: Do you not see?
compare: Do you not see?

src: Sie sagte: "Ihr Entscheidungsträger!
draft: She said: "You decision maker!
hil: "She said: 'You decision maker!'"
compare: "She said: 'You decision maker!'"

src: Und die Ungläubigen sagen von den Gläubigen: "Wäre er (der Quran) etwas Gutes, hätten sie ihn nicht vor uns erlangt." Und da sie sich nicht von ihm leiten lassen, sagen sie: "Dies ist eine alte Lüge."
ref: And the disbelievers said regarding the Muslims, “If there were any good in it, the Muslims would not have surpassed us in achieving it!”; and since they did not receive guidance with it, they will now say, “This is an old slander.”
draft: And those who disbelieve say of those who believe, "If it had [truly] been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And when they are not guided by it, they will say, "
hil: And those who disbelieve say of those who believe, "If it had truly been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And as they are not guided by it, they say, "This is an ancient lie."
compare: And those who disbelieve say of those who believe, "If it had [truly] been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And when they are not guided by it, they will say, "

src: Er hat die Schlüssel der Himmel und der Erde. Diejenigen, die die Zeichen Gottes verleugnen, das sind die Verlierer.
ref: He has the keys of the heavens and the earth; and those who deny the revelations of God will be losers.
draft: He has the keys to the heaven and the earth. Those who deny the signs of God are the losers.
hil: He holds the keys to the heavens and the earth. Those who deny the signs of God, they are the losers.
compare: He has the keys to the heaven and the earth. Those who deny the signs of God are the losers.

src: Ihre Gesandten sagten: "Existiert etwa ein Zweifel über Allah, den Schöpfer der Himmel und der Erde?
ref: Said their apostles: "Can there be doubt about God, the originator of the heavens and the earth?
draft: Their messengers said: "Is there any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?"
hil: Did any doubt arise about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?
compare: Their messengers said: "Is there any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?"

src: Jene sind (überhaupt) die Unachtsamen.
ref: They are the heedless ones.
draft: Those are the careless ones (at all).
hil: Those are the inattentive ones (at all).
compare: Those are the careless ones (at all).

src: Einen Teil tötetet ihr, und einen Teil nahmt ihr gefangen.
ref: Some of them you killed, and others you took captive.
draft: You killed a part, and you captured a part.
hil: You killed part of them and captured the other part.
compare: You killed part of them and captured the other part.

src: Allah hat gesagt: Nehmt euch nicht zwei Götter. Er ist nur ein Einziger Gott. Vor Mir (allein) sollt ihr Ehrfurcht haben.
ref: And Allah has proclaimed, “Do not ascribe two Gods; indeed He is the only One God; therefore fear Me alone.”
draft: Allah has said: Do not take two gods. He is the only one God. You shall have reverence before Me alone.
hil: Allah has said: Take not two gods. He is the only one God. You shall have reverence before Me alone.
compare: Allah has said: Do not take two gods. He is the only one God. You shall have reverence before Me alone.

src: Ehefrauen des Propheten! Welche von euch eine bewiesene Abscheulichkeit vollbringt, für diese wird die Peinigung verzweifacht. Und dies ist für ALLAH immer ein Leichtes.
ref: Wives of the Prophet, whosoever among you commits a flagrant indecency, for her the chastisement shall be doubled; that is easy for God.
draft: Wives of the Prophet! Whichever of you commits a proven act of abomination will have her punishment doubled. And this is always easy for Allah.
hil: Wives of the Prophet! If any of you commits a proven act of indecency, her punishment will be doubled. And this is always easy for Allah.
compare: Wives of the Prophet! If any of you commits a proven act of indecency, her punishment will be doubled. And this is always easy for Allah.

src: Und hätte dein HERR es gewollt, hätte ER doch die Menschen zu einer einzigen Umma gemacht - sie aber bleiben uneins
ref: But if your Lord had pleased He could have made all human beings into one community of belief. But they would still have differed from one another,
draft: And if your LORD had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ.
hil: If your Lord had willed, He could have made all people one community - but they remain divided.
compare: And if your LORD had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ.

src: Und seid nicht wie diejenigen, die sich gespalten haben und uneins geworden sind, nachdem die deutlichen Zeichen zu ihnen gekommen waren.
ref: So be not like those who became disunited and differed among themselves after clear proofs had come to them.
draft: And do not be like those who have split and become divided after the clear signs came to them.
hil: And be not like those who have divided and differed after the clear signs came to them.
compare: And do not be like those who have split and become divided after the clear signs came to them.

src: Sie sagten: "Fürchte dich nicht!" Und sie überbrachten ihm frohe Botschaft über einen äußerst wissenden Jungen.
ref: They said, “Do not fear,” and they announced to him the good news of a knowledgeable boy.
draft: They said: "Do not be afraid!" And they brought him good news about an extremely knowledgeable boy.
hil: They said, 'Do not be afraid!' And they brought him glad tidings of an extremely knowledgeable boy.
compare: They said, 'Do not be afraid!' And they brought him glad tidings of an extremely knowledgeable boy.

src: Dies (ist deshalb so), weil jene, die ungläubig sind, dem Trügerischen folgen, und weil diejenigen, die gläubig sind, der Wahrheit ihres Herrn folgen. So beschreibt Allah den Menschen ihre Lage.
ref: This is because the disbelievers followed falsehood and the believers followed the Truth which is from their Lord; this is how Allah illustrates the examples of people to them.
draft: This is therefore so because those who are unbelievers follow the deceptive, and those who are believers follow the truth of their Lord. So Allah describes to people their situation.
hil: Accordingly, those who are unbelievers follow the deceptive, while those who are believers follow the truth of their Lord. In this way, Allah describes the situation of people.
compare: Accordingly, those who are unbelievers follow the deceptive, while those who are believers follow the truth of their Lord. In this way, Allah describes the situation of people.

src: Als die Nacht über ihn hereinbrach, sah er einen Himmelskörper. Er sagte: "Das ist mein Herr."
ref: When the night came with her covering of darkness he saw a star, and (Azar, his father) said: "This is my Lord."
draft: As the night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body. He said, "That is my Lord."
