compare: Say, "The bad and the good are not equal, even if you should find pleasure in the abundance of bad." Act with Taqwa towards Allah, you wise ones! So that you may achieve success.

src: Dann bestimmte ER sie zu sieben Himmeln in zwei Ay-yam, und ließ in jedem Himmel seine Anweisung als Wahy zuteil werden.
ref: Then He completed and finished from their creation (as) seven heavens in two Days and He made in each heaven its affair.
draft: Then HE appointed for them seven heavens in two days and sent down to each heaven its instruction as Wahy (revelation).
hil: HE, then, designated seven heavens for them in two days and made His instruction as Wahy descend in each heaven.
compare: Then HE appointed for them seven heavens in two days and sent down to each heaven its instruction as Wahy (revelation).

src: Und dem, der von ihnen sagen wollte: "lch bin ein Gott neben Ihm", würden Wir es mit Gahannam vergelten. Und ebenso vergelten Wir es den Ungerechten.
ref: If any one of them said: "I am God besides Him," We should award him Hell; for this is how We requite the evil-doers.
draft: And to him who would say of them, "I am a god beside Him", We would repay with Hell, and thus do We repay the wrongdoers.
hil: And to those who would say of them, 'I am a god beside Him,' We would repay with Hell, and thus do We repay the wrongdoers.'
compare: And to him who would say of them, "I am a god beside Him", We would repay with Hell, and thus do We repay the wrongdoers.

src: Oder haben sie (etwa) Teilhaber?
ref: Or have they any partners?
draft: Or do they have (perhaps) partners?
hil: Or have they (perhaps) taken partners?
compare: Or do they have (perhaps) partners?

src: Das ist Frevel. Heute sind diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, an eurer Religion verzweifelt, so fürchtet sie nicht, sondern fürchtet Mich.
ref: Today the unbelievers have despaired of your religion; therefore fear them not, but fear you Me.
draft: This is blasphemy. Today those who are unbelievers have despaired of your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me.
hil: "This is blasphemy. We have perfected your religion for you today, completed Our favor upon you, and chosen Islam as your religion. Do not follow the unlawful and forbid what is legal, and do not fear people, but fear Allah, for He is the most knowledgeable of everything."
compare: This is blasphemy. Today those who are unbelievers have despaired of your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me.

src: Nur ein wenig erweist ihr euch dankbar.
ref: How little are the thanks you offer!"
draft: Just a little bit you prove yourself grateful.
hil: You prove yourselves grateful just a little.
compare: You prove yourselves grateful just a little.

src: Sind sie etwa nicht auf Erden umhergezogen, damit sie sehen, wie das Anschließende derjenigen vor ihnen war.
ref: Did they not travel in the land to see what sort of fate befell those before them?
draft: Are they not wandering on earth so that they can see how the successors of those before them were?
hil: Did they not travel the earth so that they could see how the end of those who were before them was?
compare: Did they not travel the earth so that they could see how the end of those who were before them was?

src: Da kam Allah über sie, von wo sie nicht (damit) rechneten, und jagte in ihre Herzen Schrecken, so daß sie ihre Häuser mit ihren (eigenen) Händen und den Händen der Gläubigen zerstörten.
ref: But God came upon them from where they did not suspect, and filled their hearts with terror, so that they destroyed their homes with their own hands (or were destroyed) by the hands of believers.
draft: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect and cast terror into their hearts, so they destroyed their houses with their [own] hands and the hands of the believers.
hil: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect and cast terror into their hearts, so they destroyed their houses with their [own] hands and the hands of the believers.
compare: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect and cast terror into their hearts, so they destroyed their houses with their [own] hands and the hands of the believers.

src: Und Wir ließen sie in Unsere Barmherzigkeit eingehen; denn sie gehörten zu den Rechtschaffenen.
ref: And they were admitted to Our grace. Verily they were among the doers of good.
draft: And We let them enter Our mercy, for they were among the righteous.
hil: And We let them enter Our mercy, for they belonged to the righteous.
compare: And We let them enter Our mercy, for they were among the righteous.

src: Das Urteil ist allein Allahs.
ref: Authority belongs to God alone.
draft: "The judgement is solely Allah's."
hil: The verdict is solely Allah's and only He knows.
compare: "The judgement is solely Allah's."

src: Und du hattest nicht erwartet, daß das Buch an dich gerichtet würde.
ref: (O Prophet), you never looked forward for the Book to be revealed to you.
draft: And you had not expected that the book would be addressed to you.
hil: And you did not expect that the book would be addressed to you.
compare: And you had not expected that the book would be addressed to you.

src: Das ist ein Versprechen Gottes. Gott bricht sein Versprechen nicht. Aber die meisten Menschen wissen nicht Bescheid.
ref: The promise of Allah; Allah does not renege on His promise, but most people do not know.
draft: This is a promise of God. God does not break His promise. But most people are unaware.
hil: It is a promise from God and God does not break His promises, but most people do not know.
compare: It is a promise from God and God does not break His promises, but most people do not know.

src: Schau, wie Wir die Zeichen verschiedenartig darlegen!
ref: Behold how We turn about the signs!
draft: Look how we present the signs in different ways!
hil: Look how we present the signs differently!
compare: Look how we present the signs in different ways!

src: Den Gottesfürchtigen obliegt nicht die Verantwortung für jene, sondern nur das Ermahnen, auf daß jene gottesfürchtig werden mögen.
ref: As for the heedful and devout, they are not accountable for them, but should give advice: They may haply come to fear God.
draft: The responsibility for those does not belong to the God-fearing, only the admonition that they may become God-fearing.
hil: It is not the responsibility of the God-fearing for them, but only the admonition, that they may become God-fearing.
compare: It is not the responsibility of the God-fearing for them, but only the admonition, that they may become God-fearing.

src: Das ist besser für euch und lauterer. Wenn ihr aber nicht (die Möglichkeit dazu) findet, dann ist Allah wahrlich All verzeihend, Barmherzig.
ref: When you wish to humbly consult with the Noble Messenger, give some charity before you consult; that is much better and much purer for you; so if you do not have the means, then (know that) Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.
draft: This is better for you and purer. But if you do not find the means, then surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
hil: This is better and purer for you. But if you are unable, then Allah is truly Forgiving, Merciful.
compare: This is better for you and purer. But if you do not find the means, then surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

src: Die Ungläubigen geben wahrlich ihr Vermögen (dafür) aus, um von Allahs Weg abzuhalten.
ref: Those who disbelieve spend their possessions on turning men away from God.
draft: The unbelievers truly spend their wealth (for this) to prevent (others) from the path of Allah.
hil: The unbelievers indeed spend their wealth to prevent (people) from the path of Allah.
compare: The unbelievers indeed spend their wealth to prevent (people) from the path of Allah.

src: Es gibt keine Gottheit außer Ihm. Gepriesen-erhaben ist ER über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Too holy is He for what they ascribe to Him!
draft: There is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him.
hil: There is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him.
compare: There is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him.

src: Ihr macht ja daraus Papyrusblätter, die ihr offen zeigt - und ihr haltet vieles geheim; und euch wurde beigebracht, was ihr nicht wußtet, weder ihr noch eure Väter. Sprich: Gott.
ref: Some of it ye disclose and much thereof ye conceal. And ye were taught that which ye knew not: neither ye nor your fathers.
draft: You make papyrus leaves out of it, which you show openly - and you keep many things secret; and you have been taught what you did not know, neither you nor your fathers. Say: God.
hil: You make papyrus leaves out of it, which you show openly - and you keep many things secret; and you have been taught what you did not know, neither your forefathers. Say: God.
compare: You make papyrus leaves out of it, which you show openly - and you keep many things secret; and you have been taught what you did not know, neither your forefathers. Say: God.

src: Und darin sollen die Konkurrierenden konkurrieren,
ref: So for this let the competitors compete.
draft: "And therein the competitors shall compete."
hil: And therein shall the competitors compete.
compare: "And therein the competitors shall compete."

src: Und es gibt nichts, dessen Schatzkammern nicht bei Uns wären.
ref: And there is not a thing, but with Us are the stores thereof.
draft: And there is nothing whose treasure chambers are not with Us.
hil: There is nothing whose treasuries are not with Us.
compare: And there is nothing whose treasure chambers are not with Us.

src: Und WIR haben dich über sie nicht als Hüter eingesetzt und du bist über sie kein Wakil.
ref: We have not appointed you their guardian, nor are you their pleader.
draft: And we have not appointed you over them as a guardian, and you are not a Wakil over them.
hil: And We have not appointed you as a guardian over them, and you are not a Wakil over them.
compare: And we have not appointed you over them as a guardian, and you are not a Wakil over them.

src: Vergib mir und schenke mir eine Herrschaft, die niemandem nach mir möglich wird. Gewiß, DU bist Der reichlich Schenkende."
ref: Forgive me and bestow upon me a kingdom, which shall not befit anyone after me; indeed only You are the Great Bestower.”
draft: "Forgive me and grant me a dominion that will be possible for no one after me. Indeed, YOU are the abundantly giving."
hil: Forgive me and grant me a dominion that will be possible for no one after me. Indeed, You are the abundantly giving.
compare: "Forgive me and grant me a dominion that will be possible for no one after me. Indeed, YOU are the abundantly giving."

src: Das Ende von beiden war, daß sie nun im Feuer sind; darin werden sie ewig weilen. Und das ist die Vergeltung für die, die Unrecht tun.
ref: So the fate of them both is that they are both in the fire, to remain in it forever; and this is the proper punishment for the unjust.
draft: The end of both was that they are now in the fire; therein they will abide eternally. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.
hil: The end of both is that they are now in the fire, where they will abide eternally. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.
compare: The end of both was that they are now in the fire; therein they will abide eternally. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.

src: Und nachdem sie von da weiterzogen, sagte er seinem Dienstjungen: "Bereite uns unser Mittagessen, gewiß, bereits haben wir auf dieser unserer Reise große Mühe gehabt.
ref: When they had gone past (the confluence), Moses said to his servant: "Give me my breakfast. I am exhausted from this journey."
draft: And after they continued from there, he said to his servant: "Prepare us our lunch, certainly, we have already had great trouble on this journey of ours."
hil: And after they moved on from there, he said to his servant, 'Prepare us our lunch. Surely, we have already faced great hardship on this journey of ours.'
compare: And after they moved on from there, he said to his servant, 'Prepare us our lunch. Surely, we have already faced great hardship on this journey of ours.'

src: Den Gläubigen ist dies verboten.
ref: This is forbidden the believers,
draft: "The believers are forbidden to do this."
hil: To the believers, this is prohibited.
compare: "The believers are forbidden to do this."

src: O mein Volk, seht ihr, wie ich euch zur Rettung rufe, ihr mich aber zum (Höllen)feuer ruft?
ref: O my people, what is wrong with me that I am calling you to preservation, while you invite me to the Fire!
draft: O my people, do you see how I call you to salvation, but you call me to (hell) fire?
hil: O my people, do you see how I am calling you for salvation, but you are calling me to (Hell) fire?
compare: O my people, do you see how I am calling you for salvation, but you are calling me to (Hell) fire?

src: Doch schön geduldig sein. Vielleicht wird Allah sie mir alle wiederbringen; denn Er ist der Allwissende, der Allweise."
ref: "You have made up the story; but patience is best; God may bring them back to me. He is all-knowing and all-wise."
draft: But be patient and hopeful. Maybe Allah will bring them all back to me; for He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.
hil: Yet, be patient and hopeful. Maybe Allah will bring them all back to me, for He is the All-Knowing and the All-Wise.
compare: But be patient and hopeful. Maybe Allah will bring them all back to me; for He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

src: Sollen wir wirklich, wenn wir gestorben und zu Staub geworden sind...? Das ist doch eine Rückkehr von weiter Entfernung.»
ref: When we are dead and turned to dust, this returning (to life) is most far-fetched."
draft: Should we really, when we have died and turned to dust...? That is a return from far away.
hil: Should we really, when we have died and turned to dust...? That is a return from far away.
compare: Should we really, when we have died and turned to dust...? That is a return from far away.

src: Meine Leute! Handelt euren Standpunkten entsprechend, auch ich handle. Ihr werdet noch wissen, wen Peinigung überkommt, welche ihn erniedrigt, und wer Lügner ist. Wartet nur ab! Ich warte ebenfalls mit euch ab."
ref: “And O my people! Keep on with your works in your positions, I am doing mine; very soon you will come to know – upon whom comes the punishment that will disgrace him, and who is the liar; and wait – I too am waiting with you.”
draft: "My people! Act according to your positions, as well as I do. You will yet know who chastisement overcomes, which humiliates him, and who is a liar. Just wait! I am also waiting with you."
hil: My people! Act according to your positions, just like I do. You will soon know who is overtaken by punishment, who humiliates him, and who is a liar. Just wait! I am waiting with you.
compare: My people! Act according to your positions, just like I do. You will soon know who is overtaken by punishment, who humiliates him, and who is a liar. Just wait! I am waiting with you.

src: Als sie vorbeigegangen waren, sagte er zu seinem Burschen: "Bringe uns unser Mittagessen. Wir haben ja durch diese unsere Reise (viel) Mühsal erlitten."
ref: So when they had gone beyond that place, Moosa said to his assistant, “Bring our breakfast – we have indeed faced great exertion in this journey of ours.”
draft: After they had passed by, he said to his servant, "Bring us our lunch. We have suffered (a lot) hardship through this journey of ours."
hil: After passing by, he said to his servant, "Bring us our lunch. Indeed, we have suffered a lot of hardships throughout this journey of ours."
compare: After they had passed by, he said to his servant, "Bring us our lunch. We have suffered (a lot) hardship through this journey of ours."

src: Also sag: "Das Verborgene kennt nur ALLAH, so wartet ab!
ref: Tell them: "Unknown things are only known to God.
draft: Therefore say: "Only ALLAH knows the hidden, so wait!".
hil: So say: "Only Allah knows the hidden, so wait!"
compare: So say: "Only Allah knows the hidden, so wait!"

src: Und erinnert euch an das, was in euren Wohnstätten von ALLAHs Ayat und der Weisheit vorgetragen wird. Gewiß, ALLAH ist immer allgütig, allkundig.
ref: And remember that which is recited in your houses of the signs of God and the Wisdom; God is All-subtle, All-aware.
draft: And remember what is recited in your dwellings of Allah's verses and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Gentle and Acquainted [with all things].
hil: Remember what is recited in your dwellings of Allah's verses and wisdom. Surely, Allah is always Merciful and Omniscient.
compare: And remember what is recited in your dwellings of Allah's verses and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Gentle and Acquainted [with all things].

src: Sag: "Mein HERR kennt das Gesagte im Himmel und auf Erden.
ref: He said: "My Lord knows whatever is spoken in the heavens and the earth.
draft: Say: "My LORD knows what is said in heaven and on earth."
hil: Say, 'My Lord knows what is said in heaven and on earth.'
compare: Say: "My LORD knows what is said in heaven and on earth."

src: Ist es denn Unsere Strafe, die sie beschleunigen wollen?
ref: Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment?
draft: Is it then our punishment that they want to accelerate?
hil: Is it then Our punishment that they want to hasten?
compare: Is it then our punishment that they want to accelerate?

src: Auch wenn sie den Weg der Rechtschaffenheit erkennen, folgen sie ihm nicht als (ihren) Weg, doch wenn sie den Weg des Fehlgehens erkennen, folgen sie ihm als (ihren) Weg, dies weil sie Unsere Ayat verleugnen und ihnen gegenüber achtlos zu sein pflegten.
ref: This is so for they have called Our messages lies, and have been heedless of them."
draft: Even if they recognize the path of righteousness, they do not follow it as their own path, but if they recognize the path of wrongdoing, they follow it as their own path, because they deny Our signs and used to be heedless towards them.
hil: Even if they recognize the path of righteousness, they do not follow it as their own path, but if they recognize the path of misguidance, they follow it as their own path, because they deny Our signs and used to be heedless towards them.
compare: Even if they recognize the path of righteousness, they do not follow it as their own path, but if they recognize the path of misguidance, they follow it as their own path, because they deny Our signs and used to be heedless towards them.

src: Und er hält nicht aus Geiz das (ihm offenbarte) Verborgene zurück.
ref: He is not chary of making public what is unknown.
draft: And he does not withhold what is revealed to him out of greed.
hil: And he does not withhold what is revealed to him out of greed.
compare: And he does not withhold what is revealed to him out of greed.

src: Wenn diese dann dicke Regenwolken trugen, lassen WIR ihn (den Regen) zu einer toten Landschaft treiben, dann lassen WIR darauf das Wasser herab. Und damit lassen WIR von den verschiedenen Früchten sprießen.
ref: Then, when they have gathered up heavy clouds, We drive them to a dead land, where We make water come down, and with it We bring out all kinds of fruits.
draft: When they (the clouds) then carried thick rain clouds, WE let it (the rain) drift towards a dead landscape, then WE let the water come down on it. And with that, WE make various fruits sprout.
hil: We let it (the rain) drift towards a dead landscape when they carried thick rain clouds, then we let the water come down on it, and with that, we make various fruits sprout.
compare: We let it (the rain) drift towards a dead landscape when they carried thick rain clouds, then we let the water come down on it, and with that, we make various fruits sprout.

src: Und an ALLAH werden die Angelegenheiten gewandt.
ref: To God all matters revert.
draft: And the affairs are turned to Allah.
hil: And all matters are referred to Allah.
compare: And the affairs are turned to Allah.

src: Und sie folgten dem, was die Satane unter der Herrschaft Salomos vortrugen.
ref: They followed what the Shayatin (devils) gave out (falsely of the magic) in the lifetime of Sulaiman (Solomon).
draft: And they followed what the Satans presented under the reign of Solomon.
hil: And they followed what the Satans presented during the reign of Solomon
compare: And they followed what the Satans presented during the reign of Solomon

src: Und Wir werden ihnen ihren Anteil fürwahr unverringert zukommen lassen.
ref: We shall verily give them their meed without diminution.
draft: And we will certainly give them their share undiminished.
hil: And We will certainly give them their share undiminished.
compare: And we will certainly give them their share undiminished.

src: Seid nicht wie diejenigen, die Musa verleumdeten, dann erklärte ihn ALLAH von dem, was sie ihm unterstellten, für unschuldig. Und er war bei ALLAH hochgeschätzt.
ref: Do not be like the people who troubled Moosa – so Allah freed him from the allegations they had uttered; and Moosa is honourable in the sight of Allah.
draft: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly valued by Allah.
hil: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly valued by Allah.
compare: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly valued by Allah.

src: Sodann lasse sie mit ihren schweifenden Gesprächen ihr Spiel treiben.
ref: Say: "God," and leave them to the sport of engaging in vain discourse.
draft: Then let them play their game with their rambling conversations.
hil: Then let them play their game with their rambling conversations.
compare: Then let them play their game with their rambling conversations.

src: Die Gänge der Himmel, daß ich zum Gott des Mose emporsteige.
ref: to the heavens and be able to climb up to the Lord of Moses.
draft: "The aisles of heaven, that I ascend to the God of Moses."
hil: The pathways of heaven so that I ascend to the God of Moses.
compare: "The aisles of heaven, that I ascend to the God of Moses."

src: Und ich war ihr Zeuge, solange ich unter ihnen weilte, doch nachdem Du mich abberufen hattest, bist Du ihr Wächter gewesen; und Du bist der Zeuge aller Dinge.
ref: And so long as I dwelt with them I was witness over their actions. And after my life had been done, You were their keeper; and You are a witness over all things.
draft: And I was their witness as long as I dwelt among them, but after You took me away, You became their guardian; and You are the witness of all things.
hil: And I was their witness as long as I dwelt among them, but after You took me away, You were their guardian; and You are the witness of all things.
compare: And I was their witness as long as I dwelt among them, but after You took me away, You became their guardian; and You are the witness of all things.

src: Sie sagte: "HERR! Wie kann ich einen Sohn haben, wo kein Mann mich jemals intim berührt hat."
ref: She said: "How can I have a son, O Lord, when no man has touched me?"
draft: She said, "LORD! How can I have a son when no man has ever touched me intimately."
hil: She said, "Lord, how can I have a son when no man has ever touched me intimately."
compare: She said, "LORD! How can I have a son when no man has ever touched me intimately."

src: Ich folge doch nur dem, was mir an Wahy zuteil wird."
ref: I only follow what is revealed to me.'
draft: "I only follow what is revealed to me."
hil: Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me."
compare: "I only follow what is revealed to me."

src: Ihm gebührt die wahre Anrufung. Diejenigen, die sie an seiner Stelle anrufen, erhören sie in keinem Anliegen.
ref: For Him (Alone) is the Word of Truth (i.e. none has the right to be worshipped but He).
draft: He deserves the true invocation. Those who call upon it in his place will not be heard in any matter.
hil: He deserves the true invocation. Those who call upon it in his place will not be heard in any matter.
compare: He deserves the true invocation. Those who call upon it in his place will not be heard in any matter.

src: Die Bitte Abrahams um Vergebung für seinen Vater erfolgte nur aufgrund eines Versprechens, das er ihm gegeben hatte. Als es ihm aber deutlich wurde, daß er ein Feind Gottes war, sagte er sich von ihm los. Abraham war voller Trauer und langmütig.
ref: And the seeking of forgiveness for his father (paternal uncle) by Ibrahim was only because of a promise he had made to him; then when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, Ibrahim broke off ties with him; indeed Ibrahim is surely very soft-hearted, most forbearing.
draft: The request of Abraham for forgiveness for his father was only made because of a promise he had given him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he disowned him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patient.
hil: The request of Abraham for forgiveness for his father was only made due to a promise he had given him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he disowned him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patient.
compare: The request of Abraham for forgiveness for his father was only made because of a promise he had given him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he disowned him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patient.

src: Da erwies Allah uns eine Wohltat und bewahrte uns vor der Strafe des Glutwindes.
ref: But God has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of scorching wind.
draft: Allah granted us a favor and saved us from the punishment of the scorching wind.
hil: Allah showed us a kindness and saved us from the punishment of the scorching wind.
compare: Allah granted us a favor and saved us from the punishment of the scorching wind.

src: Es entgeht Ihm nicht das Gewicht eines Stäubchens, weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde. Und es gibt nichts, was kleiner ist als dies oder größer, das nicht in einem deutlichen Buch (verzeichnet) wäre,
ref: Not even an atom's weight in the heavens and the earth, or something smaller or greater than it, is hidden from Him, and which is not recorded in the all-too-manifest Book,
draft: He is not unaware of the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing that is smaller than this or larger that would not be recorded in a clear book.
hil: He is not unaware of the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing that is smaller or greater than this, that would not be recorded in a clear book.
compare: He is not unaware of the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing that is smaller or greater than this, that would not be recorded in a clear book.

src: Und sie sagen: "Wenn doch ein Zeichen von seinem Herrn auf ihn herabgesandt würde!" Sag: Das Verborgene ist nur Allahs.
ref: And they say, “Why is not a sign sent down upon him from his Lord?”
draft: "They say, 'If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!' Say: The unseen is only for Allah."
hil: And they say, 'If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!' Say: The unseen is only for Allah.
compare: "They say, 'If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!' Say: The unseen is only for Allah."

src: Dem vergelten WIR mit Dschahannam.
ref: I am a god beside Him, that one We should repay with hell.
draft: We repay them with the Dschahannam.
hil: "We repay them with the Dschahannam"
compare: "We repay them with the Dschahannam"

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Weshalb sagt ihr, was ihr nicht macht?!
ref: O you who believe, why do you profess what you do not practise?
draft: You who have internalized the imam! Why do you say what you do not do ?!
hil: O you who believe! Why do you say what you do not do ?!
compare: O you who believe! Why do you say what you do not do ?!

src: Dann entsprangen daraus zwölf Quellen, bereits kennt jede Gruppe ihre Trinkstelle. Esst und trinkt von ALLAHs Rizq und übertreibt nicht auf Erden als Verderben-Anrichtende!
ref: Then there gushed forth thereout twelve springs; every people already knew their drinking-place; eat and drink of the provision of Allah, and commit not evil on the earth as corrupters.
draft: Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, and each group knew its own drinking place. Eat and drink from Allah's provision and do not act corruptly on the earth, spreading mischief.
hil: Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, and each group knew its own drinking place. Eat and drink from God's gifts, and spread no discord in the land.
compare: Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, and each group knew its own drinking place. Eat and drink from Allah's provision and do not act corruptly on the earth, spreading mischief.

src: Und sollte dich eine Versuchung des Satans (vom Wahren) ablenken, so suche Zuflucht bei ALLAH!
ref: And if an evil whisper comes to you from Shaitan (Satan) then seek refuge with Allah.
draft: And if a temptation from Satan (from the Truth) distracts you, then seek refuge in Allah!
hil: If a temptation from Satan (from the Truth) distracts you, seek refuge in Allah.
compare: If a temptation from Satan (from the Truth) distracts you, seek refuge in Allah.

src: Und sporne die Gläubigen an, vielleicht wird Gott die Schlagkraft derer, die ungläubig sind, zurückhalten. Und Gott besitzt eine noch stärkere Schlagkraft und verhängt eine noch härtere Strafe.
ref: And urge on the believers; haply God will restrain the unbelievers' might; God is stronger in might, more terrible in punishing.
draft: And urge on the believers, perhaps God will restrain the force of those who disbelieve. And God has a still greater force and inflicts an even harsher punishment.
hil: And incite the believers, perhaps God will restrain the force of those who disbelieve. And God has an even greater force and inflicts an even harsher punishment.
compare: And incite the believers, perhaps God will restrain the force of those who disbelieve. And God has an even greater force and inflicts an even harsher punishment.

src: Und gewiß, bereits ließen WIR Musa Wahy zuteil werden: "Brich nachts auf mit Meinen Dienern, dann schlage ihnen einen getrockneten Weg ins Meer! Habe keine Angst vor Verfolgung und fürchte dich nicht!"
ref: And We divinely inspired Moosa that, “Journey with My bondmen in a part of the night and strike a dry path in the sea for them, you shall have no fear of Firaun getting to you, nor any danger.”
draft: And certainly, WE already made Musa receive the revelation: "Set out with My servants at night, then strike for them a dry path through the sea! Do not be afraid of pursuit and do not fear!"
hil: And surely, we had granted to Musa the revelation (saying), 'Set out at night with my servants, then strike for them a dry path through the sea! Fear not of pursuit and do not be afraid!'
compare: And certainly, WE already made Musa receive the revelation: "Set out with My servants at night, then strike for them a dry path through the sea! Do not be afraid of pursuit and do not fear!"

src: Am Tag, da der Geist und die Engel in einer Reihe stehen. Sie werden nicht sprechen, ausgenommen der, dem der Erbarmer es erlaubt und der das Richtige sagt.
ref: Upon the day when the Spirit and the angels stand in ranks they shall speak not, save him to whom the All-merciful has given leave, and who speaks aright.
draft: On the day when the Spirit and the angels stand in rows, they will not speak except for the one whom the Merciful permits and who speaks rightly.
hil: On the day when the Spirit and the angels stand in rows, they shall not speak except for the one whom the Merciful permits and who speaks rightly.
compare: On the day when the Spirit and the angels stand in rows, they will not speak except for the one whom the Merciful permits and who speaks rightly.

src: Wenn ihr ALLAH (Seiner Sache) eine Hasan-Anleihe gebt, wird ER euch vervielfachen und euch vergeben. Und ALLAH ist reichlich belohnend, allnachsichtig.
ref: If you lend an excellent loan to Allah, He will double it for you and forgive you; and Allah is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing.
draft: If you give ALLAH (His Cause) a Hasan loan, He will multiply you and forgive you. And ALLAH is abundantly rewarding, most merciful.
hil: If you give Allah (His Cause) a Hasan loan, He will multiply you and forgive you. And Allah is abundantly rewarding, most merciful.
compare: If you give ALLAH (His Cause) a Hasan loan, He will multiply you and forgive you. And ALLAH is abundantly rewarding, most merciful.

src: Alles, was in den Himmeln, und alles, was auf Erden ist, preist Allah; und Er ist der Erhabene, der Allweise.
ref: WHATEVER IS IN the heavens and the earth sings the praises of God. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
draft: "All that is in the heavens and all that is on earth glorifies Allah, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise."
hil: All that is in the heavens and on earth glorifies Allah, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.
compare: "All that is in the heavens and all that is on earth glorifies Allah, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise."

src: Also laß von ihnen und von dem ab, was sie erlügen.
ref: Leave them to their falsehoods.
draft: Also, let go of them and what they lie about.
hil: So let go of them and what they fabricate.
compare: So let go of them and what they fabricate.

src: Es gibt welche unter den Juden, die Worte aus ihren Stellungen verdrehen und sagen: "Wir hören und wir gehorchen nicht", und "Höre, ohne gehört zu werden", und "Sei uns nachsichtig", indem sie mit ihren Zungen lügen und den Glauben lästern. Und hätten sie gesagt: "Wir hören und wir gehorchen", und "Höre", und "Schaue gnädig auf uns", wäre es besser für sie gewesen und aufrechter. Aber Allah hat sie zur Strafe für ihren Unglauben verflucht; darum glauben sie nur wenig.
ref: Some of the Jews interchange the words from their places and say, “We hear and disobey” – and they say “Hear- may you not be able to hear” – and they say “Raena (Be considerate towards us)” distorting it with their tongues and in order to slander religion; had they said, “We hear and we obey” and “Kindly listen to us, O dear Prophet,” and “Look mercifully upon us, O dear Prophet”, it would have been much better for them and more just – but Allah has cursed them for their disbelief; so they do not believe except a little.
draft: There are some among the Jews who twist words from their [proper] usages and say, "We hear and disobey" and "Hear but be not heard" and "Avert your vision" and they twist their tongues to insult the religion. And if they had said [instead], "We hear and obey" and "Wait for us [to understand]" and "Speak to us respectfully," it would have been better for them and more suitable. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few [i.e., they are not rightly guided even in a few aspects].
hil: There are some among the Jews who distort words from their proper context and say, 'We hear and we do not obey,' and 'Listen without being heard,' and 'Be lenient with us,' lying with their tongues and blaspheming faith. If they had said, 'We hear and we obey,' 'Wait for us [to understand],' and 'Speak to us respectfully,' it would have been better for them and more upright. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief; therefore, they only believe a little.
compare: There are some among the Jews who distort words from their proper context and say, 'We hear and we do not obey,' and 'Listen without being heard,' and 'Be lenient with us,' lying with their tongues and blaspheming faith. If they had said, 'We hear and we obey,' 'Wait for us [to understand],' and 'Speak to us respectfully,' it would have been better for them and more upright. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief; therefore, they only believe a little.

src: Vielleicht möchtest du einen Teil von dem, was dir (als Offenbarung) eingegeben wird, auslassen und deine Brust ist dadurch beklommen, und dies, weil sie sagen: "Wäre doch ein Schatz auf ihn herabgesandt worden oder ein Engel mit ihm gekommen!" Du aber bist nur ein Warner. Und Allah ist Sachwalter über alles.
ref: Perhaps you are leaving part of what has been sent down to you, and your chest is straitened by it, because they say: 'Why has no treasure been sent down to him, or an angel come with him' You are only a warner, and Allah is a Guardian over everything.
draft: Maybe you would like to omit a part of what is revealed to you and your chest is constricted because of it, and this is because they say, "Why has not a treasure been sent down to him or an angel come with him?" You are only a warner. And Allah is Disposer of all things.
hil: He may want to omit some of what is being revealed to him, which might cause distress and anxiety to him, because they say: "Why was no treasure sent down to him or an angel accompanied him?" (This is not the case) – as you are only a warner, and Allah is Guardian over all things.
compare: Maybe you would like to omit a part of what is revealed to you and your chest is constricted because of it, and this is because they say, "Why has not a treasure been sent down to him or an angel come with him?" You are only a warner. And Allah is Disposer of all things.

src: Abraham war weder Jude noch Christ, sondern er war Anhänger des reinen Glaubens, ein Gottergebener, und er gehörte nicht zu den Polytheisten.
ref: Neither was Abraham a Jew nor a Christian, but upright and obedient, and not an idolater.
draft: Abraham was neither Jewish nor Christian, but he was a follower of the pure faith, a God-fearing person, and he did not belong to the polytheists.
hil: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but instead a devotee of the pure faith, and he did not belong to the polytheists.
compare: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but instead a devotee of the pure faith, and he did not belong to the polytheists.

src: Am Tag, da sie sehen, was ihnen angedroht wird, wird ihnen sein, als hätten sie nur eine Stunde vom Tag verweilt.
ref: The Day when they see what they had been warned against they will feel as though they had remained in the world no more than an hour of a day.
draft: On the day they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have only lingered for one hour of the day.
hil: On the day they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have only lingered for one hour of the day.
compare: On the day they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have only lingered for one hour of the day.

src: Oder bis du den Himmel auf uns in Stücken herabfallen läßt, wie du behauptet hast, oder Gott und die Engel vor unsere Augen bringst,
ref: Or, let chunks of sky fall over us, as you assert (you will); or, bring God and the angels as a surety;
draft: Or until you cause the sky to fall upon us in fragments, as you have claimed, or bring God and the angels before our eyes.
hil: Or until you cause the sky to fall upon us in fragments, as you have claimed, or bring God and the angels before our eyes.
compare: Or until you cause the sky to fall upon us in fragments, as you have claimed, or bring God and the angels before our eyes.

src: Und wisst, daß unter euch ALLAHs Gesandter ist. Würde er auf euch in vielen der Angelegenheiten hören, würdet ihr sicherlich unter Unannehmlichkeiten leiden.
ref: Know that the Apostle of God is among you: If he agreed with you in most matters you would surely come to grief.
draft: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to listen to you in much of the matter, you would surely suffer harm.
hil: O you who believe, be aware that among you there is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to listen to you in many matters, you would surely suffer harm.
compare: O you who believe, be aware that among you there is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to listen to you in many matters, you would surely suffer harm.

src: Und ALLAH ist immer über alles allwissend.
ref: God has knowledge of everything.
draft: And ALLAH is always all-knowing about everything.
hil: And Allah is all-knowing about everything.
compare: And ALLAH is always all-knowing about everything.

src: Diejenigen, die von den Engeln abberufen werden - da sie gegen sich selber gefrevelt haben und nun unterwürfig geworden sind (sagen): "Wir pflegten ja, nichts Böses zu tun." Nein, wahrlich, Allah weiß wohl, was ihr zu tun pflegtet.
ref: whom the angels take while they were still harming themselves' Then they will offer submission, saying: 'We have done no evil' No, surely Allah knows what you have done.
draft: Those who are called back by the angels, (saying,) "We used to do no evil," - whereas they had been committing evil deeds. "Indeed, Allah is aware of what you used to do.
hil: Those who are called back by the angels due to their wrongdoing and submission (say), 'We used to do no evil.' No, indeed, Allah is fully aware of what they used to do.
compare: Those who are called back by the angels due to their wrongdoing and submission (say), 'We used to do no evil.' No, indeed, Allah is fully aware of what they used to do.

src: Hätten aber die Bewohner (jener) Städte geglaubt und wären sie gottesfürchtig gewesen, so hätten Wir ihnen ganz gewiß die Segnungen von Himmel und Erde eröffnet. Doch sie leugneten; also erfaßten Wir sie um dessentwillen, was sie begangen hatten.
ref: But if the people of these regions had believed and feared God, We would surely have showered on them blessings of the heavens and the earth; but they only denied, and We punished them for their deeds.
draft: But if the inhabitants of those cities had believed and been righteous, We would have opened for them blessings from heaven and earth. But they denied [the truth], so We seized them for what they used to earn [of evil].
hil: If the inhabitants of those cities had believed and been mindful of God, We would have certainly opened up for them the blessings of the heavens and the earth. But they denied [the truth], so We seized them for what they used to do.
compare: But if the inhabitants of those cities had believed and been righteous, We would have opened for them blessings from heaven and earth. But they denied [the truth], so We seized them for what they used to earn [of evil].

src: (Er ist der) Herr der Himmel und der Erde und all dessen, was zwischen beiden liegt.
ref: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them.
draft: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them.
hil: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them.
compare: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them.

src: So ziehen sie ihn der Lüge.
ref: So they belied him, and We destroyed them.
draft: So they pull him into the lie.
hil: So they accuse him of lying.
compare: So they accuse him of lying.

src: Diese sind es, die eine schlimme Abrechnung haben werden, und ihre Herberge ist Gahannam.
ref: They will be subjected to a severe reckoning and Hell shall be their refuge.
draft: These are the ones who will have a bad reckoning, and their dwelling place is Gehenna.
hil: These are the ones who will have a dire reckoning and their dwelling place will be in Gehenna.
compare: These are the ones who will have a bad reckoning, and their dwelling place is Gehenna.

src: Und reinige mein Haus für diejenigen, die den Umlauf vollziehen, und für die, die aufrecht stehen, sich verneigen und niederwerfen.
ref: And do thou purify My House for those that shall go about it and those that stand, for those that bow and prostrate themselves;
draft: And clean my house for those who complete the cycle and for those who stand upright, bow down and prostrate themselves.
hil: And purify my house for those who perform Tawaf and for those who stand upright, bow down and prostrate themselves.
compare: And purify my house for those who perform Tawaf and for those who stand upright, bow down and prostrate themselves.

src: (Was nun) die älteren Frauen (betrifft), die nicht mehr auf Heirat hoffen können, so trifft sie kein Vorwurf, wenn sie ihre Tücher ablegen, ohne ihre Zierde zur Schau zu stellen. Aber wenn sie sich dessen enthalten, ist das besser für sie. Und Allah ist Allhörend, Allwissend.
ref: And the old women residing in houses who do not have the desire of marriage – it is no sin upon them if they discard their upper coverings provided they do not display their adornment; and avoiding even this is better for them; and Allah is All Hearing, All Knowing.
draft: As for the elderly women who can no longer hope for marriage, there is no blame on them if they take off their outer clothing without displaying their adornment. But to refrain from doing so is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
hil: As for the elderly women who can no longer hope for marriage, there is no blame on them if they take off their outer clothing without displaying their adornment. But it is better for them to refrain from doing so. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
compare: As for the elderly women who can no longer hope for marriage, there is no blame on them if they take off their outer clothing without displaying their adornment. But it is better for them to refrain from doing so. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

src: Und wenn sie zu euch kommen, sagen sie: "Wir haben den Iman bekundet.", während sie selbst doch mit dem Kufr eingetreten und mit diesem fortgegangen sind.
ref: And when they come to you they say: we believe; whereas surely with infidelity they entered and surely with it they went forth.
draft: And when they come to you, they say, "We have declared faith (Iman)", while they themselves have entered with disbelief (Kufr) and left with it.
hil: And when they come to you, they say "We have declared faith (Iman)", while they themselves have entered with disbelief (Kufr) and left with it.
compare: And when they come to you, they say, "We have declared faith (Iman)", while they themselves have entered with disbelief (Kufr) and left with it.

src: Und Wir trafen mit ihnen ein festes Abkommen.
ref: We made a solemn covenant with them.
draft: And we made a firm agreement with them.
hil: And We made a firm covenant with them.
compare: And we made a firm agreement with them.

src: Und WIR setzten für ihr Zugrunde-Richten einen Termin fest.
ref: And We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.
draft: And WE set a date for their judgment.
hil: And WE set a date for their judgment.
compare: And WE set a date for their judgment.

src: Mein HERR! Schenke mir Weisheit und lasse mich den gottgefällig Guttuenden folgen!
ref: O Lord, give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous,
draft: My LORD! Grant me wisdom and let me follow the God-pleasing good deeds!
hil: My Lord, grant me wisdom and enable me to follow the acts of piety that please you!
compare: My LORD! Grant me wisdom and let me follow the God-pleasing good deeds!

src: Für diejenigen, die Unrecht tun, ist ein Los bestimmt wie das Los ihrer Gefährten.
ref: Those who do wrong will indeed come to the same end as their fellows (of old).
draft: "For those who do wrong, a destiny is determined like the destiny of their companions."
hil: "For those who do wrong, a destiny is determined like the destiny of their companions."
compare: "For those who do wrong, a destiny is determined like the destiny of their companions."

src: Erwarten Sie denn etwas anderes, als daß die Engel zu ihnen kommen, oder daß der Befehl deines Herrn eintrifft?
ref: So what are they waiting for, except that the angels come upon them or that your Lord’s punishment comes?
draft: Do you expect anything other than that the angels come to them or that the command of your Lord arrives?
hil: Do you expect anything else than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives?
compare: Do you expect anything other than that the angels come to them or that the command of your Lord arrives?

src: Und wer macht die Schöpfung am Anfang und wiederholt sie? Und wer versorgt euch vom Himmel und von der Erde?
ref: Or He Who initiates the creation, then will create it again, and He Who provides you sustenance from the skies and the earth?
draft: And who makes the creation at the beginning and repeats it? And who provides for you from the sky and from the earth?
hil: And who is it that creates the creation in the beginning and reverts it? And who gives you sustenance from the skies and the earth?
compare: And who is it that creates the creation in the beginning and reverts it? And who gives you sustenance from the skies and the earth?

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Wer von euch sich von seinem Din abwendet, so wird ALLAH Menschen bringen, die ER liebt und welche Ihn lieben.
ref: Believers, if any among you renounce the faith, God will replace them by others who love Him and are loved by Him, who will be kind and considerate towards believers and firm and unyielding towards those who deny the truth.
draft: You, who have internalized the imam! Whoever turns away from his Din among you, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.
hil: O believers who have internalized faith, whoever turns away from their Din, Allah will bring people He loves and who love Him.
compare: O believers who have internalized faith, whoever turns away from their Din, Allah will bring people He loves and who love Him.

src: Sie sagten: "Bist du zu uns gekommen, um uns von dem abzubringen, worin wir unsere Väter (vor)gefunden haben, und damit euch beiden die Oberhoheit im Land werde?
ref: "Have you come," said they, "to turn us back from what we found our ancestors doing, so that the two of you may attain supremacy in the land?
draft: They said, "Have you come to us to divert us from what our fathers have found, and so that both of you may have supremacy in the land?"
hil: They said, "Have you come to us to divert us from what our fathers have found, and so that both of you may have supremacy in the land?"
compare: They said, "Have you come to us to divert us from what our fathers have found, and so that both of you may have supremacy in the land?"

src: Und (Er läßt dies zu,) damit diejenigen, denen das Wissen gegeben wurde, erkennen, daß es die Wahrheit von deinem Herrn ist, auf daß sie daran glauben und ihre Herzen sich Ihm friedvoll unterwerfen mögen. Und siehe, Allah leitet jene, die gläubig sind, auf den geraden Weg.
ref: And so that the people given the knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, in order that they may accept faith in it, therefore their hearts may humble before Him; and indeed Allah will guide the believers on the Straight Path.
draft: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts may submit peacefully to Him. And indeed, Allah guides the believers to a straight path.
hil: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may recognize that it is the truth from their Lord and believe in it, and their hearts may peacefully submit to Him. And verily, Allah guides those who believe to the straight path.
compare: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts may submit peacefully to Him. And indeed, Allah guides the believers to a straight path.

src: Hätten sie gesagt: «Wir hören, und wir gehorchen», und: «Höre», und: «Schau auf uns» (unzurnaa), wäre es besser und richtiger für sie. Aber Gott hat sie wegen ihres Unglaubens verflucht, so glauben sie nur wenig.
ref: If they had said, 'We have heard and obey' and 'Hear' and 'Regard us,' it would have been better for them, and more upright; but God has cursed them for their unbelief so they believe not except a few.
draft: They said: "We listen, and we obey," and: "Listen," and: "Look at us" (unzurnaa), it would be better and more right for them. But God has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe only little.
hil: If they had said, "We listen and we obey," and, "Listen," and, "Look at us" (unzurnaa), it would have been better and more right for them. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe only a little.
compare: If they had said, "We listen and we obey," and, "Listen," and, "Look at us" (unzurnaa), it would have been better and more right for them. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe only a little.

src: Dann befände ich mich wahrlich in einem offenkundigen Irrtum.
ref: In that case I would surely be in clear error.
draft: Then I would truly be in an obvious error.
hil: If that were the case, I would indeed be in an obvious error.
compare: If that were the case, I would indeed be in an obvious error.

src: Wenn aber jemand (dazu) gezwungen ist, ohne (es) zu begehren und ohne das Maß zu überschreiten, so trifft ihn keine Schuld; wahrlich, Allah ist Allverzeihend, Barmherzig.
ref: If one is obliged by necessity to eat it without intending to transgress, or reverting to it, he is not guilty of sin; for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: If someone is forced (to do it) without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not guilty; truly, Allah is All-forgiving, Merciful.
hil: No guilt shall be incurred by a person who is compelled to do something they do not desire and who does not exceed the limits. Indeed, Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
compare: No guilt shall be incurred by a person who is compelled to do something they do not desire and who does not exceed the limits. Indeed, Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

src: Sag: "Ihr Schriftbesitzer! Ihr habt nichts (vom Din), bis ihr At-taurat und Alindschil und das einhaltet, was euch von eurem HERRN hinabgesandt wurde.
ref: Say to them: "O people of the Book, you have no ground (for argument) until you follow the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to you by your Lord."
draft: Say: "O scripture owners, you have nothing until you uphold the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord."
hil: Say, O people of the Book, you have nothing (of guidance) until you observe the Torah and the Gospel and what has been sent down to you from your Lord.
compare: Say, O people of the Book, you have nothing (of guidance) until you observe the Torah and the Gospel and what has been sent down to you from your Lord.

src: Und (erinnere daran), als Musa zu seinen Leuten sagte: "Gewiß, ALLAH gebietet euch, eine Kuh zu schlachten."
ref: And when Moses said to his people, 'God commands you to sacrifice a cow.'
draft: And (remember), when Moses said to his people: "Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow."
hil: And (remember) when Moses said to his people: "Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow."
compare: And (remember), when Moses said to his people: "Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow."

src: Könntest du nur sehen wenn sie mit Furcht geschlagen sein werden!
ref: And couldst thou see the time when they shall be terrified!
draft: Could you only see when they will be struck with fear!
hil: If only you could see when they will be struck with fear!
compare: If only you could see when they will be struck with fear!

src: ER ist Der Allhörende, Der Allwissende.
ref: He is the Hearer, the Knower.
draft: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
hil: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
compare: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

src: Und ALLAHs Erde ist weit.
ref: And God’s earth is vast.
draft: And ALLAH's earth is vast.
hil: And Allah's earth is vast.
compare: And ALLAH's earth is vast.

src: Gewiß, die Unrecht-Begehenden werden nie erfolgreich werden."
ref: But surely the wicked will not prosper."
draft: "Surely, those who commit injustice will never be successful."
hil: Indeed, those who commit injustice will never succeed.
compare: "Surely, those who commit injustice will never be successful."

src: Verleihe uns Geduld und lasse uns als Muslime sterben!"
ref: Pour (bestow abundantly) patience on us, and bestow us death as Muslims.”
draft: "Lend us patience and let us die as Muslims!"
hil: Grant us patience and let us die as Muslims!
compare: Grant us patience and let us die as Muslims!

src: Könnt ihr uns vor Gottes Pein etwas nützen?»
ref: They will say: "Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you.
draft: "Can you help us in the face of God's torment?"
hil: Can you benefit us from God's torment?
compare: "Can you help us in the face of God's torment?"

src: Diese erhalten einen Anteil von dem, was sie sich erworben haben. Gott ist schnell im Abrechnen.
ref: They are those who will surely have their share of whatsoever they have earned; for God is swift at the reckoning.
draft: They receive a share of what they have acquired. God is quick in settling accounts.
hil: They will receive a portion of what they have earned. God is swift in counting.
compare: They receive a share of what they have acquired. God is quick in settling accounts.

src: (Das ist) Allahs Versprechen in Wahrheit.
ref: The Promise of Allah is true.
draft: This is Allah's promise in truth.
hil: This is Allah's promise in truth.
compare: This is Allah's promise in truth.

src: Sie können doch sich selbst nicht helfen, und sie werden keinen Beistand gegen Uns erhalten.
ref: But they are not able to help themselves, nor can they find protection against Us.
draft: You can't help yourself, and you won't get any support from us.
hil: They cannot help themselves, and they will not receive any assistance from us.
compare: They cannot help themselves, and they will not receive any assistance from us.

src: Und lauert nicht auf jedem Weg auf, um (Menschen) einzuschüchtern und von ALLAHs Weg diejenigen abzuhalten, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben - erstrebt nach dem Krümmen (dieses Weges). Und entsinnt euch, als ihr noch wenige wart, dann ließ ER euch mehr werden. Und nehmt wahr, wie das Anschließende von den Verderben-Anrichtenden war.
ref: “And do not be seated on every road in order to scare the travellers, and to prevent from Allah’s path the people who believe in Him, wishing to distort it; and remember when you were few and He increased your numbers; and see what sort of fate befell the mischievous!”
draft: And do not lie in wait on every path, trying to scare and turn away those who have embraced faith from the path of Allah. And remember when you were few and He increased your number. And see how was the end of the corrupters.
hil: Do not lie in wait on every path trying to intimidate and turn away those who have internalized the faith from the path of Allah. Strive after the path leading to Him and remember when you were few and then He increased your numbers. Also, consider the fate of the corrupters.
compare: Do not lie in wait on every path trying to intimidate and turn away those who have internalized the faith from the path of Allah. Strive after the path leading to Him and remember when you were few and then He increased your numbers. Also, consider the fate of the corrupters.

src: ER sagte: "WIR ließen doch deine Leute nach dir der Fitna aussetzen.
ref: Said He, 'We have tempted thy people since thou didst leave them.
draft: He said: "We exposed your people to Fitna after you."
hil: He said, "We exposed your people to Fitna after you."
compare: He said, "We exposed your people to Fitna after you."

src: Und verkünde denen, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, daß für sie Gärten bestimmt sind, unter denen Bäche fließen.
ref: And bear thou the glad tidings unto those who believe and do righteous works that verily for them shall be Gardens whereunder rivers flow.
draft: And announce to those who believe and do good works that gardens are destined for them, beneath which rivers flow.
hil: And give glad tidings to those who believe and do good deeds that for them are Gardens beneath which rivers flow.
compare: And announce to those who believe and do good works that gardens are destined for them, beneath which rivers flow.

src: Und gewiß, viele führen mit ihren Gelüsten durch Mangel an Wissen zum Irrweg.
ref: Surely many (men) mislead others into following their vain desires through lack of knowledge.
draft: And certainly, many with their desires lead astray due to a lack of knowledge.
hil: And indeed, many with their desires lead astray due to a lack of knowledge.
compare: And certainly, many with their desires lead astray due to a lack of knowledge.

src: So prüfen Wir sie dafür, daß sie zu freveln pflegten.
ref: We tried them in this way, for they were disobedient.
draft: So we test them for having accustomed to sin.
hil: Thus do We test them for their penchant for transgression.
compare: Thus do We test them for their penchant for transgression.

src: Gewiß, WIR entsandten Nuh zu seinen Leuten: "Warne deine Leute, bevor zu ihnen eine qualvolle Peinigung kommt."
ref: SENT NOAH to his people to warn them before the painful punishment came upon them.
draft: Certainly, WE sent Nuh to his people: "Warn your people before a painful torment comes to them."
hil: Certainly, WE sent Nuh to his people: "Warn your people before a painful torment comes to them."
compare: Certainly, WE sent Nuh to his people: "Warn your people before a painful torment comes to them."

src: Vielmehr sind sie Leute, die (Allah andere) gleichsetzen.
ref: Nay, but they are a people who ascribe equals (to Him)!
draft: Rather, they are people who equate (others with Allah).
hil: They are rather people who equate others with Allah.
compare: They are rather people who equate others with Allah.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwürdig, allweise.
ref: He is indeed all-mighty and all-wise.
draft: Surely, Allah is worthy of all praise, all-wise.
hil: Surely, Allah is worthy of all praise, all-wise.
compare: Surely, Allah is worthy of all praise, all-wise.

src: Und WIR werden euch bestimmt das Land nach ihnen bewohnen lassen. Dies ist für denjenigen, der Ehrfurcht vor der Vorstellung Mir gegenüber hat, und der Meine Androhung fürchtet."
ref: “And indeed We will establish you in the land after them; this is for him who fears to stand before Me and fears the commands of punishment declared by Me.”
draft: And WE shall certainly let you inherit the land after them. This is for him who feared standing in My presence and feared My threat.
hil: And indeed We shall allow you to inherit the land after them. That is, for one who fears standing before Me and fears My warning.
compare: And WE shall certainly let you inherit the land after them. This is for him who feared standing in My presence and feared My threat.

src: Hast du etwa nicht diejenigen wahrgenommen, denen gesagt wurde: "Haltet euch zurück, verrichtet ordnungsgemäß das rituelle Gebet und entrichtet die Zakat"?!
ref: Have you not seen the people who were told: "Hold back your hands (from attacking), observe your devotional obligations and pay the zakat?"
draft: Did you not perceive those to whom it was said, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakah"?
hil: Did you not notice those to whom it was said: "Restrain yourselves, perform the prayer, and pay the zakat in accordance with the law"?
compare: Did you not perceive those to whom it was said, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakah"?

src: "Und gewiß, als ALLAHs Diener aufstand, an Ihn Bittgebete zu richten, beinahe wären sie ihn Niederdrückende."
ref: When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).
draft: "And surely, when Allah's servant stood up to pray to Him, they almost overwhelmed him."
hil: And indeed, when Allah's servant stood up to address Him with supplications, they almost overwhelmed him.
compare: And indeed, when Allah's servant stood up to address Him with supplications, they almost overwhelmed him.

src: Und sie sind vor (jedem) Schrecken an jenem Tag in Sicherheit'.
ref: He will be secure from the terror of the Day of Judgment.
draft: "And they are safe from (every) terror on that day."
hil: On that day, they will be safe from all terror.
compare: "And they are safe from (every) terror on that day."

src: Gewiß ALLAH verfügt bei Sich über das Wissen der Stunde, ER läßt den helfenden (Regen) nieder und ER weiß, was in den Mutterschößen ist. Und kein Lebewesen weiß, was es morgen erwirbt, und kein Lebewesen weiß, in welchem Lande es stirbt. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwissend, allkundig.
ref: Surely Allah is He with Whom is the knowledge of the hour, and He sends down the rain and He knows what is in the wombs; and no one knows what he shall earn on the morrow; and no one knows in what land he shall die; surely Allah is Knowing, Aware.
draft: Surely ALLAH has with HIM the knowledge of the Hour, HE sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. No soul knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Surely, ALLAH is Knowing, Aware.
hil: Surely, Allah has the knowledge of the Hour with Him. He sends down the rain as a mercy, and He knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Surely, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.
compare: Surely ALLAH has with HIM the knowledge of the Hour, HE sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. No soul knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Surely, ALLAH is Knowing, Aware.

src: Das Königreich, das wahrhaftige - an jenem Tage wird es des Allerbarmers sein; und ein Tag soll es sein, (der) schwer für die Ungläubigen (ist)
ref: The real sovereignty will belong to Ar-Rahman. How grievous will be the day for the infidels!
draft: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will belong to the Most Merciful; and it will be a day (that is) difficult for the disbelievers.
hil: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will be of the Most Merciful, and it will be a day that is difficult for the disbelievers.
compare: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will be of the Most Merciful, and it will be a day that is difficult for the disbelievers.

src: Allah wird uns zusammenbringen.
ref: Allah will bring us all together.
draft: Allah will bring us together.
hil: Allah will bring us together.
compare: Allah will bring us together.

src: Sag: "Setzt ihr ALLAH etwa (damit) in Kenntnis über etwas, was ER weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde kennt?!" Gepriesen-erhaben sei ER über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Say: "Do ye indeed inform Allah of something He knows not, in the heavens or on earth?- Glory to Him! and far is He above the partners they ascribe (to Him)!"
draft: Say, "Do you inform Allah about something that He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?" Exalted and high above what they associate with Him [in worship].
hil: Say, "Are you informing Allah about something that He does not know, neither in the heavens nor on the earth?" Glorified and exalted is He above what they associate with Him [in worship].
compare: Say, "Do you inform Allah about something that He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?" Exalted and high above what they associate with Him [in worship].

src: Du bringst das Lebendige aus dem Toten, und Du bringst das Tote aus dem Lebendigen hervor, und Du bescherst Unterhalt, wem Du willst, ohne (viel) zu rechnen.
ref: You bring forth the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living, and You give sustenance to whom You will beyond all reckoning.'
draft: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without (much) accounting.
hil: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without counting.
compare: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without (much) accounting.

src: Aber er ist nicht den steilen Paßweg hinaufgestürmt.
ref: But he could not scale the steep ascent.
draft: But he didn't rush up the steep mountain pass.
hil: But he did not rush up the steep mountain pass.
compare: But he didn't rush up the steep mountain pass.

src: Sie pflegten nicht zuzuhören und sie pflegten nicht einzublicken.
ref: They could not bear to hear (the preachers of the truth) and they used not to see (the truth because of their severe aversin, inspite of the fact that they had the sense of hearing and sight).
draft: They did not use to listen and they did not use to look in.
hil: They were accustomed to not listening and not looking in.
compare: They were accustomed to not listening and not looking in.

src: Und WIR ließen Musa Wahy zuteil werden, als seine Leute ihn um Wasser baten: "Schlage mit deinem Stock gegen den Felsen!"
ref: And We revealed unto Musa, when his people asked him for drink: Smite the rock with thy rod.
draft: "And WE allowed Musa to receive revelation when his people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with your staff!"
hil: We revealed to Musa when his people asked him for water: 'Strike the rock with your staff!'
compare: "And WE allowed Musa to receive revelation when his people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with your staff!"

src: Und wenn der Himmel (wie ein Fell) abgezogen wird,
ref: The curtain drawn back from the skies,
draft: And when the sky (like a pelt) is peeled off,
hil: And if the sky is peeled off like a pelt
compare: And when the sky (like a pelt) is peeled off,

src: Und daß ihr fastet, ist besser für euch, wenn ihr (es) nur wißt!
ref: And if you fast it is good for you, if you knew.
draft: And that you fast is better for you, if you only knew!
hil: And it's better for you to fast, if you only knew!
compare: And it's better for you to fast, if you only knew!

src: Und verheiße den Gläubigen die frohe Botschaft.
ref: So convey glad tidings to those who believe.
draft: And give the believers the good news.
hil: Give the believers the glad tidings.
compare: And give the believers the good news.

src: Diejenigen, die es lieben, daß sich das Abscheuliche unter denjenigen, die glauben, verbreitet, für sie wird es schmerzhafte Strafe geben im Diesseits und Jenseits. Allah weiß, ihr aber wißt nicht.
ref: There is painful punishment in this world and the next for those who like that immorality should spread among the believers, for God knows and you do not know.
draft: Those who love that the abominable be spread among those who believe, for them there will be painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.
hil: Those who love that the abominable is spread among those who believe, for them there will be painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.
compare: Those who love that the abominable is spread among those who believe, for them there will be painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.

src: Sie sagen: "Allah hat Sich Kinder genommen." Preis sei Ihm! Er ist der Unbedürftige. Ihm gehört, was in den Himmeln und was auf der Erde ist. Keine Ermächtigung habt ihr dafür. Wollt ihr über Allah etwas sagen, was ihr nicht wißt?
ref: They said, “Allah has created a son for Himself”- Purity is to Him! He is the Perfect (Unwanting, free of needs); to Him only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; “You do not have any proof of this; do you say a thing concerning Allah which you do not know?”
draft: They say, "Allah has taken children for Himself." Glory be to Him! He is the Self-sufficient. To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say about Allah what you do not know?
hil: They said, "Allah has taken an offspring for Himself" - Purity is to Him! In fact, all that is in the heavens and the earth is His dominion; all are submissive to Him. Do you wish to inform Allah of that which He knows not in the heavens or in the earth?
compare: They say, "Allah has taken children for Himself." Glory be to Him! He is the Self-sufficient. To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say about Allah what you do not know?

src: Und hätten sie sich doch in Geduld geübt, bis du zu ihnen herauskommst, wäre dies sicher besser für sie.
ref: If they had waited for you to come out it would have been better for them.
draft: And if they had only practiced patience until you came out to them, this would surely be better for them.
hil: And if they had only practiced patience until you came out to them, this would surely be better for them.
compare: And if they had only practiced patience until you came out to them, this would surely be better for them.

src: Möge sein Herr ihm, wenn er euch (alle) entläßt, zum Tausch andere Gattinnen geben, die besser sind als ihr: muslimische Frauen, die gläubig und demütig ergeben sind, bereit zur Umkehr sind, (Gott) dienen und umherziehen, ob sie früher verheiratet waren oder Jungfrauen sind.
ref: In case he divorces you, his Lord will give him better wives in return, who will be modest, true believers, obedient to God, repentant, observant of prayer and fasting, both widows and virgins.
draft: May his master, when he dismisses you, give him other wives in exchange who are better than you: Muslim women who are faithful and obedient, willing to repent, serve (God) and travel, whether they were previously married or virgins.
hil: May his master, when he releases you all, give him other wives in exchange who are better than you: Muslim women who are faithful and obedient, willing to repent, serve (God), and travel, whether they were previously married or virgins.
compare: May his master, when he releases you all, give him other wives in exchange who are better than you: Muslim women who are faithful and obedient, willing to repent, serve (God), and travel, whether they were previously married or virgins.

src: Das ist ein gerader Weg."
ref: This is the straight path."
draft: "The path is straight."
hil: This is a straight path.
compare: "The path is straight."

src: Da wollte er sie aus dem Land aufschrecken.
ref: So he resolved to turn them out of the land (of Egypt).
draft: He wanted to scare her out of the country.
hil: He wanted to scare her out of the land.
compare: He wanted to scare her out of the land.

src: Kostet nun die Pein dafür, daß ihr ungläubig waret.»
ref: Therefore now taste the punishment, the result of your disbelief.”
draft: "Now taste the pain for being unbelievers."
hil: Taste now the pain for being unbelievers.
compare: Taste now the pain for being unbelievers.

src: Dachten sie etwa nicht über sich selbst nach?!
ref: What, have they not considered within themselves?
draft: Did they not even think about themselves?!
hil: Did they not even reflect on themselves?!
compare: Did they not even reflect on themselves?!

src: Und die frohe Botschaft gib den Demütigen
ref: Give good tidings to those who bow in obedience to God,
draft: And the good news give to the humble.
hil: Give the glad tidings to the humble.
compare: Give the glad tidings to the humble.

src: Das Gleichnis derer, denen die Thora auferlegt wurde, und die ihr dann nicht nachlebten, ist wie das Gleichnis eines Esels, der Bücher trägt. Übel steht es um die Leute, die Allahs Zeichen leugnen. Und Allah rechtleitet kein ungerechtes Volk.
ref: The example of those who were entrusted with the Taurat, and did not carry out its commands, is like the donkey carrying books; what a wretched example is of the people who denied the signs of Allah; and Allah does not guide the unjust.
draft: The parable of those who were burdened with the Torah and then did not live up to it is like the parable of a donkey carrying books. Evil is the state of those who deny Allah's signs. And Allah does not guide a wrongdoing people.
hil: The parable of those to whom the Torah was entrusted but who then did not follow it is like that of a donkey carrying books. Wretched is the state of those who deny Allah's signs. And Allah does not guide unjust people.
compare: The parable of those who were burdened with the Torah and then did not live up to it is like the parable of a donkey carrying books. Evil is the state of those who deny Allah's signs. And Allah does not guide a wrongdoing people.

src: Und WIR wiesen dem Menschen zu, seinen Eltern Ihsan zu erweisen. Seine Mutter war schwanger mit ihm in Angestrengtheit und brachte ihn zur Welt in Angestrengtheit.
ref: We have enjoined on man to be good to his parents: His mother carries him in her womb with hardship, and gives birth to him in pain.
draft: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. [Quran 31:14]
hil: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years.
compare: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. [Quran 31:14]

src: Sie sagten: "Al-'aziz!
ref: They said, “O governor!
draft: They said: "Al-'aziz!"
hil: They said, 'Al-'aziz!'
compare: They said: "Al-'aziz!"

src: Und euer HERR ist gewiß Der Allgnade Erweisende.
ref: Surely your Lord is Ar-Rahman.
draft: And your Lord is certainly the one who shows great mercy.
hil: Your Lord is certainly the Most Merciful, He shows great mercy.
compare: Your Lord is certainly the Most Merciful, He shows great mercy.

src: Und wenn du sie fragst, wer die Himmel und die Erde erschaffen und die Sonne und den Mond dienstbar gemacht hat, sagen sie bestimmt: «Gott.» Wie leicht lassen sie sich doch abwenden!
ref: And if you ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth, and subjected the sun and the moon?”, they will surely say, “Allah”; so where are they reverting?
draft: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, and made the sun and moon subservient, they will surely say "God". How easily they are turned away!
hil: If you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, and set the sun and the moon to work, they will answer, 'God.' How easily they are turned away!
compare: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, and made the sun and moon subservient, they will surely say "God". How easily they are turned away!

src: Und wenn die Menschen (vor Mir) versammelt werden, werden sie ihre Feinde sein und ihre Anbetung verleugnen.
ref: When all men are gathered together (on that Day) they will become their enemies and deny their worship.
draft: And when people are gathered (before Me), they will be their enemies and deny their worship.
hil: When people are gathered before Me, they will be their enemies and will deny their worship.
compare: When people are gathered before Me, they will be their enemies and will deny their worship.

src: Sag: "Ja!
ref: Say: "Yes!
draft: Say: "Yes!
hil: Say: 'Yes!'
compare: Say: "Yes!

src: Als er zu seinem Vater sagte: "Mein Vater! Weshalb betest du etwas an, das weder sieht, noch hört, noch von dir irgend etwas abwenden kann?
ref: Remember, when he said to his father: "O my father, why do you worship that which can neither hear nor see nor even profit you the least?
draft: When he said to his father, "My father! Why do you worship something that neither sees nor hears nor can turn away anything from you?".
