hil: He said to his father, "My father, why do you worship something that neither sees nor hears nor can turn away anything from you?"
compare: When he said to his father, "My father! Why do you worship something that neither sees nor hears nor can turn away anything from you?".

src: sie würden gewiß sagen: "Nur unsere Blicke sind benommen; wahrlich, man hat uns nur etwas vorgegaukelt."
ref: They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."
draft: They would certainly say, "Only our gaze is dazed; truly, we have only been shown something."
hil: They would surely say, 'Only our gaze is dazed; verily, we have only been shown something.'
compare: They would certainly say, "Only our gaze is dazed; truly, we have only been shown something."

src: Es ist so! Denn ALLAH wandelt keine Gabe (in Bestrafung) um, die ER Leuten beschert hat, bis sie sich selbst (zum Schlechten) verändern.
ref: That is so because Allah will never change a grace which He has bestowed on a people until they change what is in their ownselves.
draft: It is true! Because ALLAH does not transform any gift that HE has bestowed upon people into punishment, until they themselves (turn to wrongdoing).
hil: It is true! For ALLAH does not transform any gift that He has bestowed upon people into punishment, until they themselves turn to wrongdoing.
compare: It is true! Because ALLAH does not transform any gift that HE has bestowed upon people into punishment, until they themselves (turn to wrongdoing).

src: Ihr Menschen! Esst von dem, was auf Erden ist, an genießbaren Halalmitteln, und folgt nicht den Fußstapfen des Satans!
ref: O men, eat only the things of the earth that are lawful and good.
draft: "O people! Eat from the Earth what is permissible and good, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan!"
hil: O people! Eat of the lawful and good things that are in the earth, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.
compare: O people! Eat of the lawful and good things that are in the earth, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.

src: Sagt: "Wollt ihr mit uns über ALLAH disputieren, wo ER unser und euer HERR ist, und wo uns unsere Taten und euch eure Taten gehören, und wo wir Ihm gegenüber aufrichtig sind?!"
ref: Say: "Why do you dispute with us about God when He is equally your Lord and our Lord? To us belong our actions, to you yours; and we are true to Him."
draft: Say, "Do you want to argue with us about Allah while He is our and your Lord? And we are accountable for our deeds and you are accountable for your deeds, and we are sincere to Him."
hil: Say, "Do you not want to act according to Taqwa?"
compare: Say, "Do you want to argue with us about Allah while He is our and your Lord? And we are accountable for our deeds and you are accountable for your deeds, and we are sincere to Him."

src: Und WIR ließen sie in Unsere Gnade eintreten.
ref: And they were admitted to Our grace.
draft: And WE let them enter into our grace.
hil: And WE allowed them to enter into our grace.
compare: And WE let them enter into our grace.

src: Immer wieder wenn sie aus ihr (Dschahannam) aus einer Drangsal herausgehen wollten, werden sie wieder zu ihr zurückgeschickt.
ref: Whenever in their anguish they try to get out of it, they are restored to it.
draft: Again and again, when they wanted to get out of it (Dschahannam) from distress, they are sent back to it again.
hil: Again and again, whenever they wanted to get out of it (Dschahannam) due to distress, they are sent back to it again.
compare: Again and again, whenever they wanted to get out of it (Dschahannam) due to distress, they are sent back to it again.

src: Jene laden zum (Höllen)feuer ein. Allah aber lädt zum (Paradies)garten und zur Vergebung ein, mit Seiner Erlaubnis, und macht den Menschen Seine Zeichen klar, auf daß sie bedenken mögen.
ref: They invite you to Hell, but God calls you to Paradise and pardon by His grace. And He makes His signs manifest that men may haply take heed.
draft: Those invite to (Hell)fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that perhaps they may remember.
hil: Those invite to the fire, but Allah invites to the Garden and to forgiveness by His permission. And He makes clear His signs to the people that they may reflect.
compare: Those invite to (Hell)fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that perhaps they may remember.

src: Und solltest du diejenigen sehen, die über Unsere Ayat lästern, so wende dich von ihnen (so lange) ab, bis sie zu einem anderen Thema übergehen.
ref: When you see them argue about Our messages, withdraw from their company until they begin to talk of other things.
draft: And if you see those who blaspheme against Our verses, turn away from them until they turn to another topic.
hil: If you see those who blaspheme against Our verses, turn away from them until they switch to another topic.
compare: If you see those who blaspheme against Our verses, turn away from them until they switch to another topic.

src: Er aber erklärte (es) für Lüge und war ungehorsam.
ref: But (the Pharaoh) disavowed and disobeyed.
draft: But he declared it a lie and was disobedient.
hil: But he declared (it) a lie and was disobedient.
compare: But he declared (it) a lie and was disobedient.

src: Haben WIR euch etwa nicht ein langes Lebensalter gewährt, während dessen derjenige sich erinnern konnte, der sich erinnern wollte?! Auch der Warner kam zu euch.
ref: But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you?
draft: Have WE not granted you a long lifespan during which the one who wanted to remember could remember?! Also, the Warner came to you.
hil: Have WE not granted you a long lifespan during which the one who wanted to remember could remember?! Also, the Warner came to you.
compare: Have WE not granted you a long lifespan during which the one who wanted to remember could remember?! Also, the Warner came to you.

src: Der Satan ist gegen den Erbarmer widerspenstig.
ref: Verily Satan was disobedient to Ar-Rahman.
draft: "The Satan is obstinate against the Merciful."
hil: The Satan is obstinate against the Merciful.
compare: "The Satan is obstinate against the Merciful."

src: Und (auch) diejenigen unter diesen da, die Unrecht tun, werden die bösen Taten treffen, die sie begangen haben.
ref: So will the evil deeds of those who are sinners among them recoil back on them.
draft: And (also) those among them who do wrong will face the evil deeds they have committed.
hil: And (also) those among them who do wrong will face the evil deeds they have committed.
compare: And (also) those among them who do wrong will face the evil deeds they have committed.

src: Euer Besitz und eure Kinder sind nur eine Versuchung; Allah aber - bei Ihm gibt es großartigen Lohn.
ref: Your wealth and children are surely meant as trial for you: But with God is the great reward.
draft: Your possessions and your children are only a temptation; Allah, however, with Him is great reward.
hil: Your ownership and your children are but temptation; Allah, however, great reward is with Him.
compare: Your possessions and your children are only a temptation; Allah, however, with Him is great reward.

src: Und dort vor Salomo wurden dessen Heerscharen der Ginn und Menschen und Vögel versammelt, und sie standen in Reih und Glied geordnet
ref: His armies of jinns and men and Tair assembled, formed into ranks, (and marched)
draft: And there, before Solomon, his armies of Jinn and men and birds were gathered, and they stood arranged in rows and in files.
hil: And there, in front of Solomon, were assembled his armies of Jinn and men and birds. They stood in rows and columns, arranged in order.
compare: And there, in front of Solomon, were assembled his armies of Jinn and men and birds. They stood in rows and columns, arranged in order.

src: Das ist der Tag, an dem sie nicht reden
ref: They will not be able to speak that day,
draft: This is the first turn result: "This is the day they don't talk."
hil: The output based on the given examples and revisions: "That is the day they are not speaking."
compare: The output based on the given examples and revisions: "That is the day they are not speaking."

src: Vielmehr sind es geehrte Diener.
ref: (Those whom they think are God's sons) are only His honorable servants.
draft: Rather, they are honored servants.
hil: Rather, they are honored servants.
compare: Rather, they are honored servants.

src: Sie werden ihrem Herrn begegnen. Allein, ich erachte euch für ein Volk, das unwissend ist.
ref: Surely, they are going to meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people that are ignorant.
draft: You will meet your master. However, I consider you to be a people who are ignorant.
hil: They will meet their Lord. However, I consider you to be an ignorant people.
compare: They will meet their Lord. However, I consider you to be an ignorant people.

src: Auch ist es eine Erinnerung für die Mumin.
ref: You are to warn with it—and a reminder for the believers.
draft: Also, it is a reminder for the Moomins.
hil: It is also a reminder for the Moomins.
compare: Also, it is a reminder for the Moomins.

src: So kehre dich von ihnen ab; du bist (hierin) nicht zu tadeln.
ref: Turn away from them. You will not be blamed.
draft: So turn away from them; you are not to blame for this.
hil: Turn away from them, and you are blameless in this regard.
compare: Turn away from them, and you are blameless in this regard.

src: Du versuchst nur, ein Tyrann im Land zu werden, und du willst kein Friedensstifter sein."
ref: You only want to be a tyrant in the land and no peacemaker."
draft: "You're just trying to become a tyrant in the country, and you don't want to be a peacemaker."
hil: You are only trying to become a tyrant in the country and you do not want to be a peacemaker.
compare: "You're just trying to become a tyrant in the country, and you don't want to be a peacemaker."

src: Ob er wohl (die Botschaft) für Lüge erklärt und sich abkehrt?
ref: If he cries lies, and turns away -
draft: "Will he declare (the message) to be a lie and turn away?"
hil: Did he deny (the message) and turn away?
compare: "Will he declare (the message) to be a lie and turn away?"

src: Allah hatte ja mit den Kinder Isra'ils ein Abkommen getroffen. Und Wir beriefen von ihnen zwölf Obmänner.
ref: God covenanted the people of Israel and raised twelve leaders among them, and said: "I shall verily be with you.
draft: Allah had made a covenant with the Children of Israel, and We appointed twelve leaders among them.
hil: Allah had taken a bond from the Children of Israel, and We appointed twelve wardens among them.
compare: Allah had made a covenant with the Children of Israel, and We appointed twelve leaders among them.

src: Und gewiß, ich denke doch über dich, du Pharao! - daß du verleitet bist."
ref: I truly think, O Pharaoh, your days are done."
draft: " And surely, I do think about you, you pharaoh! - that you are tempted."
hil: And indeed, I do think about you, O Pharaoh, that you are misled.
compare: And indeed, I do think about you, O Pharaoh, that you are misled.

src: Laß Mich in Ruhe mit denen, die diese Botschaft für Lüge erklären.
ref: So leave those who deny this Discourse to Me.
draft: Let me alone with those who declare this message to be a lie.
hil: Leave the one who denies this matter to Me; We shall soon steadily take them away, from a place they do not know.
compare: Let me alone with those who declare this message to be a lie.

src: Geh hinaus. Du gehörst zu den Erniedrigten.»
ref: Go, and away; you are one of the damned."
draft: "Go outside. You belong to the humiliated ones."
hil: Go out. You belong to the humiliated ones.
compare: "Go outside. You belong to the humiliated ones."

src: Und Gott zürnt ihm und verflucht ihn und bereitet ihm eine gewaltige Pein.
ref: For him a greater punishment awaits.
draft: And God is angry with him and curses him and prepares a powerful pain for him.
hil: And God is angry with him and curses him and prepares a great pain for him.
compare: And God is angry with him and curses him and prepares a powerful pain for him.

src: (Es sind) diejenigen, die glauben und deren Herzen im Gedenken Allahs Ruhe finden.
ref: “Those who accepted faith and whose hearts gain solace from the remembrance of Allah; pay heed!
draft: Those who believe and find peace in the remembrance of Allah are (the ones).
hil: Those who believe and find peace in contemplation of God, surely there is peace of heart in God!
compare: Those who believe and find peace in the remembrance of Allah are (the ones).

src: Die Entscheidungsträger vom Pharaos Leuten sagten: "Gewiß, dieser ist doch ein im Wissen fundierter Magier!
ref: The nobles of Pharaoh said: "He surely is a clever magician.
draft: "The decision-makers of Pharaoh's people said: "Indeed, he is a knowledgeable magician!"
hil: The assembly of Pharaoh's people said, "Indeed, he is a knowledgeable magician!"
compare: The assembly of Pharaoh's people said, "Indeed, he is a knowledgeable magician!"

src: Wir fordern von keiner Seele etwas über das hinaus, was sie zu leisten vermag. Und wenn ihr eine Aussage macht, so übt Gerechtigkeit, auch wenn es einen nahen Verwandten (betrifft); und haltet den Bund Allahs ein.
ref: Give full measure and weight, according to justice, We never charge a soul with more than it can bear, when you speak, observe justice, even though it concerns a close relative; and fulfil the covenants of God.
draft: We do not demand from any soul more than it can bear. And if you make a statement, then practice justice, even if it concerns a close relative; and keep the covenant of Allah.
hil: We do not demand from any soul more than it can bear. And if you make a statement, then practice justice, even if it concerns a close relative; and keep the covenant of Allah.
compare: We do not demand from any soul more than it can bear. And if you make a statement, then practice justice, even if it concerns a close relative; and keep the covenant of Allah.

src: Sie (die Königin) sagte: "Ihr Vornehmen, ein ehrenvoller Brief ist mir überbracht worden.
ref: (The Queen said): "O nobles, a venerable letter has been delivered to me.
draft: She (the queen) said: "Your Excellency, an honorable letter has been delivered to me."
hil: She (the queen) said, 'Your Excellency, an honorable letter has been delivered to me.'
compare: She (the queen) said, 'Your Excellency, an honorable letter has been delivered to me.'

src: Dann bezichtigten sie ihn der Lüge, dann verletzten sie ihm (dem Kamelweibchen) die Beine, dann richtete ihr HERR sie wegen ihrer Verfehlung zugrunde, dann ließ ER es ihnen gleichmäßig sein.
ref: But they called him a liar and hamstrung her. So God obliterated them for their crime, and (destroyed) all of them alike.
draft: Then they accused him of lying, then they injured his (the female camel's) legs, then their LORD destroyed her for their transgression, then HE made it equal for them.
hil: Then they accused him of lying, then they injured the legs of the female camel, then their Lord destroyed her for their transgression, then He made it equal for them.
compare: Then they accused him of lying, then they injured the legs of the female camel, then their Lord destroyed her for their transgression, then He made it equal for them.

src: Und wenn diejenigen, die Unrecht begingen, die Peinigung gesehen haben, wird diese ihnen weder erleichtert, noch wird ihnen Zeitaufschub gewährt.
ref: And when the wicked shall face the torment it will not be decreased, nor will they be reprieved.
draft: And when those who committed injustice see the punishment, it will neither be lightened for them nor will they be granted respite.
hil: And those who have committed wrongdoing, when they see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be granted respite.
compare: And those who have committed wrongdoing, when they see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be granted respite.

src: Ihre Angelegenheit unterliegt nur ALLAH, dann wird ER ihnen das kundtun, was sie zu tun pflegten.
ref: Their affair is with God. He will tell them the truth of what they were doing.
draft: Your matter is only subject to ALLAH, then HE will inform you about what you used to do.
hil: Your matter is subject only to Allah, then He will inform them of what they used to do.
compare: Your matter is only subject to ALLAH, then HE will inform you about what you used to do.

src: So ließen Wir die einen von ihnen auf die anderen folgen und machten sie zu(m Gegenstand von) Geschichten. Weg darum mit Leuten, die nicht glauben!
ref: So oft as there came unto a community their apostle, they belied him, so We made them follow one anot her, and We made them bywords: so away with a people who believe not!
draft: Therefore, We caused some of them to follow others, and We made them subject of stories. Therefore, away with the people who do not believe!
hil: We made some of them follow the others and turned them into the subject of stories. So away with the people who do not believe.
compare: We made some of them follow the others and turned them into the subject of stories. So away with the people who do not believe.

src: Bis auf eine alte Frau unter denen, die zurückblieben und dem Verderben anheimfielen.
ref: Except one old woman who remained behind.
draft: Except for an old woman among those who remained and fell prey to destruction.
hil: Except for an old woman among those who remained and fell prey to destruction.
compare: Except for an old woman among those who remained and fell prey to destruction.

src: Der Mensch ist ja eilfertig.
ref: Curse him, etc." and that one should not do, but one should be patient].
draft: "Man is indeed hasty."
hil: Indeed, man is hasty.
compare: Indeed, man is hasty.

src: Allah wird sie bald in Seine Barmherzigkeit einführen. Wahrlich, Allah ist Allvergebend, Barmherzig.
ref: This is certainly a means of achieving nearness (to God), and God will admit them to His mercy, for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: "Allah will soon introduce them into His mercy. Truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful."
hil: Allah will soon introduce them into His mercy. Verily, Allah is All-Forgiving and merciful.
compare: "Allah will soon introduce them into His mercy. Truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful."

src: Sie glauben nicht eher, bis sie dich über das richten lassen, was zwischen ihnen umstritten ist, und hierauf in sich selbst keine Bedrängnis finden durch das, was du entschieden hast, und sich in voller Ergebung fügen.
ref: They will not believe until they make you a judge in their disputes, then do not find within their hearts any dissent to your verdict and submit in full submission.
draft: They do not believe until they have had you judge in a dispute over that which is in contention among them and then find within themselves no discomfort over what you have decided and submit in full submission.
hil: They do not believe until they have had you judge in a dispute over what is in contention among them and then find no discomfort within themselves over what you have decided and submit in full submission.
compare: They do not believe until they have had you judge in a dispute over that which is in contention among them and then find within themselves no discomfort over what you have decided and submit in full submission.

src: In Deiner Hand ist das Gute; wahrlich, Du hast Macht über alle Dinge.
ref: All goodness is Yours (entirely). Indeed You have the power over all things.
draft: In your hand is the good; truly, you have power over all things.
hil: In your hand is the good; truly, you have power over all things.
compare: In your hand is the good; truly, you have power over all things.

src: ALLAH möge euch vergeben.
ref: God will forgive you.
draft: May ALLAH forgive you.
hil: May ALLAH forgive you.
compare: May ALLAH forgive you.

src: Und auswirft, was in ihr ist, und somit ganz leer wird
ref: And throws out whatever it contains and is empty,
draft: And throws out what is in it, and thus becomes completely empty.
hil: He throws out what is within it, and thus becomes completely empty.
compare: And throws out what is in it, and thus becomes completely empty.

src: Und sie sagen: "Wann wird dieses Versprechen (verwirklicht werden), wenn ihr wahrhaftig seid?"
ref: They say: "When is this promise going to come, if what you say is true?"
draft: And they say, "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truly sincere?"
hil: They say: 'When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truly sincere?'
compare: And they say, "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truly sincere?"

src: Vielmehr wissen die meisten von ihnen nicht.
ref: Nay, most of them know not.
draft: Most of them, however, do not know.
hil: Most of them don't know.
compare: Most of them, however, do not know.

src: Die Vergeltung für diejenigen unter euch, die dies tun, ist nichts als Schande im diesseitigen Leben, und am Tag der Auferstehung werden sie der härtesten Pein zugeführt werden. Und Gott läßt nicht unbeachtet, was ihr tut.
ref: There is no other award for them who so act but disgrace in the world, and on the Day of Judgement the severest of punishment; for God is not heedless of all that you do.
draft: The retribution for those of you who do that is nothing but shame in this worldly life, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be subjected to the severest punishment. And God does not overlook what you do.
hil: The retribution for those of you who do this is nothing but disgrace in this worldly life, and on the Day of Resurrection, they will be subjected to the severest punishment. And God does not overlook what you do.
compare: The retribution for those of you who do that is nothing but shame in this worldly life, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be subjected to the severest punishment. And God does not overlook what you do.

src: Und wenn sie um Hilfe rufen, wird Ihrem Hilferuf entsprochen mit Wasser wie das Geschmolzene, das die Gesichter schmort.
ref: If they ask for water they will be helped to liquid like molten brass that would scald their mouths.
draft: And when they call for help, their cry for help will be answered with water like molten metal that burns their faces.
hil: And when they cry out for help, their cry for help shall be answered with water like molten metal that will scorch their faces.
compare: And when they cry out for help, their cry for help shall be answered with water like molten metal that will scorch their faces.

src: Ihr Menschen! Bereits ist zu euch doch ein Gesandter mit der Wahrheit von eurem HERRN gekommen, so verinnerlicht den Iman, dies ist besser für euch.
ref: O men, the Messenger has now come to you with the truth from your Lord; so believe; better is it for you.
draft: "O people! A messenger has already come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe in him; it is better for you."
hil: O people! A messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so internalize faith, it is better for you.
compare: O people! A messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so internalize faith, it is better for you.

src: Uns beeilen, ihnen gute Dinge (zu gewähren)? Aber nein! Sie merken nicht.
ref: We provide them with the means of competing with each other in virtuous deeds, but they do not realize this.
draft: Let's hurry to grant them good things? But no! They don't notice.
hil: They hurry us to grant them good things? But no! They don't notice.
compare: They hurry us to grant them good things? But no! They don't notice.

src: Nein, sondern wir glauben, daß ihr Lügner seid!"
ref: In fact, we think you are a liar."
draft: "No, but we believe that you are liars!"
hil: No, but we believe that you are liars!
compare: "No, but we believe that you are liars!"

src: Dient eurem HERRN, Der euch erschuf und diejenigen vor euch, damit ihr Taqwa gemäß handelt.
ref: Worship your Lord, Who has created you and those before you, in the hope of attaining piety.
draft: Serve your LORD, Who created you and those before you, so that you may act according to Taqwa.
hil: Serve your Lord who created you and those before you, so that you may act according to Taqwa.
compare: Serve your LORD, Who created you and those before you, so that you may act according to Taqwa.

src: Und stifteten darin viel Unheil.
ref: And multiplied corruption.
draft: And caused a lot of harm in it.
hil: And caused a lot of harm in it.
compare: And caused a lot of harm in it.

src: Betreiben sie etwa Schirk mit dem, was Nichts schafft, während sie alle doch erschaffen werden?!
ref: Do they associate those with Him who cannot create a thing, and are themselves created,
draft: Do they operate Schirk with what creates nothing, while all are yet to be created?!
hil: Do they commit shirk with what creates nothing, while all are yet to be created?!
compare: Do they operate Schirk with what creates nothing, while all are yet to be created?!

src: Da ergriff sie Gott wegen ihrer Sünden.
ref: But Allah seized them with punishment for their sins.
draft: God seized her because of her sins.
hil: God seized her because of her sins.
compare: God seized her because of her sins.

src: Dies sind Allahs Grenzen, so übertretet sie nicht! Wer aber Allahs Grenzen übertritt, diejenigen sind die Ungerechten.
ref: Do not exceed the limits of God, for those who exceed the bounds set by God are transgressors.
draft: These are Allah's boundaries, so do not exceed them! But whoever violates the boundaries of Allah, they are the unjust.
hil: These are the limits set by Allah, so do not transgress them. Indeed, those who transgress the limits of Allah are the wrongdoers.
compare: These are Allah's boundaries, so do not exceed them! But whoever violates the boundaries of Allah, they are the unjust.

src: Euch wird euer Lohn am Tag der Auferstehung voll erstattet.
ref: And only on the Day of Resurrection shall you be paid your wages in full.
draft: "You will receive your reward in full on the day of resurrection."
hil: You will be fully reimbursed your reward on the day of resurrection.
compare: "You will receive your reward in full on the day of resurrection."

src: Doch wenn ihr Kufr betreibt, so ist Meine Peinigung gewiß qualvoll."
ref: My punishment is dire.
draft: But if you commit disbelief, then surely My punishment is severe.
hil: But if you engage in disbelief, then surely My punishment is severe.
compare: But if you commit disbelief, then surely My punishment is severe.

src: Und für euch gibt es anstelle von ALLAH weder Wali, noch Beistehenden.
ref: And you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.
draft: And for you there is neither a Wali nor a helper instead of Allah.
hil: There is no guardian, nor any helper for you instead of Allah.
compare: There is no guardian, nor any helper for you instead of Allah.

src: Und für diejenigen, welche die gottmißfälligen Taten intrigieren, ist eine harte Peinigung bestimmt.
ref: To Him ascend (all) the goodly words, and the righteous deeds exalt it (the goodly words i.e. the goodly words are not accepted by Allah unless and until they are followed by good deeds), but those who plot evils, theirs will be severe torment.
draft: And for those who conspire in the acts displeasing to God, a harsh punishment is destined.
hil: And for those who conspire in acts displeasing to God, a harsh punishment is determined.
compare: And for those who conspire in acts displeasing to God, a harsh punishment is determined.

src: Doch solltet ihr euch abwenden, so fürchte ich doch für euch die Peinigung eines langen Tages.
ref: But if you turn away, I fear the punishment of a terrible Day for you.
draft: However, if you turn away, I fear for you the torment of a long day.
hil: If, however, you turn away, I fear for you the torment of a long day.
compare: However, if you turn away, I fear for you the torment of a long day.

src: Es sind aber nur die Ungläubigen, die Unsere Zeichen leugnen.
ref: Only those who are infidels will deny it.
draft: But only the unbelievers deny our signs.
hil: Only the unbelievers deny our signs.
compare: But only the unbelievers deny our signs.

src: Gepriesen-erhaben ist ER! ER ist ALLAH, Der Einzige, Der Allbezwingende.
ref: Exalted is He; He is Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
draft: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is ALLAH, the Only One, the Almighty.
hil: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is ALLAH, the Only One, the Almighty.
compare: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is ALLAH, the Only One, the Almighty.

src: Also gräme dich nicht wegen der fisq-betreibenden Leute!"
ref: So do not grieve for these, the wicked people."
draft: "Do not worry about the people who are causing trouble with FISQ!"
hil: Do not grieve because of the people who are promoting fisq!
compare: "Do not worry about the people who are causing trouble with FISQ!"

src: Seine Mutter war schwanger mit ihm in Angestrengtheit und brachte ihn zur Welt in Angestrengtheit. Und (die Zeit) der Schwangerschaft mit ihm und sein Entwöhnen ist dreißig Monate.
ref: His mother beareth him with reluctance, and bringeth him forth with reluctance, and the bearing of him and the weaning of him is thirty months, till, when he attaineth full strength and reacheth forty years, he saith: My Lord!
draft: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And the duration of his conception and his weaning is thirty months.
hil: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. The duration of his conception and weaning is thirty months.
compare: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And the duration of his conception and his weaning is thirty months.

src: Aber dir gehört es, zu befehlen.
ref: It is for you to decide.
draft: But it is yours to command.
hil: But it belongs to you to command.
compare: But it belongs to you to command.

src: Sie sind doch im Zweifel über die Begegnung mit ihrem HERRN.
ref: They are in doubt concerning the Meeting with their Lord? (i.e. Resurrection after their deaths, and their return to their Lord).
draft: You are in doubt about your encounter with your LORD.
hil: You are indeed in doubt about the encounter with your LORD.
compare: You are indeed in doubt about the encounter with your LORD.

src: Und der Gesandte sagt: "O mein Herr, mein Volk mied diesen Qur'an unter Mißachtung."
ref: The prophet will say: "O my Lord, my people had fettered the Qur'an."
draft: And the envoy says: "O my lord, my people avoided this Qur'an with contempt."
hil: The messenger says, "O my Lord, my people avoided and ignored this Qur'an."
compare: The messenger says, "O my Lord, my people avoided and ignored this Qur'an."

src: So haben Wir ihn als klare Zeichen hinabgesandt, und (es ist so,) daß Allah rechtleitet, wen Er will.
ref: That is why We have sent down these clear revelations, for God gives guidance whomsoever He please.
draft: So we sent him down as clear evidence and (it is so) that Allah guides whom He wills.
hil: We have sent it down as clear signs, and it is Allah who guides whom He wills.
compare: So we sent him down as clear evidence and (it is so) that Allah guides whom He wills.

src: So wendet euch nicht als Schuldige ab."
ref: So do not turn away from Him as sinners."
draft: "So do not turn away as guilty."
hil: Do not turn away as guilty.
compare: Do not turn away as guilty.

src: Und dein HERR genügt als Wakil."
ref: Thy Lord suffices as a guardian.
draft: "And your Lord is sufficient as a guardian."
hil: Your Lord suffices as Guardian.
compare: "And your Lord is sufficient as a guardian."

src: Dem, der Gutes vollbringt, wird Besseres als das zuteil sein, und sie werden vor dem Schrecken an jenem Tag sicher sein.
ref: Whoever comes with good (deeds) will receive better than (what he had done), and be safe that day from terror.
draft: The one who does good will receive better than that, and they will be secure from the fear on that Day.
hil: To the one who does good deeds, will be given something better than what he did, and they will be secure on that Day from the horror.
compare: To the one who does good deeds, will be given something better than what he did, and they will be secure on that Day from the horror.

src: Und hätten sie doch das getan, womit sie ermahnt werden, wäre es besser für sie und würde sie noch mehr (im Iman) bestärken.
ref: And did they do that which they are exhorted to do, it would be for them better and more strengthening.
draft: And if they had done what they were admonished to do, it would have been better for them and would have strengthened them even more in their faith.
hil: And if only they had acted upon what they were advised to, it would have been better for them, and it would have strengthened their faith even more.
compare: And if they had done what they were admonished to do, it would have been better for them and would have strengthened them even more in their faith.

src: um undankbar zu sein für das, was Wir ihnen gegeben haben, und um zu genießen; sie werden (es noch) erfahren.
ref: And deny what We had given them, in order to go on enjoying themselves. They will come to know soon.
draft: To be ungrateful for what we have given them, and to enjoy; they will (still) experience it.
hil: To be ungrateful for what We have given them, and to enjoy; they will experience it.
compare: To be ungrateful for what We have given them, and to enjoy; they will experience it.

src: (Aber) gewiß, Meine List ist fest.
ref: Verily, My Plan is strong.
draft: (Aber) gewiß, Meine List ist fest. -> (But) indeed, my cunning is firm.
hil: (But) indeed, my plan is firm.
compare: (Aber) gewiß, Meine List ist fest. -> (But) indeed, my cunning is firm.

src: Ihnen genügt Dschahannam, sie werden darin hineingeworfen.
ref: Hell is enough for them. They will roast in it.
draft: They are content with Jahannam, and they will be thrown into it.
hil: They are content with Jahannam and will be thrown into it.
compare: They are content with Jahannam and will be thrown into it.

src: Das ist Allah, euer Herr. Segensreich ist darum Allah, der Herr der Welten.
ref: That then is God, your Lord, so blessed be God, the Lord of all Being.
draft: This is Allah, your Lord. Therefore, Allah is blessed, the Lord of the worlds.
hil: He is Allah, your Lord. Therefore, Allah is blessed, the Lord of all the worlds.
compare: He is Allah, your Lord. Therefore, Allah is blessed, the Lord of all the worlds.

src: Allah wird ganz gewiß diejenigen kennen, die die Wahrheit sprechen, und Er wird ganz gewiß die Lügner kennen.
ref: So Allah will surely know those who are true and He will surely know the liars.
draft: "Allah will certainly know those who speak the truth, and He will certainly know the liars."
hil: Allah will certainly recognize those who speak the truth, and He will certainly recognize the liars.
compare: "Allah will certainly know those who speak the truth, and He will certainly know the liars."

src: (Ihre Abneigung gegen diese Einteilung von Al-anfal ist) genauso (wie damals), als dein HERR dich aus deiner Wohnstätte mit der Wahrheit herausführen ließ, während eine Gruppe von den Mumin gewiß dem doch abgeneigt war.
ref: As your Lord sent you from your home (to fight) for the true cause, a section of the faithful were averse,
draft: (Your aversion to this division of Al-anfal is) just like (back then), when your LORD brought you forth from your home with the truth, while a group of believers were certainly averse to it.
hil: (Your aversion to this division of Al-anfal is) just like (back then), when your Noble Messenger (Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) was sent to you with the truth from your lord, yet a group of the believers were certainly averse to it.
compare: (Your aversion to this division of Al-anfal is) just like (back then), when your LORD brought you forth from your home with the truth, while a group of believers were certainly averse to it.

src: Die Kaffara dafür ist die Speisung von zehn Bedürftigen in jenem Maß, wie ihr die Eurigen im Durchschnitt speist, oder Ihre Bekleidung oder die Befreiung eines Unfreien.
ref: The atonement for it is by feeding ten needy people from the average of what you feed your families, or by clothing them, or by freeing a slave.
draft: The expiation for it is the feeding of ten needy persons with such food as you normally provide to your own family, or the clothing of them, or the freedom of a slave.
hil: The expiation for it is to feed ten needy persons with the average of that food which you provide to your own family, or to clothe them, or to free a slave.
compare: The expiation for it is the feeding of ten needy persons with such food as you normally provide to your own family, or the clothing of them, or the freedom of a slave.

src: Gewiß, sie waren jungeMänner, die den Iman an ihren HERRN verinnerlichten, undWIR ließen sie noch mehr Rechtleitung gewinnen.
ref: They were a few young men who believed in their Lord; so We gave them greater guidance.
draft: Certainly, they were young men who internalized the faith in their LORD, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.
hil: Certainly, they were young men who internalized their faith in their Lord, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.
compare: Certainly, they were young men who internalized their faith in their Lord, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.

src: Aber der Lohn des Jenseits ist wahrlich besser für diejenigen, die glauben und gottesfürchtig sind.
ref: And certainly the recompense of the life to come is better for those who believe and follow the right path.
draft: But the reward of the Hereafter is truly better for those who believe and are mindful of God.
hil: The reward of the Hereafter is truly better for those who believe and are mindful of God.
compare: But the reward of the Hereafter is truly better for those who believe and are mindful of God.

src: ER trifft damit von Seinen Dienern, wen ER will.
ref: He makes it reach whomever He wills of His servants.
draft: He thus meets whom He wills of His servants.
hil: He meets whom He wills of His servants.
compare: He thus meets whom He wills of His servants.

src: Und Wir legten zwischen ihnen und den Städten, die Wir gesegnet haben, sichtbare Städte an.
ref: We placed other prominent towns between them, the towns that We had blessed and had set well-measured stages between them.
draft: And We placed visible cities between them and the cities We have blessed.
hil: And We placed visible cities between them and the cities We have blessed.
compare: And We placed visible cities between them and the cities We have blessed.

src: Wahrlich, Allah ist über alle Dinge Allwissend.
ref: Verily God has knowledge of everything.
draft: Truly, Allah is All-Knowing of all things.
hil: Truly, God is All-Knowing of everything.
compare: Truly, Allah is All-Knowing of all things.

src: Ha Mim.
ref: HA MIM.
draft: Ha Mim.
hil: Ha Mim.
compare: Ha Mim.

src: Die Engel und Gabriel steigen zu Ihm auf in einem Tage, dessen Ausmaß fünfzigtausend Jahre beträgt.
ref: To whom the angels and the soul take a day to ascend, whose length is fifty thousand years.
draft: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day, the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
hil: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day, the measure of which is fifty thousand years.
compare: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day, the extent of which is fifty thousand years.

src: Seine Leute kamen eilig zu ihm getrieben. Zuvor pflegten sie böse Taten zu begehen.
ref: And his people came to him, running towards him; and erstwhile they had been doing evil deeds.
draft: His people came rushing to him. Previously, they used to commit evil deeds.
hil: His people came rushing to him impelled. Previously, they used to commit evil deeds.
compare: His people came rushing to him. Previously, they used to commit evil deeds.

src: Und manche von ihnen bezichtigen dich (ungerechter Verteilung) der Sadaqa. Doch würde ihnen davon etwas gegeben, wären sie zufrieden. Aber wenn ihnen davon nichts gegeben wird, so sind sie wütend.
ref: And among them is one who slanders you regarding the distribution of charity; so if they receive some of it they would be happy – and if not, thereupon they get displeased!
draft: And some of them accuse you (of unfair distribution) of the Sadaqa. But if something is given to them, they are satisfied. But if nothing is given to them, they are angry.
hil: And some of them accuse you of unfair distribution of alms. But if something is given to them, they are satisfied. But if nothing is given to them, they are angry.
compare: And some of them accuse you of unfair distribution of alms. But if something is given to them, they are satisfied. But if nothing is given to them, they are angry.

src: Und (erinnere daran), als Musa für seine Leute um Wasser bat, dann sagten WIR: "Schlage mit deinem Stock an den Felsen!" Dann entsprangen daraus zwölf Quellen, bereits kennt jede Gruppe ihre Trinkstelle. Esst und trinkt von ALLAHs Rizq und übertreibt nicht auf Erden als Verderben-Anrichtende!
ref: And when Moosa asked for water for his people, We said, “Strike this rock with your staff”; thereupon twelve springs gushed forth from it; each group recognised its drinking-place; “Eat and drink from what Allah has provided, and do not roam about the earth making turmoil in it.”
draft: And (remember) when Musa asked for water for his people, then WE said, "Strike the rock with your staff!" Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, so that each group knew their drinking place. Eat and drink from ALLAH's Rizq and do not exceed on the earth as corrupters!
hil: And remember when Musa asked for water for his people and We said, 'Strike the rock with your staff!' Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, so that each group knew their drinking place. Eat and enjoy God's gifts and spread no discord in the land.
compare: And remember when Musa asked for water for his people and We said, 'Strike the rock with your staff!' Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, so that each group knew their drinking place. Eat and enjoy God's gifts and spread no discord in the land.

src: Und esst und trinkt, bis für euch der weiße Faden (der Dämmerung) vom schwarzen Faden (der Nacht) unterscheidbar wird, dann vollendet das Siyam bis zur Nacht! Und werdet nicht intim mit ihnen, während ihr I'tikaf in den Moscheen vollzieht.
ref: And eat and drink, until the white thread shows clearly to you from the black thread at the dawn; then complete the Fast unto the night, and do not lie with them while you cleave to the mosques.
draft: And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinguishable to you from the black thread of night, then complete Siyam until the night! And do not be intimate with them while you are performing I'tikaf in the mosques.
hil: And eat and drink until you can distinguish the white thread of dawn from the black thread of night, then complete Siyam until the night! And do not be intimate with them while you perform I'tikaf in the mosques.
compare: And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinguishable to you from the black thread of night, then complete Siyam until the night! And do not be intimate with them while you are performing I'tikaf in the mosques.

src: So verinnerlicht den Iman an ALLAH und an Seine Gesandten.
ref: So have faith in Allah and His apostles, and do not say, ‘[God is] a trinity.’
draft: "So internalize the belief in Allah and His messengers."
hil: Internalize the faith in Allah and His messengers.
compare: "So internalize the belief in Allah and His messengers."

src: Also esset von dem, was sie für euch fangen, und sprecht Allahs Namen darüber aus.
ref: So eat from what they catch for you, and pronounce God’s name over it.
draft: Also eat from what they catch for you, and mention Allah's name upon it.
hil: Eat from what they catch for you, and pronounce Allah's name over it; and fear Allah, for Allah is swift in reckoning.
compare: Also eat from what they catch for you, and mention Allah's name upon it.

src: Und sie eilen dann zum Weg um die Wette, aber wie könnten sie da sehen?
ref: Then they would have raced along to cross the Bridge but how could they have seen (their way)?
draft: And then they rush to the path as if in a race, but how could they see there?
hil: And then they rush to the path as if in a race, but how could they see there?
compare: And then they rush to the path as if in a race, but how could they see there?

src: Gewiß, ER ist Seinen Dienern gegenüber allkundig, allsehend.
ref: He is all-aware and all-seeing.
draft: Certainly, HE is omniscient, all-seeing towards His servants.
hil: Verily, HE is all-knowing, all-seeing towards His servants.
compare: Certainly, HE is omniscient, all-seeing towards His servants.

src: Sie geben einander zum Trug prunkende Rede ein und hätte es dein Herr gewollt, hätten sie es nicht getan; so überlaß sie sich selbst mit dem, was sie erdichten.
ref: But if your Lord had willed they would not have done so. Pay no attention to them and to what they fabricate.
draft: They give each other deceitful, pompous speeches, and had your lord wanted it, they would not have done it; so let them indulge in what they invent.
hil: They give each other deceitful and pompous speeches; and had your Lord wanted it, they would not have done it. Therefore, let them indulge in what they invent.
compare: They give each other deceitful, pompous speeches, and had your lord wanted it, they would not have done it; so let them indulge in what they invent.

src: Das Gebäude, das sie errichtet haben, wird nicht aufhören, Zweifel in ihren Herzen zu errregen, bis ihre Herzen in Stücke gerissen sind. Und Allah ist Allwissend, Allweise.
ref: The edifice they have built will always fill their minds with perturbation (which will not cease) till their hearts are rent to pieces, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.
draft: The building they have constructed will not cease to raise doubts in their hearts until their hearts are torn apart. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
hil: The building they have constructed will not cease to raise doubts in their hearts until their hearts are torn apart. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
compare: The building they have constructed will not cease to raise doubts in their hearts until their hearts are torn apart. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

src: Und gehöre nicht zu den Unachtsamen!
ref: Be not thou among the heedless.
draft: And do not be among the careless!
hil: And do not be one of the inattentive (ones).
compare: And do not be one of the inattentive (ones).

src: Das ist Allahs Anordnung, die Er zu euch (als Offenbarung) herabgesandt hat.
ref: This is the commandment of God that is sent down to you.
draft: This is Allah's commandment that He has revealed to you.
hil: This is Allah's commandment that He has revealed to you.
compare: This is Allah's commandment that He has revealed to you.

src: Dann ist es an jenem Tag ein schwerer Tag,
ref: It will be a day of distress,
draft: Then on that day, it is a difficult day.
hil: Then on that day, it will be a heavy day.
compare: Then on that day, it will be a heavy day.

src: So wartet ab! Ich gehöre mit euch zu den Abwartenden."
ref: So wait (for what is to come), I am waiting with you."
draft: "So just wait! I belong with you to the waiters."
hil: Just wait! I am also one of the waiters with you.
compare: Just wait! I am also one of the waiters with you.

src: Um damit Korn und Pflanzen hervorzubringen
ref: That We may produce from it grain and vegetation,
draft: To produce grain and plants with it.
hil: To bring forth grain and plants with it.
compare: To bring forth grain and plants with it.

src: Gewiß, das Gebet hält davon ab, das Schändliche und das Verwerfliche (zu tun). Und das Gedenken Allahs ist wahrlich größer.
ref: Surely prayer keeps you away from the obscene and detestable, but the remembrance of God is greater far; and God knows what you do.
draft: Certainly, prayer prevents one from doing shameful and reprehensible things. And the remembrance of Allah is truly greater.
hil: Certainly, prayer prevents one from doing shameful and reprehensible things. And the remembrance of Allah is truly greater.
compare: Certainly, prayer prevents one from doing shameful and reprehensible things. And the remembrance of Allah is truly greater.

src: O die ihr glaubt, nehmt nicht die Ungläubigen anstatt der Gläubigen zu Schutzherren!
ref: O believers, do not hold unbelievers as friends in preference to the faithful.
draft: O you who believe, do not take the disbelievers as protectors instead of the believers!
hil: O you who believe, do not take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers!
compare: O you who believe, do not take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers!

src: Sind beide im Gleichnis etwa gleich?!
ref: Can they be equal?
draft: Are both equal in the parable?!
hil: Are both equal in the parable?
compare: Are both equal in the parable?!

src: Er aber gab (dir) Macht über sie; und Allah ist Allwissend, Allweise.
ref: So He gave you mastery over them, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.
draft: He gave you power over them; and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
hil: He gave (you) power over them; and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
compare: He gave you power over them; and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

src: Es ist wie mit den Leuten des Pharao und denen, die vor ihnen lebten: Sie erklärten die Zeichen ihres Herrn für Lüge, so ließen Wir sie für ihre Sünden verderben, und Wir ließen die Leute des Pharao ertrinken.
ref: Their case is like that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them: they rejected the signs of their Lord as false and so We destroyed them for their sins, and caused the people of Pharaoh to drown.
draft: It is like with the people of Pharaoh and those who lived before them: they rejected the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned Pharaoh's people.
hil: It is like with the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They rejected their Lord's signs, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned Pharaoh's people.
compare: It is like with the people of Pharaoh and those who lived before them: they rejected the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned Pharaoh's people.

src: Der alles gut gemacht hat, was Er erschuf. Und Er begann die Schöpfung des Menschen aus Ton.
ref: Who made all things He created excellent; and first fashioned man from clay,
draft: He who created everything well, began the creation of man from clay.
hil: He who created all things well, began the creation of mankind from clay.
compare: He who created all things well, began the creation of mankind from clay.

src: Keineswegs haben sie ALLAH verherrlicht, wie es Ihm gebührt, als sie sagten: "ALLAH hat keinem Menschen irgend etwas hinabgesandt." Sag: "Wer hat denn die Schrift hinabgesandt, mit der Musa als Licht und als Rechtleitung für die Menschen kam?
ref: And they (the Jews) did not realise (or appreciate) the importance of Allah as was required when they said, “Allah has not sent down anything upon any human being”; say, “Who has sent down the Book which Moosa brought, a light and guidance for mankind, which you have divided into different papers, some which you show and hide most of them?
draft: They did not glorify Allah as He deserves when they said, "Allah has not sent down anything to any human being." Say, "Who then sent down the Book that Moses brought as a light and guidance for people?"
hil: They did not glorify Allah as He deserves when they said, "Allah has not sent down anything to any human being." Say, "Who then sent down the Book that Moses brought as a light and guidance for people?"
compare: They did not glorify Allah as He deserves when they said, "Allah has not sent down anything to any human being." Say, "Who then sent down the Book that Moses brought as a light and guidance for people?"

src: Dann bringe uns, was du uns androhst, solltest du von den Wahrhaftigen sein."
ref: Then bring upon us what you predict for us, if you are a man of truth."
draft: "Then bring us what you have threatened us with, if you are one of the truthful."
hil: Then bring us what you threatened us with, if you are among the truthful.
compare: "Then bring us what you have threatened us with, if you are one of the truthful."

src: Die Zahl der Monate bei Gott ist zwölf Monate, im Buch Gottes festgestellt am Tag, da Er die Himmel und die Erde erschaffen hat. Vier davon sind heilig. Das ist die richtige Religion. So tut euch selbst in ihnen kein Unrecht. Und kämpft gegen die Polytheisten allesamt, wie sie gegen euch allesamt kämpfen. Und wißt, Gott ist mit den Gottesfürchtigen.
ref: Indeed the number of months before Allah is twelve – in the Book of Allah – since the day He created the heavens and the earth, of which four are sacred; this the straight religion; so do not wrong yourselves in those months; and constantly fight against the polytheists as they constantly fight against you; and know well that Allah is with the pious.
draft: The number of months with God is twelve months, as recorded in the Book of God on the day He created the heavens and the earth. Four of them are sacred. This is the correct religion, so do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight against the idolaters all together as they fight against you all together. And know that God is with the righteous.
hil: The number of months with Allah is twelve months by Allah's ordinance, in the day that He created the heavens and the earth. Four of them are sacred. This is the correct religion, so do not commit injustice against your souls during the sacred months but fight all the pagans just as they fight against all of you, and know that Allah is with the righteous.
compare: The number of months with Allah is twelve months by Allah's ordinance, in the day that He created the heavens and the earth. Four of them are sacred. This is the correct religion, so do not commit injustice against your souls during the sacred months but fight all the pagans just as they fight against all of you, and know that Allah is with the righteous.

src: Doch ihr seid keineswegs dessen Aufbewahrer.
ref: It is not ye who are the holders of the store thereof.
draft: But you are by no means its custodians.
hil: You, however, are by no means their custodians.
compare: You, however, are by no means their custodians.

src: Darin liegen Zeichen für die Leute, die Verstand haben.
ref: Verily there are signs in this for men of understanding.
draft: Therein lies a sign for people who have understanding.
hil: Therein are signs for people who have understanding.
compare: Therein lies a sign for people who have understanding.

src: Und Allah ist wahrlich All verzeihend und Allvergebend.
ref: But God is forbearing and forgiving.
draft: And Allah is truly All-forgiving and All-merciful.
hil: Assuredly Allah is forgiving and merciful.
compare: And Allah is truly All-forgiving and All-merciful.

src: Und niemand kann Uns voraus sein.
ref: And we are not to be outrun.
draft: And no one can be ahead of Us.
hil: And nobody can be ahead of Us.
compare: And no one can be ahead of Us.

src: Und ALLAH hat euch erschaffen, dann läßt ER euch sterben. Und manch einer von euch wird in das faselnde Alter zurückgesetzt, damit er nichts mehr weiß, nachdem er über Wissen verfügte.
ref: It is God who creates you, then makes you die; and some reach the age of dotage when they forget what they had known before.
draft: And ALLAH has created you, then He lets you die. And some of you are reset to babbling age so that they no longer know anything, even though they once had knowledge.
hil: And ALLAH created you, then He lets you die. And some of you are reset to babbling age so that they no longer know anything, even though they once had knowledge.
compare: And ALLAH has created you, then He lets you die. And some of you are reset to babbling age so that they no longer know anything, even though they once had knowledge.

src: Und erfüllt die (eingegangene) Verpflichtung. Gewiß, nach der (Erfüllung der) Verpflichtung wird gefragt werden.
ref: And fulfil the covenant; surely the covenant shall be questioned of.
draft: And fulfill the (undertaken) obligation. Indeed, the fulfillment of the obligation will be asked for.
hil: Fulfill the (undertaken) obligation. Surely, after the fulfillment of the obligation, one will be asked.
compare: And fulfill the (undertaken) obligation. Indeed, the fulfillment of the obligation will be asked for.

src: Und nehmt Zeugen, wenn ihr miteinander Handel treibt. Und weder dem Schreiber noch dem Zeugen soll Schaden zugefügt werden.
ref: Have witnesses to the deal, (and make sure) that the scribe or the witness is not harmed.
draft: "And take witnesses when you trade with each other. And neither the scribe nor the witness should be harmed."
hil: Take witnesses when you do business with each other. And neither the scribe nor the witness should be harmed.
compare: "And take witnesses when you trade with each other. And neither the scribe nor the witness should be harmed."

src: Dies sind wahrlich die Worte eines edlen Gesandten,
ref: That this is indeed the word of an honoured Messenger,
draft: These are truly the words of a noble messenger.
hil: These are truly the signs of Allah which We recite to you, (O Muhammad SAW), in accordance with the truth. They change the words from their places; they say, 'If given this, take it, but if not given this, then beware!' And whomsoever Allah wants to put in trial, you can do nothing for him against Allah. Allah will never leave the believers in the state in which you are until He separates the evil from the good; nor is Allah going to make you acquainted with the unseen, but Allah chooses of His apostles whom He pleases; therefore believe in Allah and His apostles; and if you believe and guard (against evil), then you shall have a great reward."
compare: These are truly the words of a noble messenger.

src: Haben sie denn nicht auf das geschaut, was vom Himmel und von der Erde vor ihnen und was hinter ihnen ist?
ref: Do they not see what is before them and what is behind them of the heavens and the earth?
draft: Have they not looked at what is before them from the sky and the earth, and what is behind them?
hil: Behold they not that which is before them and that which is behind them of the heaven and the earth?
compare: Behold they not that which is before them and that which is behind them of the heaven and the earth?

src: Als die Munafiq zu dir kamen, sagten sie: "Wir bezeugen, daß du doch ALLAHs Gesandter bist." Und ALLAH weiß, daß du doch Sein Gesandter bist. Und ALLAH bezeugt: "Gewiß, die Munafiq sind doch Lügner."
ref: When the hypocrites come in your presence (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) they say, “We testify that you surely are Allah’s Noble Messenger”; and Allah knows that you indeed are His Noble Messenger, and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are indeed liars.
draft: When the hypocrites come to you, they say,"We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah." Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed liars.
hil: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah." And Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed liars.
compare: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah." And Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed liars.

src: Bestimme für mich eine Aya!"
ref: Make a sign for me."
draft: "Determine a verse for me!"
hil: "Specify a verse for me!"
compare: "Determine a verse for me!"

src: Darin werden sie auf immer ewig weilen; und sie werden weder Freund noch Helfer finden.
ref: They will live in it for ever, and will find no saviour or helper.
draft: They will dwell there forever and ever; and they will find neither friend nor helper.
hil: They will abide therein forever, and they will find neither friend nor helper.
compare: They will dwell there forever and ever; and they will find neither friend nor helper.

src: Und die spenden, was sie spenden, während ihre Herzen sich (davor) ängstigen, daß sie zu ihrem Herrn zurückkehren werden,
ref: Who give whatsoever they give (in His way), and their hearts tremble with fear that they have to go back to their Lord,
draft: And they donate whatever they donate while their hearts are anxiously fearful that they will return to their Lord.
hil: And they donate whatever they donate while their hearts are fearful that they will return to their Lord.
compare: And they donate whatever they donate while their hearts are fearful that they will return to their Lord.

src: Und sie haben Allah andere als Seinesgleichen zur Seite gestellt, um (die Menschen) von Seinem Weg abirren zu lassen.
ref: They have appointed equals of God to mislead people from His path. Tell them: "Enjoy yourselves (so long as you may).
draft: And they have set up other gods beside Allah to lead (people) astray from His path.
hil: They have appointed equals of God to mislead people from His path.
compare: And they have set up other gods beside Allah to lead (people) astray from His path.

src: Fürwahr, ungläubig sind diejenigen, die sagen: "Gewiß, Allah ist al-Masih, der Sohn Maryams", wo doch al-Masih (selbst) gesagt hat: "O Kinder Isra'ils, dient Allah, meinem Herrn und eurem Herrn!"
ref: They are surely infidels who say: "God is the Christ, son of Mary." But the Christ had only said: "O children of Israel, worship God who is my Lord and your Lord."
draft: Truly, those who say "Indeed, Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary" are unbelievers, as the Messiah himself said, "O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord."
hil: Truly, those who say "Indeed, Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary" are unbelievers, as the Messiah himself said, "O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord!"
compare: Truly, those who say "Indeed, Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary" are unbelievers, as the Messiah himself said, "O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord."

src: Und wenn WIR wollten, hätten WIR sie mit ihresgleichen eingetauscht.
ref: And whenever We list, We can replace them with others like Unto them.
draft: And if we wanted to, we could have exchanged them with their own kind.
hil: If We willed, We could have exchanged them with their peers.
compare: If We willed, We could have exchanged them with their peers.

src: Wir begreifen nicht viel von dem, was du sagst - außerdem gewiß sehen wir, daß du doch unter uns ein Schwacher bist.
ref: We do not understand much of what you say, and we see you a weak (man, it is said that he was a blind man) among us.
draft: We do not understand much of what you say - moreover, we certainly see that you are a weak person among us.
hil: We do not understand much of what you say - moreover, we certainly see that you are a weak person among us.
compare: We do not understand much of what you say - moreover, we certainly see that you are a weak person among us.

src: Könnt niemanden gegen Ihn verführen,
ref: Can mislead anyone away from Him,
draft: Can't seduce anyone against Him.
hil: You cannot seduce anyone against Him.
compare: You cannot seduce anyone against Him.

src: Bestimmt ist für sie bei ihrem Herrn die Wohnstätte des Friedens. Er ist ihr Freund wegen dessen, was sie zu tun pflegten.
ref: For them is the abode of peace with their Lord and He is their Master – the result of their deeds.
draft: Surely, with their Lord is the home of peace, and He is their Protector because of what they used to do.
hil: Surely, the abode of peace is reserved for them with their Lord. He is their Friend because of what they used to do.
compare: Surely, the abode of peace is reserved for them with their Lord. He is their Friend because of what they used to do.

src: Und wer dem Gesandten widerspricht - nachdem ihm die Rechtleitung deutlich wurde, und einem anderen als dem Weg der Mumin folgt, den werden WIR das verantworten lassen, wofür er verantwortlich war, und dann werden WIR ihn in Dschahannam hineinwerfen lassen. Und erbärmlich ist dieses Werden.
ref: And he who opposes the Prophet even after the way has become clear to him, and follows a path other than the way of believers, We shall lead him to what he has chosen for himself, and shall take him to Hell: How evil a journey's end.
draft: And whoever contradicts the messenger - after guidance has been clearly conveyed to him, and follows other than the path of the believers - we will leave him in what he has chosen and drive him into Hell, and what an evil destination.
hil: And whoever contradicts the messenger, after the guidance has become clear to him and follows a way other than that of the believers, we will leave him to that which he has chosen and drive him into Hell, and what an evil destination.
compare: And whoever contradicts the messenger, after the guidance has become clear to him and follows a way other than that of the believers, we will leave him to that which he has chosen and drive him into Hell, and what an evil destination.

src: Als dein Herr Mose rief: «Geh zum Volk, das Unrecht tut,
ref: When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people,
draft: When your Lord called Moses, "Go to the people who do wrong,
hil: When your Lord called Moses he said, 'Go to the people who do wrong.'
compare: When your Lord called Moses he said, 'Go to the people who do wrong.'

src: Dennoch gibt es unter euch welche, die nur auf sie hören. Und Gott weiß über die Bescheid, die Unrecht tun.
ref: They have some spies among you, and Allah knows best the wrongdoers.
draft: Nevertheless, among you are those who only listen to them. And God knows about those who do wrong.
hil: And yet among you are those who only listen to them, and God knows about those who do wrong.
compare: And yet among you are those who only listen to them, and God knows about those who do wrong.

src: Und damit Staub aufwirbeln,
ref: Raising clouds of dust,
draft: And raise dust.
hil: And thus raise dust.
compare: And raise dust.

src: Und nehmt zwei gerechte Leute von euch zu Zeugen, und erhaltet das Zeugnis Gottes aufrecht.
ref: And call in to witness two men of equity from among yourselves; and perform the witnessing to God Himself.
draft: And take two just people from your midst as witnesses and keep the testimony of God upright.
hil: Take two just people from among you as witnesses and maintain the testimony of God.
compare: And take two just people from your midst as witnesses and keep the testimony of God upright.
